content: It's a really good app, featuring all kinds of music, from old to recent and every genre. I really like it. But the thing is when one hasn't subscribed to the premium features, he's deprived of many choices. That's understandable, but then part of the restrictions is that there's a limit to how many times you can choose a song from your library in a day. Another thing, the app tends to play or switch to songs that are not in my catalog while I'm playing a song stored there. it's infuriating.

I LOVE Spotify, and as a user since circa 2013, I like to think I'm think I'm an early adopter and have a lot of experience with the app. That said, the last 6 months it's gone drastically downhill. The app constantly closes with no crash report, it just stops playing and it closes. Sometimes it's playing and the app is not even showing as open, which is fun. Sometimes, it's choppy and that may be a service issue but it's only been happening the last few months. Not sure what's going on!

Spotify Premium is one of the few subscription services I actually consider worth the money. We use it not just daily but for several hours a day every single day. I play music in the kitchen at work. We turn it on the TV at home. We play it through the car. Hours of use a day. And their customer service is actually great. Once my account got hacked and I planned to just delete the whole thing and start over. I was devastated. They were able to recover it for me and fix my account. Awesome!

I love spotify! It's super easy. I will say that it's not good unless you have premium though. My my first request is that a long time ago on desktop you could see when the song was added on collaborative playlists, and that has been removed, could you add that back? The next request is that on collaborative playlists, the collaborators should be able to edit the playlist cover and order of the songs. That's is, great app!

i got the family premium plan while it was on sale so with pricing id say i got pretty lucky. the quality of spotify is amazing, especially with the ability to adjust quality and volume playback within the app. the amount of features you get within spotify for free, like spotify wrapped and other limited - time events ( playlist in a bottle, the fortune telling one, etc. ) are super fun and add to the app. i have no negatives for spotify other than bringing back playlist in a bottle !

I absolutely love Spotify, there's not a whole ton of ads for me and I can still listen for free. I like the Spotify wrapped feature at the end of the year and I love the fact you can see your top songs and artists. Also the mixes are just amazing that they make including all my favorite songs and a few new and suggested ones!

I have been using Spotify for years and have been a premium member pretty much the whole time. For the price, it's totally worth it. I use it for music in my car, music for cleaning the house, music for sleep, asmr for sleep, podcasts, music for my toddler, or just music for lounging around the house. I was in the top 2% of Spotify users a couple years in a row. Saying I use this app all the time is an understatement. It's really good at creating playlists specifically tailored to me.

The limited number of commercials and the inclusion of video has made this platform a fantastic alternative to YouTube for me while I am at work. I heavily recommend it since it is very user friendly for my phone especially when I just want to listen to my favorite casters and sometimes being able to watch them when I have the ability to do so.

I've been using the free version for quite some time for podcasts. I'm happy with the quality & updates. Only issue I've ever had an with it was recent (episodes shuffling while shuffle is off) It's fixed promptly. I'm planning for premium. It'll come in handy listening to downloaded episodes offline while travelling.

On my device, it's awesome. I use this everyday, everywhere and always, for over 50,000 minutes. Other than the ads (which aren't too annoying once, again, on my device) it's pretty much perfect. I just don't enjoy how some songs are unavailable because of regions, but it's not a big issue since the mainstream is there as well as a lot of underground. There's not much to complain about, since I use the free version. So far, i say this is great.

üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü Best music app ever! üé∂üíö Spotify is my favourite app for listening to music anytime, anywhere! It has millions of songs, playlists, podcasts, and moods ‚Äî whether I‚Äôm studying, chilling, dancing, or feeling low, there‚Äôs always something perfect to play üéßüéµüíÉ. The sound quality is amazing, and I love how it recommends songs based on my mood and taste üòç‚ú®. The UI is clean, easy to use, and the dark theme looks so cool üåôüñ§. Yes, ads come in the free version, but it's still worth it.

Spotify is my go-to music streaming app! I love the vast library of songs, playlists, and podcasts. Discover Weekly and Release Radar are my favorite features - they always introduce me to new artists and tracks. The app is user-friendly, and I appreciate the ability to create playlists and share music with friends.

Spotify is the most amazing app that I have ever downloaded, it has like every single song that exists, and offers most songs in different languages (if u don't speak English). The only thing that I would like them 2 improve is the lyrics and time sinking them. They r most likely 2 fix it if you report it, and when u do it takes like 1-2 weeks to be fixed. But this app does not only have music it has podcasts, a DJ that makes playlist for you, episodes of craters strate from YouTube and more

Amazing app on all aspects. Huge collection of data, songs and artists of various styles of music and in different languages. Originality and richness of playlists based on your favorite artists and taste of music, sound quality and many many other good options. I actually tried different apps like Anghami and that was a very bad experience, believe me Spotify is far better in every way, even what you get with the free version is enjoyable and might be sufficient for many.

Music is EVERYTHING. It makes me calm, relaxed, and just be in my little small world! I love how I get to do my playlist!! I would use this everywhere I go. In my car, my room, outside, in school, in stores, when I'm bored, when I feel happy/sad, I just love this so much and I'm being so fr! Literally all the songs one needs/knows. The same goes for the podcasts! EVERYTHING is on Spotify with entertaining playlists made by so many people! It is easy and fun to use!! Best app for music/podcasts!!

Update - Really enjoying Spotify, seems more stable, audio books are a big plus. *Feature request* in android auto you cannot see the full title of the song playing. Can the title be made to scroll/ticker tape. I have the title showing on the main screen and also in the driver's console but both are static and only show the first few words.
replyContent: Hey! We're sorry to hear this. We're open to feedback, and we‚Äôd like to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

content: It's the only music app where I'm WILLING to pay for the subscription. I've seen people complain about the recommendations, but they're generally pretty on point for me, so I've built up a massive collection of music, and theres something for every mood! It's helped me through so much this year. I'm also so grateful for the student discount! Thank you to the people at Spotify for making my past several years that much more enjoyable!

I love all the different playlists on here,, they let me explore different genres and often I find music I haven't listened to in years! I also like that if I want to just listen to an artist, or an album, I can do that too! I haven't been at a loss for good music since I started using this app!

A very large audio library providing good automated daily risk and recommendations. I have tested it in hip hop and it is the same as tidal, but it is better in podcasts is those are not existing in tidal, and apart from hip hop probably it's a bit better as title started with hip hop. However this case podcasts and maybe more with regards to other music genres. Spotify is a very good music App!

Spotify is the ultimate music streaming platform with an extensive library of songs, curated playlists, and podcasts. The personalized recommendations and cross-device syncing create a seamless listening experience. With features like offline downloads and high-quality audio, it's perfect for music lovers everywhere.

I have been a user of Spotify for many years and I thank God for this platform. Its vast collection of Christian songs, ranging from timeless hymns to contemporary Christian music, is truly impressive. The sound quality is really good. I pray that Spotify will continue to make wholesome music available so that more people, especially the younger generations, will come to know the Saviour. God bless!

A fantastic app with play lists based on my "likes" or I can create my own. I've now got music for every mood. The sound is clear and there's loads of variety. I love it!! ‚ù§ Edit 23/9/25 I was asked for another review. These days, I only listen to barely audible background music. But I know that Spotify has the most comprehensive range of music, radio & podcasts, and I wouldn't use any other app. Shoutout to them for allowing me to stay free for around 5 yrs with only a few ads.

Spotify is awesome for music and podcasts. You can stream almost any song, make your own playlists, or let the app recommend music based on what you like. The sound quality is solid, and it works across all your devices. The free version has ads, but Premium makes it ad-free and lets you download tracks. Overall, it‚Äôs super convenient for discovering and enjoying music anywhere.

I love Spotify and happily pay the individual membership each month to keep listening without EXTREMLY loud adds that don't wait that 30 minutes or whatever it promises (I've timed that, multiple times. always got an add before 27 mins passed), but I've been premium for so long I don't care anymore lol. I love how you can turn someone else's playlist into your own (good start-up), and I love that you can put emojis and use fancy text in the titles and descriptions.

After losing close to 100 playlists without notice or explanation. I had enough. This was after 12+ years of patronage. My son encouraged me to check out Spotify. I'm not even a month into a 90 trial and couldn't be happier. Like many, with me, music almost comes before food. With the current climate these days, Spotify makes sure you'll have what you need to get you through those tough days.

I love Spotify so much, it is super easy to use and you can listen to all types of music for free. I think the app is the best but there is a lot of ads now for me, I think it was a glitch or something because once I got a ad after every song for an hour. But then it stopped, I'm not sure what happened with the app but other then that it is a really good app.

In my opinion,Hands down the best app for music there is, No question that if you try to "measure it up" per say, by trying to see if you can come up with a song that they dont have.. Well pack a lunch, because you may not even be able to do that, what my main point is, is that you surly wont be able to come up with anything in your first one or two picks or even handful or so of picks like most apps... And the premium version is definitely worth it, the new A. I. Inspired DJ is AMAZING to!

Best music streaming platform. Song recommendations are better than Apple music, even the yearly wrapped is significant better than Apple's. Very affordable on top of that, especially for students, such as I. Even when you don't have money in your debit account it doesn't suspend your premium subscription, instead it waits until you can pay. Been using it for 4 consecutive years, after coming from Apple music, and I still recommend Spotify til today

Spotify is the shiznizzle skipskap. with the premium subscription, of course. I pay for the family subscription. I like how you can add 6 people and everyone is able to open their own individual accounts. worth every penny. although, sometimes I feel like the dj has been sleepin on me because he'll randomly go into music genres that are the exact opposite of my taste. but it's easy to get him back on track.

Thank you for letting us to search and play any song on free tier. The problem with premium is the price! That offer for 3 month premium at price of 1 month was pretty good value! More people would have premium if the price was actually good... Right now is very expensive! People can get songs to mp3 and listen locally easily, so why paying so high for a membership just to listen music from time to time... Drop the price at half and everyone will pay for sure.

I have Spotify Premium, so I have access to everything with almost no problem. I say "almost" because it glitches sometimes, like when I want to watch a Spotify Short or whatever you call it. Also I block the songs with explicit content, but then it lets me listen to certain cuss words??? Please fix this. Just because you are okay with certain ones doesnt mean I am. At least give a personalized choice. But otherwise great app. Spotify Wrapped just tops it all off. Wonderful job.

This app is amazing but I'd like to request something. I think it would be awesome if the app has a timer sort of thing like when you're about to sleep and you want to listen to music but you want the music to stop in like 15 to 20 minutes so that when you fall asleep the music has already stopped and your phone got to rest. That's all thanks i hope this will be heard.

Spotify is my go-to app for music, podcasts, and everything in between. The sound quality is excellent, the interface is user-friendly, and the recommendation algorithm always seems to get my mood just right. What I love most is the ability to create and share playlists, discover new artists, and enjoy both trending hits and hidden gems. From workouts to relaxation, there‚Äôs always a soundtrack for every moment.

My experience??...... SATISFYING!! I'm a free version user and I get to pause and skip to next song (although the skip to next song DOES have a limit, I assure you it's not 6skip per hour or whatever). Everything is perfect for a free version user; it doesn't consume data and you could almost do everything a paid user can. But there are ad interruptions only after a song is done playing. The only thing I would've appreciated is if you could view the lyrics to every song.... whenever. I recommend

Spotify is where it's at, man. Even the free version is better than the competition, but this service is actually worth the monthly price for premium. It's so much better than YouTube Music or Pandora, in my humble opinion. While it may be missing some of the live performances/versions of songs that YouTube Music has, YTM has gotten so intrusive with ads that it's left a bad taste in my mouth. Spotify is so much better, and the developers have done a fantastic job with the app itself. Kudos! A+

Easy to use, although I don't like that when I want to add a song it automatically adds it to my likes and likes it as it was before yk, like, Add the songs but make it easier to add them . On my tablet, you can't see the lyrics if it's in horizontal, I don't like it... everything else is fine I guess

This is an updated review written after Spotify's latest updates. After Spotify reduced the ads as well as making it a feature to be able to click on a specific song and listen to it right away instead of listening to 5 different songs by the same artist, I have been enjoying the free experience alot more. It's very similar to the Free PC experience as well, which is a plus. Thanks for making music more accessible Spotify!

So far so good, no stupid forced ai usage, no ID verification just to listen to music where I'm at *yet* and premium is truly worth it. the audio quality is astounding, background usage PC wise isn't bad either if you got an alright computer. I love that you're able to use your phone like a wireless controller, making switching screens not needed and picking songs speedy when in important matches and wanting good beats to jam with

I have used just about all the most popular music apps. I've played the free settings for years, and the free version has access to all music, and most podcasts are available, also fewer advertisements than many of the paid music apps. Really, after years, I might be upgrading to the paid settings for the unlimited skips and unlimited music downloads for the ability to play my music selection when the internet isn't available. Upgrading is damn cheaper than buying music. üíØ ü§üüëÅüëÉüëÅüëçüç∫

It's great,it's free to play,but can annoying keep playing the same song and same ads over and over again.my daughter has the free version, I ts worse now than when I had it, it plays the same song has you pick,I pay now, it's great no ads but sometimes I get repeat songs sometimes,podcasts are great,now books I can listen to the latest books,but unlike the music and podcasts ,the books are limited to so many hours, you have to pay ¬£9:99. which unfair. At least it's cheaper than others.

I like this app, been using it for a couple years. There's many artists here on this app I love and love listening to. But my problem is most definitely the amount of ads. I do enjoy this music platform, but the ads get obnoxious sometimes especially with the amount of them and the length of them. One or two in a row every ten or so songs I can handle, but just about around four max is irritating. Paying for premium is something that I will do to rid of them. It isn't too expensive which I like

I am so glad, they finally let non-premium users, pick any song without having to listen through your whole playlist to listen to a specific song. Before this change, I was very frustrated, not being able to pick a specific song. I'm happy with the changes,100% recommend Spotify!!! ü§å

I've had the free version for at least 3 years now. Of course, im getting the ad's, but they've been very cool about proportionality: the right amount of song s to the amount of commercials. I've freeloaded for a long time and am going to start paying for Spotify and make it part of my budget.

Welp, they did it. Spotify finally gave the regular people like me what they want, that being control over their music. the new update lets you directly pick which song you want. which is what changed my point of view of this entire app. in fact, this makes the adds the app throws at you slightly tolerable. I really hope it stays like this

Spotify is soooooo amazing because it has music for literally every mood and moment. I like how you can make your own playlists or listen to the ones they suggest. The app is easy to use, and it even has podcasts, which makes it extra fun. It‚Äôs perfect for chilling, studying, or just vibing with friends. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

I mean, I have never had premium because I don't really need to be even more broker than I already am. Since I have the free version, I'm used to having ads, and I get you need ads for money and stuff, but can you guys at least not lie about the 30-minute "uninterrupted" listening time for music. it's more like 10 if im lucky, but I guess that's what we get for only the free version. Other than that, it's a really good app to listen to the music I want. I would pick Spotify over Pandora anyday.

I've been using Spotify for a while now, and it's hands down one of the best streaming platforms out there. The user interface is easy to navigate, whether you're on your phone, desktop or smart device. The ability to download music for offline listening, create and share playlists and switch between devices makes the experience super convenient. Spotify Wrapped at the end of the year is always a fun bonusüòçüòçüòç

Spotify has been my go-to music app for years. The sheer variety of music and podcasts is amazing‚ÄîI can always find exactly what I'm in the mood for, whether it's a new release or a deep cut from my favorite artist. The personalized playlists like Discover Weekly and Daily Mixes are incredibly accurate and have introduced me to so many new artists I love. The app is fast, easy to use, and the sound quality is fantastic. Highly recommended for any music lover!

I think this is the best music app out there,I tried it after using YouTube music and they're both good but personally speaking Spotify provides top notch experience. Although I listen to gospel music,they provided me with the best playlist for my choice of songs. And a quick one though,I couldn't find my offline playlists after the recent update,I hope this gets fixed real soon.

strong music discovery features, social sharing options, and the ability to integrate podcasts and audiobooks into one platform. Its personalized playlists, like "Discover Weekly" and "Release Radar," are particularly effective at introducing users to new music. The platform's social features, such as the ability to follow friends and blend playlists, also make it a popular choice for those who enjoy sharing their musical tastes.

I spend so much time listening to music, and especially when I am doing a task. But lately Spotify has been BUNS. Like random crashes and stuff, and then if u want the feature that's let's you choose a song to pick, which shouldn't be for money, but it is. ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

I was satisfied with desktop app, so I subscribed to premium to get the 
same experience on phone. Well, now I keep looking at empty or loading 
screens all the time, while on full signal WiFi/3G. After several tens of 
seconds of nothing, I just go for mp3s instead. Really, it can take minutes 
to get choosen song to play. Unsubscribing, going free desktop only. While 
I didn't like Google Play Music for different reasons, at least it was 
always snappy.

‚ÄãI love Spotify. As a music lover, I've spent hours exploring artists, but what makes it special is how personal the experience feels. I've created two playlists of Ilaiyaraaja songs that are truly awesome. I love that one can find the obscure, tiny, forgotten bands on Spotify. I'm so glad I started the Premium service bc I can download my playlists and have them ALWAYS, with or without internet. I rave about this app o anyone who will listen lol! Give it a go! I have premium but even the free service is better than any around! Plus they now have Spotify duo which allows you and someone in the same house to have 2 separate accounts for 3 bucks more than premium. I'll stay with Spotify always

My automatic go to for music! Has all the up to date music for all the artists I listen to. I have been with Spotify for 26 years, I don't use any other app. I like that it can play non-stop music, I start it off with one song and it continues playing similar songs and artists. When I tire of music, I have the option of podcasts. Spotify notifies me of new releases from the artists I follow. I can add all my favorite songs to a saved list. Playlists can also be shared between users.

I love this app, I won't listen to music anywhere else, but an idea, not a criticism just an idea for Spotify, to have a background mode where you can keep the app open and it shows a display of the song and album on a vynl record,cd player, ect, kinda like MD vynl widget, but as a programmer i know that it wouldn't be to dificult to add that and would not be to hard or expensive to code, just an idea

I love Spotify. It has unlimited skips for music and podcasts. Based on the music you like to listen to it has a Smart Shuffle. which I love because it let's me hear new music from my favorite artist. You can play this app on your phone, computer, tablet or watch. It is a reasonable price for everything that you can do.

I have tried so many music apps and regardless of sound quality or monthly fee I find myself coming back to spotify. Why? The number one thing for me is super user friendly interface. Second, would be the personalization of my music.I like the fact I can collaborate my playlist and follow people. Thirdly it integrates so well with Alexa and waze. Did I mention the huge music library they have and newly audio feature. Podcasts as well. I guess all this makes the price worth it.

Great app and extremely recommended! I used to use YouTube Music and it was great until I saw I can't play it on different apps. I saw my dad using Spotify for his podcasts he listened to daily (using blue tooth) and I kept it away from me until last month. I finally tried it and I played the first song. Amazing audio and stuff! RECOMMENDED!

it is one of the best apps i've used to listen music, cause make me discover new music and new artists; the only one that I don't like is that you cannot skip ads on Spotify. But then is incredible even for listen podcasts currently I only use Spotify to listen podcasts. May God bless Spotify and its employees.

This app changed my life. As one that's heavily dependent on music for my daily dose of dopamine, I can categorically state that Spotify beats all other platforms hands down. I just need a bit of a tweak to the UI. Is it possible for y'all to add a short description of albums? That would go a long way. üôè

Spotify introduced me to online music streaming. It made listening so simple and you can binge on any of the old favourites as well as new releases within the app. Believe me when I say it, it has one of the top music algorithm and recommendations of any other competitors out there. Spotify really changed music for me.

I absolutely LOVE the recent addition of the ability for Spotify users on the free plan to play the exact song you want with one click instead of having to shuffle through songs and using up all of your six hourly skips before you even got to play the song you were looking for in the first place. This change has made my time spent using the app 1000√ó better. üôÇ

It finally happened y'all. Spotify listened to the people and now WITHOUT premium we can choose any song we want AND have unlimited skips!! ü•≥ Spotify was good before, but this is amazing!! I'm bumping up my review to ‚ú®FIVE STARS‚ú® for a few reasons. 1. Of course this new update! It's so so amazing. 2. The chat feature is so cool and really really nice. 3. I have all my music in one place that's easily customizable, looks pretty, AND is easily accessible. 5/5, Spotify is goat.

obviously it is the best app for music streaming and is pretty smooth the only sad part is that for non premium users it basically offers nothing more than playing random songs weather you like them or not but now the app has made it so that non premium users could play the song they select tho sadly you still cannot listen to albums in the right order and it only uses smart shuffle which is sad that it doesn't offer it and you have to pay to listen to albums in the righ order.

I've been using Spotify for almost 15 years, I started a premium subscription almost immediately after and never regretted it. Now 15 years later I have the duo subscription for my boyfriend and I and Spotify is always playing in the back at home. Couldn't be happier with this app! Bugs are super rare and if there're some they're fixed in a day or less. My only problem is that it's getting a bit more expensive every year but still worth it so far!

This is the best app on the Google Play Store. better than YouTube Music and Pandora by a country mile. the DJ is such a cool addition. I'm also absolutely LOVING the mix feature. just the cherry on top of such an already perfect app. I guess the only feedback I have is finding a way to make podcast comments more accessible for a more social experience.

Spotify is One of The Good Music Listening app but Its Good when you have a premium membership music quality Good, Various types of playlist and many More. but the free version is worst because it's shows many ads and You can't skip music without premium membership so I request to Spotify, that please change the price of membership plans and also add new membership plans, because 139 Rs for 1 month is very costly it's close to NETFLIX'S 1 month plan 150 Rs

i've used this app for years and I really appreciate all the extra fun features added in for users like the spotify wrapped at the end of the year, swipe and discover, fortune teller, and the new customizable transition mixes between tracks :) thanks for giving me so many ways to play around with the songs I love Spotify!

I have loved music for, literally, as long as I can remember. It is, has, and always will been that to which my heart beats, the lyrical expression to all that I feel. Spotify exemplifies "one stop shopping" for whatever my mood yearns, old school through new, and I will remain a forever fan forever, period.

Spotify isn‚Äôt just an app, it‚Äôs an entire vibe. üé∂ From trending hits to hidden gems, from podcasts to lo-fi midnight playlists, it has everything. The recommendations feel like it actually reads my mood, and the UI is smooth and easy. Premium makes it even better with offline downloads & no ads. Honestly, Spotify has become my daily soundtrack ‚Äì music, podcasts, emotions, all in one place. Best music experience ever! üåü

I have used almost all the music streaming services that are around and some that used to be around. I have very fond memories of using Nokia Music and it was a very good service. Apart from that, I can only feel similar with Spotify. I keep trying other platforms but keep coming back to Spotify.

I really like it. the only thing I'm not a huge fan about is all the ads. There is so many ads telling you to get the primium. Otherwise it is really great. its nice being able to do something else or be able to shut ur phone off with the music still going. I definitely recommend this to anybody wanting to try it!!

Great music Definitely recommend. Love the Spotify Wrapped at the end of the year. I don't like the new plus button I prefer the heart and separately add it to my playlist. Also please make the explicit filter so that everyone on a premium plan can manage their own account in full, the plan manager shouldn't have control over everyone's account. Spotify stop taking features people like away for no reason. I'm starting to hate you and will change unless you shape up.

incredible service with long time gains and easy to use ui it has the same bad subscription decay but they tend to try to fix it sometimes. but what makes it great is the amount of songs the lack of bs so g censorship and the loyalty to the music with multiple options to make the songs as close to the users and writers interpretation.

I had Spotify for years without premium just because it didn't bother me. I accidentally got premium one day and I never went back! Love the audiobook feature BUT it should definitely include limitless listening..after all it's premium. had to update my review because I can't get over how sick the new update is. there's a "mix" setting for your music which you can pick multiple options how you want to transition the next song. it's feels like a dj radio. OBSESSED. spotify wins again.

I changed my review to 5 stars. After the update I was unable to edit my playlists. I just figured out...if I press edit...then hold my finger on the song I want to move...then it moves. It's a different look...I'm just glad I can edit my playlists now.
replyContent: Hi. We're open to feedback, and we'd love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

content: Love the app. It helps me easily find new music through algorithms, make my own playlists, & save music on my phone to use when I don't have signal - all for a reasonable price.. Although it's a shame the artists get shafted on how much money per play.

Spotify is an amazing platform with a seamless user experience. The sound quality is excellent, the music library is vast, and the personalized playlists make discovering new songs effortless. It truly brings music closer to life, and I highly recommend it to anyone who loves music.

Thank you so much for allowing the free users to be able to actually choose the song. I was genuinely losing it without the beautiful algorithm that spotify has. It's the best way to find new songs, but that pay wall really just ruined everything. Thank you!

Good app, but really slow. I have good internet and can't find any updates needed. I advise you fix this issue. Anyhow a good app. Edit: I think it just updated and I do not like it. It won't let me search in albums anymore and the setup is very strange, still will use app since its still good but I do not like that.

it's okay. too many ads, it says ad free for 30 minutes and then 5 minutes later I get so many ads. It was better when they weren't trying to get so many ads in at once. Edit (9/25/25) LOVE THE NEW UPDATE!!! THANK YOU SM SPOTIFY ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è YOU LISTENED AND WE LOVE
replyContent: Hey! We hear you, and we'll pass your feedback along to the Ads team. Also, you might be able to find some steps to help with this on our Community. Just head to community.spotify.com and search for "30 mins of uninterrupted listening".

content: it's great I have premium so I get offline music which is great for snowboarding but the only con I have is the sort button they need to bring it back instead of going through a menu. -edit- Can you add an "add to" button to add a song to a single playlist on the song playing screen, I want the screen to disappear after I make my selection. I deal with the three-dots but this would be nice.

Absolutely better than any other music app with this new update. I used to prefer Spotify on desktop simply because I was able to choose the songs I was listening to and there were a tad bit less ads. But now due to the update I don't think I'll ever be using YouTube music again üòÅ

In all fairness I havent tried out other music players as such, but thats because I never felt the need to search for anything better. I have really liked spotify I was just going to take the Free 3 months offer but I'm fairly sure that I'm going to keep using it even after my 3 free months are over. I'm amazed at the selection of music and other audio. And finding the music I like has been incredibly easy.

It's an amazing app . 5 stars . I have the premium. I absolutely love Spotify. I am tired of listening to certain genres and remixes. Personally (and only personally and privately) controlled censorship of music when exploring songs. If this already exists, and im being silly, I apologize.

Not only am I enjoying the music, but I am revisiting music that I have forgotten about and discovering music and Artists and groups that I never knew existed...It has become a real enjoyable experience and learning...I love all genres of music and there is no shortage of it...I love how i can customize my play lists but also the ones thatvare suggested...Thanks Spotify...You sound great through my Bose soundlink revolve plus 2...yee haw...

Spotify has the music I like, and I don't have to worry about ads or personalities. I haven't tried an ebook yet, but I also enjoy the occasional podcast. There is a large (huge!) selection to choose from. I thoroughly enjoy this app.

I LOVE Spotify, and as a user since circa 2013, I like to think I'm think I'm an early adopter and have a lot of experience with the app. That said, the last 6 months it's gone drastically downhill The app constantly closes with no crash report, it just stops playing and it closes. Sometimes it's playing and the app is not even showing as open, which is fun. Sometimes, it's choppy and that may be a service issue but it's only been happening the ost few months. Not sure what's going on!

Spotify is the ultimate music streaming app. The library is massive, and the personalized playlists like "Discover Weekly" are always spot on. The interface is clean and easy to use, and I love being able to download music for offline listening. It's an essential app for any music lover.

I just wanted to say how much I love using Spotify! It makes discovering new music so effortless and enjoyable. I especially appreciate the personalized playlists like Discover Weekly‚Äîthey always seem to know exactly what I‚Äôm in the mood for. The user interface is super intuitive, and having everything synced across my devices is a total game-changer. Love this app. I can play so many songs and create many playlists. I have had this app since 2019 and I have enjoyed it both on Android and Apple. I am not sure why people are complaining about playback. Simple solution is download the songs or Playlists you enjoy the most. I do wish the automix did a better job mixing it up my playlists I have created otherwise I don't really see the difference than the regular mix shuffle.

At this point, I don't think there's anyone that doesn't use Spotify. I mean, it's simply the best music platform out there. you get albums, mixes recommendations mainstream underground basically all types of music at an affordable price. plus the small benefit of giving back to the artists. it's a win-win for everyone

Update 2: been months since I reinstalled and the problem hasn't reappeared. Thank you!Update: Reinstall worked perfectly, I appreciate the quick response from them. Brought my rating up a star, will bring it to five stars if the problem doesn't reappear.***Took two stars off because the app will do this thing where it won't let me play any specific songs from my liked playlist even though I have premium.
replyContent: Hey, we're sorry to hear this. A quick reinstall might do the trick. If that doesn't help, we recommend reaching out to our Customer Service team at http://support.spotify.com. Just search "Contact us", and they'll be happy to help.

content: Great but can we get a pop out player for podcasts. edit. thank you so much for the podcast pop out player. It's so much more convenient now. again, thank you Spotify programmers for including this. edit. pop up viewer gone, Google has no fix for this, need to fix or post how to fix

And also for the listeners to like the music I am playing like on a live stream where you can see the likes and comments

ok, tbh I wasn't really expecting much about Spotify, but damnnn it's so easy to use, and you can literally add any of your fav songs to listen, I mainly use spotify to have something to motivate me and stuff so I'm really happy to have this app, continue evolving Spotify, sending a lot of love to all the workersssüñ§üñ§üñ§

I highly recommend this app to anyone who loves listening to any types of podcast. Well made app, great experience, recommendations system is also great and lyrics translation is a great add and also If you buy the premium subscription there will be no issue(that free user complain about) what so ever. It's cheap or there are other options if you refer free service.

replyContent: Hi! If you're using the free service, you can listen to your favorite tunes, although there are some limitations. Smart Shuffle is enabled by default, which introduces new songs and keeps your queue lively. For full access, we suggest checking out our Premium plans at spotify.com/premium. If you haven't tried Premium, you might qualify for a trial.

content: I've been a loyal Spotify Premium subscriber for years now and love the app more each time I listen to the music available. Playlists are very easy to make and manage. Features like New Music availability and Spotify Playlists made just for me are only the beginning of what this app is great for! I'm able to take the app on the go with me in the car as well! Thank you Spotify for keeping me updated on both new music and old songs I've grown to love and listen to again!

I got fed up with the increasing number of glitches in my paid subscription to Amazon Music so I tried Spotify. Best decision ever. Still not sure if I'm going to switch to paying for premium - we'll see how annoying the ads are when my free trial runs out. But the premium is only a dollar more than Amazon was and it's a more user friendly app with more options.

7-8-2025: Y'all, what did you do to the widgets? I loved being able to see my recent playlists, but now only see "Open Song Radio" and I don't want to! Please change this back! Overall, I enjoy this app, I do wish there was a way to augment your plan to get more audiobook hours if you want them instead of paying for top ups! I've been a Premium member since having my first job, and love the audiobook addition, just wish there was a easier/cheaper way to get more hours!

I enjoy the creation of playlist, and the extra features Spotify offers on its platform my main and only issue is when being played in my vehicle through Bluetooth there's an ONGOING ISSUE with the signal dropping out completely; either using Spotify by itself and also when using the GPS.

I wish there was an option to listen to music you've physically never listened to before. - Podcasts are peppered with adverts (not ones recorders have added into audio, but that Spotify allows to be added). I now listen to podcasts elsewhere because of it.

anyone that has a complaint about this app should give more constructive criticism instead of negative rude comments as a lady that is disabled because of a car accident I have brain damage it is healing but slowly Spotify has been so easy for me to understand how to use and save music make my playlist that make me so happy when I'm having a really bad day I turned it on first thing in the morning and it's just awesome to have on TV my phone and the diversity I get so much out of it. Paid version is good 5*: Algorithms, connectivity, no ads. Free version is rather 3*: good as long as you can use it (too many ads, fake promises of 30 minutes ads free, only one song plays at a time).
replyContent: Sorry to hear that. We suggest getting in touch with our Customer Support team so they can investigate further. You can find them on X and Facebook (@SpotifyCares), or start a live messaging session with them at https://support.spotify.com/contact-spotify-anonymous/, and they'll be happy to help.

content: Easy to use!!!, but I like to the way where you can go to your Playlists/other people's Playlists/or ones made by Spotify itself where you can tap on a song when you browse through what songs are on that list listening to the best parts before that part plays now I can just listen to the music as if I had premium and choose it...but plays on shuffle...I'm good with shuffle buying rather listen to songs I browse through to see which ones fit in certain lists/etc small sample listens.

I love using Spotify their AI systems are State of the art in putting together Playlist specific to your personality and music you listen to by allowing the app to access your phone. I get a constant update everyday of music I've never heard of and the majority of them are right on when it comes to listening at the right moment for whatever is going on in your life. Plus you can share with friends, as well with others beyond creating a jam session.

Love the app to death but a few requests that I would love to see on the app: - When adding songs to queue, pressing "previous song" could play the song that was played and added into the queue and not simply skip and continue to the original playlist. Queue songs are great and would love to have the possibility to play it again if I forget to add it to queue again! - Option to "block" artists so that they would never come up in the playlist radio. Thank you!

For a long time, I thought Spotify was just 'fine,' you know? It gets the job done. But I recently started listening to audiobooks, and I had an 'aha!' moment. Instead of cutting you off the second your time is up, the app actually lets you finish the chapter. This simple, thoughtful feature prevents you from being cut off mid-sentence and shows a genuine understanding of how people use the app. It's the little things that matter, and this is a great one.
replyContent: Hey there! Can you try logging out > restarting the device > logging back in to see if it makes any difference? If it doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at http://support.spotify.com. Just search ‚ÄúContact Us‚Äù, and they'll be happy to help.

content: Spotify is the only way that I'll pay to listen to music, and I respect the prices. Although, Spotify, for the love of the universe, PLEASE go back to the old "edit" format, I hate it when I'm dragging a song to put it with the others of that album and it just stops if I go too far, and I also hate the fact that y'all also got rid of the scroll bar that was on the side. Other than that, I think that Spotify is a solid 5/5.

Music has become a part of my (almost) everyday life and I enjoy implementing it with Spotify! Thank you to the devs. for all your hard work constantly trying to improve the app. I enjoy creating Playlist's to suite my moods and activities, discovering new artists and genres, reading lyrics and finding a song that randomly popped in my head by entering a few lyrics in the Search bar. The "offline backup" is incredibly helpful and I'm really enjoying the "Smart Shuffle ".

I positively love Spotify!! I listen to it every single morning for several hours and become lost in the land of music. I still can't figure out how to keep it from repeating, though. Some days, it seems as though I'm hearing the same songs as yesterday, but I just go to a song I didn't hear and play it! I highly recommend this app for music lovers!!

I love the features that Spotify Premium has to offer. Great app. Would recommend for daily use and has great clarity of the music. If u take the subscription, it is great but without it also it's a great app. This is way better than apple music. replyContent: Hi. Have you tried a quick reinstall? If that doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Just search ‚ÄúContact Us‚Äù, and they'll be happy to help.

content: I‚Äôve been using Spotify for over a year and love its wide variety of songs, playlists, and features. It‚Äôs easy to find music for any mood, and the app is smooth to use. Spotify has always been my go-to app for listening to Music. As a Spotify Premium user, the subscription is definitely worth it! I love spotify!! I'm still learning about the app, but, i love the different deals on packages they have now! my friend doesn't have premium, but as a premium member, i would for sure recommend. able to get everyone in on the family plan, and the features they offer are great. i love the app and find it better than the others i've used/have. the only thing i'd like to see is an option on the search bar that enables the microphone to pick up on music playing already in a space like a store or restaurant. that way, if you don't know the song, you can search it and have it pulled up. that's my one bug :)

UI is smooth, app works and rarely has updates, price is fair for anyone using it more than 3 times a week. Only thing I'd like them to add is a way to look at the history of songs played. So I don't have to just backspace 30 times to get to a song I heard while listening to suggested auto play.

Spotify has completely transformed the way I listen to music. The app is easy to use, fast, and packed with features that make discovering and enjoying songs effortless. Great app! Use all the time from phone, computer, and Google home. Won't load podcast episode lists at times, but usually I can just back out or close the app and it will pull right up. Oh Spotify, how I love you! For those that might find themselves reading this review, and haven't already downloaded/been using Spotify.. let me tell you something okay. I absolutely love Spotify! but they do have their downs and ups and cons and pro cons, first is cons, it's good it's just I wish they had more skips (I skip songs a lot) next is pro cons, I love how you get unlimited skips and no ads. now is the down side, the down side is that sometimes it stops my music I don't know why, now the up side of Spotify, I personally think there's a lot of upsides with Spotify like how there's so much music choices. Excellent, excellent app. Not one bad thing or issue. I cannot live without this app in my car, or on our devices in the house. Worth every penny. We pay for the whole year at every renewal (one-time charge), and will continue to do so. No worrying about monthly pymts. We're extremely happy with Spotify.

I've been using Spotify regularly to stream music, explore new artists, and create personalized playlists. The platform offers a seamless and enjoyable listening experience, with a wide variety of genres, podcasts, and curated recommendations that suit my mood or activity. I appreciate the smooth interface, offline downloads, and the ability to discover music through features like ‚ÄúDiscover Weekly‚Äù and ‚ÄúRelease Radar.‚Äù Overall, Spotify has become an essential part of my daily routine.

Choice of music is just as good as other digital venues. Value, however, keeps me a loyal customer. While all the other companies keep raising their prices year after year...Spotify has yet to do so. The premium version of Spotify is a staple on all of my devices.

Only music app you‚Äôll ever need. Love the playlists and release radar but I think my favorite is the AI DJ option because it allows me to listen to my favorites while also discovering new music. Also sometimes I‚Äôm just not sure what I‚Äôm in the mood for so it works as inspiration as well. Runs super smoothly, downloading music is also extremely fast and has been a life safe on long haul flights. Great job Spotify!

As a DJ , Spotify has been a game-changer for me. The curated playlists and powerful recommendations help me discover new tracks for my sets every day. The sound quality, smooth interface, and offline mode make it perfect for both personal listening and professional inspiration. Truly the best music app out there ‚Äì 5 stars from me!

I absolutely love Spotify, but I do have one complaint. I wish the DJ feature had more customization options. I'd rather not go from cyberpunk to evanescence when I'm in the mood for cyberpunk music.

My experience has personally been really good with Spotify. However, I have Spotify premium Which is really, really helpful. If you get Spotify premium, there are no ADS and you get to choose which music you like, however, if you don't have Spotify premium, you get ADS during songs and your playlist just plays and you can't choose what song's you want next.

I had i tunes and apple music, both were difficult and troublesome to use. Spotify is easy and has all the types of music anyone could want. I would and have recommended this to anyone. I am close to 70 years old and used to play in a jazz band. Music is in my life every day and Spotify makes it easy.

Spotify is honestly amazing, every song you want is on there in any genre. I love using it when I'm driving, working or even studying! My favorite part is that it syncs with all of my devices so I can pause it on my phone and then start listening to it on my computer! Definitely recommend premium!

Hands down in my opinion the best and only place to listen to music. Spotify always has every song I search for, and more. I've found music I didn't know that I absolutely love from their song suggestions, and the play list the make exclusively for me based on my listening. There's not a day that I don't listen to my Spotify. There's so many positives I could go on and on. (But I won't do that to you üòÅ). Fantastic. I listen to Spotify all the time, my only minor pitfall is trying to find certain songs because of the way Spotify sensors things, but otherwise fantastic. This is why I don't like to update Spotify without having a clear description of what's happening, it's a shot in the dark, sometimes good, sometimes awful. Honestly I've been using Spotify for a while now and to say my experience has been nothing but great is an understatement. Aside from the occasional crashing the app is near perfect. PS: Guys, dont expect free versions of an app to be top tier when you're not paying to deserve the luxury üôèüò≠

great app but on television I have a problem with syncing the lyrics with sound. the timer just gets ahead of itself and it only stops after I rewind multiple times. sometimes it'll even start playing ads early due to the unsynchronized timing. wish it could be fixed but besides that I have no complaints.

Overall I enjoy the app, I am a premium member yet again. BUT, I'm contemplating deleting the app again as it skips during some songs from time to time as if a scratched CD is playing. Then, at times the music shows that it's playing .. but no sound is generated !! As a paying customer I find it extremely irritating !! Thank you to the developers who suggested the reinstall .. same was done. Issues appear to have stopped occurring. Thank you.
replyContent: Hi. Can you try doing a quick reinstall and see if it makes a difference? If that doesn't work, we suggest reaching out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Simply search ‚ÄúContact Us‚Äù, and they'll be happy to assist.

content: I love Spotify but I'd rather stick to my music I love, today's music isn't really my thing. But I'm not sorry for saying this Spotify needs to get rid of its AI as im never going to use it. AI generated music its taking the skills away from musicians who work hard creating music playing instruments.

Spotify is a game-changer for music lovers! The personalized playlists (Discover Weekly, Daily Mixes) are spot-on, and the sound quality is excellent. Offline listening and cross-device syncing make it super convenient. Worth every penny for Premium‚ÄîI can‚Äôt imagine life without it.

Spotify is better than Apple music. if my membership stops they won't erase my library of music like Apple music does. I'm staying with Spotify forever. they have Great customer service and a great music selection.

I reallyyy love Spotify but honestly I don't like the fact that you only get 6 skips an hour just because you're not subscribed and that you also can't see what is next or cant SEE ur playlists placement. but over all this app is peak and helps a lot from the fact the music doesn't stop playing when u turn off your phone or when you go on a different app. this app doesn't work on things like Roblox, tiktok,ect. but that's all this app is honestly a pretty good music app

Spotify is an amazing app for streaming music. It has a huge collection of songs, albums, and playlists in every language and genre. The sound quality is excellent, and I love how it suggests music based on my taste. The interface is smooth and easy to use. Great for both free and premium users!

Spotify is a great app for all of your listening needs, all the music you could ever think of, tons of great podcasts, and if you're a premium subscriber, you even get to listen to 10 or 15 hours of audio books, I can't remember for sure how many hours, but it's enough to listen to most books in one shot. Initially gave this app a 5 star review but since then needed to change it to 3 stars. I use spotify every day and have problems with it every day. When I start up the app and pick music to listen to, which takes a large amount of time to do any ways, it usually takes about 5 minutes for the song to start, and most of the time it stops after playing for about a minute and I have to go and start the music again. When the music does play it will stop sporadically for about a minute all though it says its still playing and then start back up even with full service, and most of the time when trying to stop the music it will continue playing even when I close the app which is quite annoying when trying to go into a place like the grocery store. Not sure why this app is so laggy but it brings down the enjoyment of using this app for sure.

after a break of 5 years, I came back to spotify after trying other streaming platforms, and I find it to have a much better signal in all areas that I travel, and also easier to use. on the downside it is more expensive, with no annual option to pay

Dear Spotify! Please please stop developing this app! This app was stable until last year. Since then with every update it's getting worse. I'd usually go through the queue and change what songs are up next. Now, I can't figure it out anymore. Update: Thanks for fixing it!!! I can listen to the different genres in my Liked Playlist now.

I listen to Spotify all day. I listen on a desktop, on Bluetooth speakers throughout the house, when working outdoors, and when in my vehicle. I listen to music, podcasts, and audiobooks. There is no complaints here, everything thing works well music podcasts great job. I love this app. I can create my playlist, play my songs in the background, and edit my playlist while it's playing music. The recommended songs that follow my list are almost exactly what I like. All this is free. I'll happily listen to a 30-second commercial, especially since it doesn't start in the middle of a song or pause your music and wait for me to hit the "yes" button.

This is my favourite app for music, I love how it groups my favourite songs together. Also the recommendation for new music is on point. I love exploring different sounds and finding different artists and the experience has been great.

I also can have a friend playing the same song right next to me, and following a link to the song and re-adding it to my Playlist lets it work again, for a period of time.

replyContent: Hi. We'd recommend reinstalling as it fixes many common issues your app may be experiencing. You can find the steps by searching "Reinstall" at support.spotify.com. replyContent: Hi. We appreciate you reporting this to us. By any chance, have you toggled the Shuffle setting off? Smart Shuffle may still be toggled on. If that doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Just search ‚ÄúContact Us‚Äù, and they'll be happy to help.

Spotify‚Äôs a juggernaut in music streaming, with a massive library‚Äîover 100 million tracks and 6 million podcasts as of last count. Its strength lies in personalized playlists like Discover Weekly and Spotify Wrapped, which hook users by making them feel seen. The algorithm‚Äôs scary good at predicting taste, though some argue it traps you in a musical echo chamber. Free tier‚Äôs ad-heavy but functional; Premium‚Äôs worth it for offline listening and no interruptions.Downsides? Artists get peanuts‚Äî$0.0

I have nothing bad to say about Spotify except I wish offline play wasn't a premium expenditure, and instead was complimentary. As I don't have data about 95% of the year so I can't listen to anything and obviously if I can't afford data then premium is out of the picture. But that's more of a personal issue otherwise the app is really, really good.

Love this app! I wish you could move playlists in folders on the phone like you can on a computer, but aside from that 5 stars. The family premium bundle is especially nice so we can all get premium and don't have to shuffle (though I like to anyway) and have no ads! Love that I can listen to audiobooks on here too.

Spotify has completely changed how I listen to music. The sound quality is amazing, and the recommendations are always spot-on. I love how I can create my own playlists or explore curated ones for any mood. The interface is clean and easy to use, and having access to millions of songs and podcasts anytime, anywhere is just unbeatable. Whether I‚Äôm working out, relaxing, or on a road trip‚ÄîSpotify is always my go-to. Highly recommended!

I've used Spotify for years, and haven't bothered leaving a review it's the same as the rest of them, especially with premium. HOWEVER. since they implemented the DJ, I haven't listened to a single one of my playlists again!! I absolutely adore the DJ and it's my favorite playlist for every mood! you just tell it what you want to hear and it makes a playlist just for you based off of what you like!! holy cow is this amazing!!

I'm redoing my Spotify edit as the bug is fixed! I use Spotify all day every day, as soon as I get up for work in the morning at 5 am ill turn Spotify DJ on to start the music going all the way throughout the day to make my hours go by smooth. Even on nightshift, when it's a quiet night, I can use Spotify for some quiet music for the rest of the shift. No matter when or where Spotify is running!
replyContent: Hey, we're sorry to hear you're having trouble. We'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at http://support.spotify.com. Just search ‚ÄúContact Spotify‚Äù, and they'll be happy to help.

content: Great app on Premium, not the most suitable one for DJs, but that's not, what it is really built for. I see free version has a lot of limits and I guess that's fair, the price is quite reasonable for what you get and you can share it with your family and pay less. It would be great, if one could share Playlists with free acc holders, maybe a one time access link, could entice them to join. UI great, mostly facing no issues, have been a member now for years. Love the lyrics for original songs üëå

Spotify has truly become the soundtrack to my life, and it absolutely deserves this five-star rating! From the moment I signed up, I was blown away by the sheer vastness of its music library. It feels like every song imaginable is right there at my fingertips, ready to be discovered or revisited. Whether I'm in the mood for the latest chart-toppers, classic rock anthems, intricate jazz compositions, or obscure indie gems, Spotify never fails to deliver.

I love it, I used to use YT music, it was nice but when the free trial ran out I couldn't draw while listening to music, you can only listen to it while on the app, on the OTHER hand.. with Spotify‚Ñ¢ you can listen to it while drawing, playing games, and even MAKING music! I absolutely love it and I HEAVILY HEAVILY recommend! üíñ

This is temporary, I can't log in with my password, it gives me an error. Then when I try to log in without a password it has an error processing the link. Been using Spotify for nearly a decade and this is my first major issue. Fix this and you go back to 5 stars. Thank you. Fixed within hours, great work.

Absolutely amazing, I've been using Spotify for a few years now, ever since I could afford premium and personally it is amazing. I listen to a lot of heavy music like death metal and what not and Spotify has all of it, from cannible courpse to parkway drive, even some slightly controversial bands like burzum, it has everything I need. The UI is great for me and having so much songs downloaded is great. The audio quality is brilliant and overall I love the app. The best for music if you ask me!

Heavenly.!! I wanted to listen to a certain group and I just input a couple of groups I wanted to listen to and was a little disappointed when they were playing different singers and when I was changing the songs, it said for me to just listen to the mix. I did this irritated at first but when I listened to the songs they were the perfect songs for my mood. Thank you spotify!.

I have tried so many music apps to get background music for free, but none of them provided that. This is the only app I have found so far that is fully compatible with my device and it also supports background music for free. Besides there is also no add, which is also missing in a lot other apps. It also has a nice user-friendly interface. Love that. Obviously deserves a 5 star.

Spotify is my one-stop music platform. I love that it has both functions, streaming, and mp3. The exact reason I do not use Pandora is because it completely lacks mp3 functionality. Spotify gives almost 100% of listener control. The only thing that could be added to make it better is a "repeat A-B" function, where you're able to control a specific spot in a song that you want to repeat. It is a function that has been lost due to time and technological advancement, and I dearly miss it.

OMG thanks for lyrics!!- The menus have great animations, but when I want to add songs to playlists it feels slow waiting for these animations. - I'd add configurable buttons at the bottom of the now playing page - You can't delete a song from the playlist you're playing it from, without clicking on the album, then pressing the song options and then remove... - If I launch the app and dont wait for the first page to load, just press the music collection on the right bottom, the app freezes

I've had an amazing experience using Spotify! The user interface is smooth, the music discovery features keep surprising me, and the personalized playlists always feel spot-on. Whether I'm working, relaxing, or on the move, it‚Äôs become my go-to platform for soundtracking life. Definitely deserving of a solid 5-star rating.

Luv this app is very nice specially when u pay the low price per yr for no ads... But 1 thing is luv to see is when u bring up a best of group or person that on the top corner u can just like the whole thing of songs at once instead of individually... Sometimes theres a lot of songs to add. An other thing is it shuts itself off at times, especially while ur drivin maps on also. Other than that l, had for several yrs! üòò

I still believe that Spotify is the best music app. However I'm experiencing some problems. 1. Sometimes when I play music or a podcast, it will go silent while the play time is still counting. 2. I can't listen to my downloaded content unless I go online, press play and then go offline again.

A vast library of music that encompass most of my favorite artists and songs. I've also discovered many songs similar to my taste I really like. The App is lightweight and user friendly and the sound superb. Easily a Five star üåü from me. Edit: Having the video toggle option on Spotify is really welcome & a very helpful addition to its features, however there should be smoother transition between toggling and when in Video mode, a boost download ahead of the playtime position for smooth viewing.

I've now had spotify for several years and it's great! fantastic for 90% of the time. However, for some reason after one of the latter updates, I can no longer use the search within my liked songs and then play that selected song. Uninstalling and reinstalling didn't help. It's inconvenient but app is still great.

BEST MUSIC APP IVE EVER HAD!!! Took me a few years to switch because I was so used to the one Ive used for years and I have sooo many playlists, especially some with rare and hard to find tracks. I understand I can turn Bluetooth off but surely I'm allowed to choose if I want the music to stop playing. it's really annoying in the car because I have my Bluetooth on for phone calls but I'm forced to listen to music when I would actually like the quiet to think.

Dang. one of the best song apps. Spotify is hands down the best music app I‚Äôve ever used. It has everything ‚Äî songs, podcasts, personalized playlists, even mood mixes. Whether it's doing my homework, reading or simply just listening to some good music. Ads can be annoying yet you can always just get premium if they really disturb you. I don't mind them personally because it doesn't really bother me. Anyways, this is definitely a 5 stars for me.

Finally hooked. Been using for free since launch, but the catalogue and convenience are just too good to not pay the $10 a month for mobile and ad free usage. Edit: 2025 Spotify's algorithms continue to ensure it's the only real choice if music discovery is one of the things you value.

kinda wish they would steer away from automation (AI)... the wrapped has been really bad the last few years. like no effort. that said, I keep coming back. CS has always been really nice to me, though. usually issues with redeeming gift card.codes and they always sort it out for me.

Spotify is the only music app I use (And will continue to use) My partner of three years and I share an account with hundreds of playlists and likes between the two of us, and it works great. The option to download songs for offline is nice too. The subscription is actually pretty cheap and definitely worth the money. It plays nicely in the background and there is limited to no lag whatsoever. The layout is superior to something like YT music or Pandora as well, and you can buy concert tickets!

I love Spotify, and it is one of my subscriptions that is permanent. However, if they could enable a feature to sort songs by genre that are liked or in a playlist, it could revolutionize the ability for people to make playlists and could lead to some really cool things I think. I hope to see that feature one day.

This app is amazing! It's so easy to understand and to function, especially with premium. No adds at all! You can put your favorite song on playlists, download, search, and play them out loud, on headphones, or even on speakers. You could even find your favorite shows and Youtubers on this app and share your songs. You can also discover new artists and find new songs by your favorite singers. They have a for you page made specifically for new songs that you might enjoy. 100% recommend this app.

literally the best app to get to play music, when you create playlists it recommends some other songs that might make you wanna add them to your playlist or if you don't want it it shuffles the playlists really good by what I mean the beats of the song the was first playing once it ends another song that fits the beat or rhythm comes up next. ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê Love using Spotify! Spotify makes listening to music so easy and fun. I really like how it recommends songs based on what I usually play‚Äîit‚Äôs like it knows my mood. Been using Spotify since 2019. Great app all around. In the more recent months, I have noticed that Spotify has been a bit glitchy and wonky. Not being able to click on my songs, nor able to search songs while still having full internet/wifi. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Other than that, keep the party going.

I love Spotify and have to say it's the best music streaming service out there, along with two other services I love. I'll rate it 5/5 because it's just amazing. One of the best music streaming apps & I've tried them all. Tidal & Spotify are the 2 with the least amount of bugs & crashes. Spotify is probably my favorite of the two though. a classic music app. I've only had one issue in the 3/4 years I've been using spotify. I love my Spotify. The app works seamlessly, with excellent customer interface, and delightful recommendations for more music and podcasts. It's an interactive experience that showcases a user's top artists, songs, genres, and podcasts from the year. And it's hilarious!

Spotify has become the only music source for me. has a huge selection of music. anything you can think of you can find here. is an outstanding product end service and for the money you can't beat it it's easy on your wallet I can restore some peace of mind highly recommend Spotify over any of the brand or service out there it's a very outstanding product I'm happy to have it on my phone and my laptop I use it all the time not a day goes by I don't use it.

Spotify delivers a smooth, user-friendly streaming experience with a vast music and podcast selection. Personalized playlists like "Discover Weekly" make exploring new content easy, while cross-device syncing adds convenience. The free version has ads and limitations, but Premium offers offline listening, better audio quality, and unlimited skips.

This app is amazing, especially the premium version. Create addiction, and I personally couldn't find any fault yet, and I'm using Spotify for the last 7 years. I the beginning, it was included in my phone plan, but now I pay myself as I can't stay a day without listening to my favourite songs.

Best music app ever created. Adds minimal with free version, none existent with premium. Speaking of Premium, say hello to music heaven baby! I have it and LOVE it so much. hey I may be just another commenter on this app but this really is an amazing way to listen to music. I love this app, best app by far to listen to any music you can think off. I recently payed for premium and i can skip songs all the time now, with no adds. I forgot to mencion that you can share your playlist with your friends, or you can hide the playlist you dont want people to see.

Stuck on a black screen, even with google! I try to listen to it on Google, and I got a black screen! Come on Spotify. Try to fix this! Please? I really like it. Yes I still think Spotify is the best you'll get. The music doesn't lag, and there's less ads. Unlike YouTubeMusic.

This is literally an amazing choice and one of the best music apps to install. To say, I always listen to music while I study and I study a lot. replyContent: Hi Audrey. This should be fixed now. If you're still having issues, we'd recommend letting our Customer Service know. You can find them by searching ‚ÄúContact Us‚Äù at support.spotify.com.

content: great app to listen to music offline and be able to listen anywhere you go. When I first use this app as a kid, I was trying out new songs and soundtracks and this app helped me out a lot, it even suggested some good songs to try, now I am listening to any kinds and still trying out new songs. Thank you Spotify for helping me along the music career, also I am going to start making music with a friend then work on my own later years, so I am excited to see how Spotify helps me with that.

Really great app for listening to music! it has tons of different songs from almost every genre. the only problem is, I listen to fall out boy, my chemical romance, twenty one pilots etc and it always recommends Taylor swift or harry styles. it doesn't take taste or preference into much consideration, but if you want to experiment for yourself, it's great!üìº

Very good quality music which is very important to me. Also very convenient! And the dl option so you can take your music anywhere! I've been a premium user for over half a year, and the experience has been amazing. The collection of music is good, but there is a lot of room for improvement as well. Firstly, please don't remove songs that are popular, and few songs got completely changed in my playlist automatically, it's annoying. Secondly, a feature that shuffles a playlist after every play, so it avoids repetition, would be nice. There's this bug that, the queue appears empty with only 2 songs, while the playlist plays.

replyContent: Hi! To get the 30-minute ad-free experience, make sure to keep the video ad in focus and not navigate to another app. Also, make sure that you don't accidentally click the "No, thanks" button when prompted to watch the ad. If that doesn't help, you can get in touch with our Customer Service by heading to support.spotify.com/contact-spotify-support.

It has generally been a solid app and service since I started using it years ago. It's my go-to for music streaming. It gets better all the time as they improve navigation and their various features. I wish they had better tools for organizing playlists, as well as more tools to customize playlists (where you can see and add your most played songs to a list), a better designed queue list management where it's a easy to add or remove songs and albums to current playback, and I wish I could organize and sort my saved music better. Sometimes I want to save an album or artist for later, but it gets lumped into my entire library and it's hard to get back to it later. A separate library "Watching" category would probably help with that. This is just my wishlist. I love their personalized dynamic playlists and want to see more of them.
