This last update is horrible. Absolutely no music is bufferd, so if the internet connection is unstable, it stops playing anything. And this menu... You should consider firing the person responsible for it. Where are my frequently used playlists?? Horrible... Oh, and after reinstalling it, it does not want to log in...
I love the new update wheres you can play the song you want.

love this app, using premium account, I didnt enjoy it so much when using for the unpaid spotify version. I really like the home screen widget and also the functionability when using spotify app alongside other systems, smooth translation to Android drive and UE boom app for controlling Bluetooth speakers.
your Spotify has the best music it also comes in handy especially for someone who has epilepsy for me it is amazing ü§©ü§©
The one and only music streaming app I will ever use. I love Spotify! <3

I've been using Spotify for years now, and I love their algorithms. Great work. I would love to see them integrate Veevo music videos, or older ones as well. I sort of liked the old Genius lyrics, but there was no way to turn off the excerpts, sometimes I only wanted to see what the actual lyrics were. Also, I listen to a lot of podcasts, and sometimes I wish I could change playback speed, or change data speed without digging through my profile settings. Still, a great product. Thanks!
this is a amazing app to use! especially on road trips, I always have to have background music when I'm doing something, such as drawing,working,or when I take a nap. definitely recommended!

Can't download music for offline play. i went online and logged out of all my devices. too over a week but then was able to finally download on my main device. Spotify you'll need to look into this as I see this issue happening with other users too.
replyContent: Hi. Have you tried a quick reinstall? If that doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Just search ‚ÄúContact Us‚Äù, and they'll be happy to help.

content: Spotify gives me endless music and podcasts for every mood. The sound quality is great, and playlists are easy to customize. I listen every single day.
I just love listening to the music and they have all genres.

I've had Spotify Premium for years & have never had a problem. Ever since the last update, I haven't been able to use the app for more than 20 minutes without the app shutting down & getting a no internet connection error message (with both wifi & mobile data). I have to clear the cache at least twice to get it to work, but even then it shuts down again. Please fix this!!

I would give it a 10 stars if I could, the only problem is I can't replay songs or go back and I have limited skips. and I have to buy Spotify Platinum to get those things. but other than that, it's a great app

EDIT: It's been fixed for a while, thanks There's a bug that's interfering with Motorola's battery saver feature regarding restricting the audio quality change over "the Android data saver being on" while it's off. Other than that, pretty good.

The algorithm isn't based on the way Pandora seems to think just because you search for a song from a certain year, that you like everything on the radio at that time. Spotify seems to be interested in the actual sounds, beats, guitar riffs, and vocals of what you search for and listen to. When you like something, the suggestions for similar and even new are pretty Spot on. Even creepy. I've discovered some pretty spectacular new artists and been able to filter out the garbage. It's saved my life in long road trips and 14 hour flights by downloading Playlists. Don't bother with anything else.

The app itself is easy to use and has lots of lightweight features. It doesn't lag very often, and it has a great ideal kind of streaming and finding music. However, though it has lots of music, it doesn't have all of them. I'm hoping the company improves the song lists, include those that are found in iTunes too, because non-iTunes users cannot listen/stream/download anything that's why they resort to Spotify. But in my overall experience, it does still do a pretty goodjob. Cheers!

In general, Spotify is fantastic. The quality of the music is great, the app is easy to use and the variety of artists fabulous. I would give it a 5-star rating if the app didn't crash so often or on my laptop it says "can't play this song", which is super annoying. Also the daily mixes changes throughout the day. When I think I'm listening to a certain set of songs, they change before I get those songsüò¢.

Overall the best I've used so far, mostly due to their large(st) discography (I haven't used many, but I have used the top rated apps) .   Two issues though: 1. When the download toggle is disabled (playlist), when you restart the app (Android) and the songs are already downloaded, you can not play the sons (a "song not available" prompt is displayed) , which is a huge issue, since I only enable the download toggle when I actually want to download something, then I disable it, and meanwhile, if I lose signal and restart the app, I can not play the songs that are already downloaded. This does not happen if the signal is lost while the app is on, only after a restart while I'm offline. 2. Why bother with the share option if you're only going to share 30 sec of the song?!! I understand that this is a piracy issue, but trust me, there are a lot easier ways to copy your song then via facebook  or any other social media. If not for the download issue, and the mentioned usability issue (along with a very few minor other usability issues), this would have been the perfect app, but since it's the best I found, I guess 5 starts are deserved, because perfection doesn't exist.

I LOVE music and the equalizer allows me to get the best sound even out of some fairly mediocre speakers or headphones. I'm not sure why there's a option to keep all music at the same level. Without that option selected, the music is constantly changing the volume level. Find that auction is selected, the music volume is mostly too low to enjoy.

Great variety, good sound quality, though I do think that it could be made a bit easier to use on mobile devices. What I mean is: On Tidal, I can swipe at ease to return to a previous page or lower and raise the bar listing the song playing as I browse. Whereas on Spotify I cannot, and have to press the small button which is thin and rather easy to miss.

I love the diversity in the Spotify app. It is easy to create a playlist, share it (as an added contribute or just another listener), like or dislike tracks, control the audio levels, set a sleep timer, and more. I find that, compared to Amazon, Spotify wins for it's extra options and easy to use interface. Also, I do not notice the lagging that I get with Amazon Music. Another difference, and what I really love most, is the ability to have a playlist automatically add recommended tracks.

I've been using Spotify for almost two years now, and I can't get enough of it. I love the way the way Spotify can curate a playlist and create personalized recommendations for based on my recent searches and plays. Lately it's very difficult to find a song. Sometimes when I search for a song I really wanna play, it plays another song and this is can be very annoying. Other than that, the app is amazing and a very easy to navigate through. Thank you very much for this master piece.

Great!üëç I've been using Spotify since a year and i love it! But i'd love to if there were less ads. And here an idea: When i create a playlist i sadly cannot change the Name of the playlist later again . I don't know why but i can't do it and i am not sure if you can do it and it just dosen't work for me , or if that is not an option (or only for people with Premium).ü´∂ Also => I think everyone would be more happy if we can skip more song without Premium (8-15 song) But still great app!!!üòªü´∂‚ù§

I appreciate Spotify for always providing a service, most other music and podcast applications do not provide anything of value unless You pay at a premium price. Spotify, in my experience, provides a service that has real usable value, however You can pay for more premium services.

The range of artists, songs & radios is great! I just wish the devs would use algorithms that respect the artist I chose for each occasion! Or at least allow subscribers to actually CHOOSE whether to shuffle or not! Just to be clear: I haven't shuffled the music myself. I wanna listen to an specific artist, playlist and genre and the app plays whatever unrelated song after playing the one song I pressed on. Edit: promptly fixed! Thank you very much!

I've been using Spotify for over a year now, and I can't recommend it enough! Here are a few reasons why I‚Äôve given it a five-star rating: 1. **Vast Music Library:** Spotify offers an extensive library of songs, albums, and playlists across all genres. Whether you're into pop, rock, classical, or indie, you'll find something to suit your taste. 2. **User-Friendly Interface:** The app is incredibly easy to navigate. Finding your favorite tracks or discovering new music is a breeze, thanks to

Best app ever fr fr. I had trouble with it once,but it works now and I love it. I listen to music 24/7 and it. But there are too much ads. I don't normally have a problem with that,but it's very annoying sometimes because it'll give me that "30 minutes without ads" and then if I skip a song it'll give me one. Pls do smth about it,but in rest I love it <33

Love love spotify! I've been using this app for years and haven't found a real competitor. I've tried many other apps and always came back here. As a free user I have to say the quantity of ads is quite annoying. I'd rather have one 2 or 3 min ad every 1 hour as opposed to 10-second ads every 5 minutes. I will say I love the amount of music on here and really enjoy the simplicity of the app. I don't appreciate the amount of "Buy Premium" pop-ups but it's not THAT annoying yk. Just an opinion.

Solid options for Spotify! I enjoy it so much, and for a tad over $10? What an awesome deal. Hope to have you as long as I can. I have a hard time getting it to play in my car and give up (stupid technology...)I always play it again later. I would rate this higher than a 10. The only drawback is that I wish their were more random bands or songs rather than the same playlist. There is, but I'll find it.I truly enjoy it though!

Not sure what happened, but Spotify no longer works on mobile. At least on Android. It gets stuck on a perpetual loading screen whenever I select playlists or albums, or even try to go to my library. If I search for a song and select it, nothing happens. The app is just broken. Only runs on my laptop, now. Edit: Looks like whatever you guys did fixed it! Thank you! Everything's back up and running and I'm listening to music now!
replyContent: Hi! We‚Äôre sorry to hear this and thanks for letting us know. We‚Äôd like to investigate further. If you have time, could you reach out to our Customer Support team again with a screenshot of your review and our reply? You can find them on X and Facebook (@SpotifyCares), or via live messaging at https://support.spotify.com/contact-spotify-anonymous/.

content: Best app EVVVAAA!!! The selection of music? Good God there is nothing you cannot find on here. I'm from Austria, my native language is German and I've been able to find every last German song that I grew up with. It's amazing!!!

Spotify is a classic for a reason. I like the variety of music, but I wish I did not have to pay for Premium to escape the dreaded ads. I know that's how this company pays for itself, though, so :/ I guess it makes sense... otherwise reliable and fun to use (And in my opinion, there are so many pros that they easily outweigh the cons)!

Overall it's good. I don't mind the ads. My main issue is a song will stop playing in the middle or the sound will cut off, even though my volume is all the way at maximum and the signal is good on my phone. I also can't log in on the mobile website if the app isn't working. Very frustrating as my playlist is pretty much all I listen to for music these days. Premium isn't in my budget either. Update: Reinstalling the app helped, it's working again. Thank you!
replyContent: To reach our Customer Service, search ‚ÄúContact Us‚Äù at support.spotify.com.

content: "While Spotify is a great app, there are some areas for improvement. The shuffle feature could be more random, as it sometimes repeats the same songs. It would also be nice to have more customizable playlist options and better song recommendations based on listening history. Additionally, a lyrics translation feature for all songs would enhance the experience."
Brilliant all kinds of music and it is not expensive.

It's great and has so many features like the lyric search, which I love. It rivals YouTube Music if you have premium. Without premium, though, it is really annoying to use. For instance, if you want to play a specific song, it rarely plays that song; it randomizes between others most of the time. That may well be the only thing about Spotify Basic that I hate.

I like Spotify but I don't like the way it's organized. I have an idea for their business which is to join. Shazam with their app so that you could press the Shazam button while you're in the app. That's the reason I am actually writing something, but while I'm here I would like to say that there could definitely be some improvements in terms of options, how to organize the playlists, etc, etc. Wishing you guys luck!!

Spotify is awesome. Yeah, the UI might be confusing for some people. But its really straightforward. I love the sound quality. Not everything is in spatial audio, and that's OK. A lot more things are in stereo. Did you know that stereo with Spotify is surround sound? It's called "Bilinier audio". Your welcome. I love the fact that you can share your Playlist of whatever is playing with other people so that they can listen in real time. Keep up the great work.

I've had a fairly rocky journey when it comes to music apps, but after I landed on Spotify, I never looked back. I listen when I'm gaming, drawing, reading, Stretching, etc. The problem with ads feels non-existent, honestly. I hardly get ads enough for me to be annoyed. Spotify has just been super nice! Chromebook especially. I move around often, so being able to listen to music even when my Chromebook is kept safe in my bag is neat. Anyway, I just really like the app, give it a shot!

Great music of all genres anytime. Also, as an English learner, I like the podcasts I can find about any topic, from authors with different accents. The app is easy to use. I like meditation and I currently have a short list for this purpose, I like the songs that the app reproduces once my list reaches its end. I have found useful the function "Don't play this artist". I'd like that all podcasts' episodes would have the transcript, for English learning is really valuable

My experience has always been good, great. I'm totally satisfied with it.I don't really know all the various things one can do with your app. I've tried texting songs to friends , when they go to open the song there's nothing there. Can you only text songs to other Spotify Users. Maybe i'm just doing it wrong. I really appreciate that you can find lyrics.To the songs you love on spotify. My favorites list.I think has over 500 songs on it.And I don't know what I would do without it. Thanks guys.

Spotify is great, but honestly, I hate the ads, and there's no way I'm buying premium. I used to use YouTube Music but I switched to Spotify.. when I realized you can mod it to listen without ads. I do not condone listening with mods on Spotify or installing mods, I'd just like to share my personal opinion. Some downsides to modding is you cannot use Android Auto most of the time with Spotify, and you don't get any lyrics. However no ads, unlimited skips, and free downloads are quite nice.

Thank you for the option for a free account! But therein lies my complaint...the option to listen to an ad for 30 minutes of non-stop music doesn't always work, and sometimes isn't offered. Today specifically there's an ad that starts with people saying hello (the 3rd one is Grogu) but the ad doesn't continue...it freezes, then a song starts. But that's it, just one song, then you try to get the ad for 30 minutes non-stop, and it does the same thing. Would LOVE a fix for that. :) Thank you!
Finally dropped lossless, won't be switching anymore üôè
replyContent: Hi, we appreciate your feedback. We don't have anything to share regarding HiFi at this time. Should any information become available, we'll announce it in our Community thread. Just visit community.spotify.com, then search for "HiFi Quality - Lossless Streaming 16bit 44.1khz".

content: it's a very good platform for any type of music and I loved it very much ‚ù§Ô∏è

I have had Spotify for years now, the first 2 years I didn't have premium. It was stilghtly annoying to get ads and only be able to skip 6 times. Though, that problem really only happened with my phone. On my tv I was able to pick any song, and not have a problem. I personally think that the money I spend on premium is well worth it. Though, that's my opinion. I personally have no issues with anything, I love Spotify and I know I'll probably use it for the rest of my life.

everything about the app is great. ESPECIALLY if you have premium. from their predictive algorithm to listening to offline tracks... plus, it saves you so much space. that R65 is totally worth it! I just wish you could set a ringtone using the app , just like you can an alarm. I just think they could include more things to their wrapped liked. the way they did in previous years

Spotify is the ultimate game-changer for music lovers and podcast enthusiasts! With its vast library of songs, albums, and playlists, I'm always discovering new favorites. The Discover Weekly and Release Radar playlists are genius, keeping me up-to-date with the latest hits and hidden gems. Overall, Spotify is a must-have for anyone who loves music and podcasts. It's a 5-star experience that never fails to impress!"

Spotify has been an absolute fundamental app for my life. I probably sound over enthusiastic, but when you don't have any friends, a social life, and going through hard times, this app has always been my go to where I connect with anything of interests, from genres of music, podcasts, audio books and much more. I can search for absolutely anything at any time with premium, I am never disappointed. Spotify has put so many bridges in the gaps in my journey that I call life. Just try it and see!

It would be incredible if you guys could figure out a better layout for the 'now playing' song part for tablets. (You know, the one with the lyrics and play/pause buttons.) Something like putting the lyrics on one side of the screen and the play/pause buttons on the other side. Left and right. Guys, it would be nice if we had the ability to check the 'date of release' of songs.

After about 6 months u will know how to manipulate the settings for ur max listening pleasure. Spotify creates playlists for the members based on individuals taste. This makes it easy to add new songs (discover) u like to ur playlists. The only problem I can see is the QUALITY of the music tracks. If they can even remotely match CD quality, it would be bloody awesome. üëåüòé

I've been using Spotify for the last two years and I love it. I'm looking forward to this years Spotify Wrapped! Wish it'd come out sooner tbh. The only downside to Spotify is the amount of ads you get. If I'm listening on my phone I get a plethora of ads every three to four songs, and I get 3-5 fiveteen second ads, so if I skip three songs right after ads, I get thrown right back into them. I understand that Spotify gives ads that frequently in order to keep the app itself free, but come on.
IT TR BEST APP BECAUSE YOU CAN FIND ANY SON THAT I LIKE AND PUTTING IN MY PLAYLIST AND REPEAT THEM OVER AND OVER AGAIN.!!!!!!!!

Spotify's app is excellent, with a sleek design and easy navigation. I love the lyrics section and offline downloads for premium users. The AI DJ feature is great, but I wish it had customizable mood settings. Sometimes I'm not in the mood for the genre being played, and being able to choose would be awesome. Adding playback speed options would also be super helpful, sometimes I want to listen to music at faster pace like 1.5 or 2 times the normal speed

Helps alot, especially since you could play it on a phone for instance, and then go to the same account on another device, but change things from your device. Also has alot of music options there hasn't been a song I wanted to listen to that I haven't been able to find on spotify. If your kid wants an account there is a setting that allows that account to not listen to explicit songs. Great for families and not to expensive for premium. In my opinion this is the best app for music. Xbox works to

Greatly enjoy the variety offered here. Makes it real easy to go back and listen to artists that aren't heard on radio, so much these days. Signed up for three months at .99 per month and now pay the full amount and never hear a single ad. Bluetooth pairing with my UE Boom and I have great tunes on demand. I love it!!!!!!

I love it. All my music in all my devices all the time. What else could I ask for. And yes, I decided to buy premium after some time and it is totally worth it IMO. You can choose what to listen to and Download it so you don't waste data. It is also a good platform for podcast listeners, although I would like to see a coment section on those. Overall I think you should use it.

I Have the premium subscription and i absolutely love Spotify, I've had it for years. Any track you can possibly think of is on here, plus there's play lists, artist radio stations, interesting podcasts and everything in- between. Hands down it is literally the best music streaming app i have tried. I'd literally be lost without it, love my MUSIC! üíô

Spotify is amazing. I love it and will forever use it over other music platforms. It feels way more user-friendly than other apps, and I like it when it recommends new things for me. Although, I've had an issue lately where songs (both downloaded and not downloaded) won't load and will only play the first few seconds of a song before stopping and never loading. From what I can tell, though, no one else I talk to seems to have this issue, and it might just be a personal setting I need to change.

I've been with Spotify since almost when they started there hasn't been a song I've not been able to find even from albums that are hard to find that are no longer being produced and havent been for years. Spotify had it. Hands down best music platform everything for 10 bucks a month. Less than 40 cents a day, you can't beat it. I had a major accident at work and have been financially strapped so I have only been able to use the free plan for some time now. Does Seem to be more commercials

For the most part, this is one of the best apps I've used for music, I will say, once you give into premium you probably won't go back, I wish ads gave you like an hour of free listening instead of 30 minutes, as they give you maybe 3-6 ads in a row. Otherwise, this is a great app until I purchase all my music, and It makes it much easier to find songs as it goes by not only taste but also by the year of music you're listening to, which has helped me find many good songs several times over.
the app is NOT working. had to uninstall and reinstall (first time ever-so that's ok).

This app is really nice. I use it often for listening and streaming music. But the problem is, there's a lot of ads, like one time it gave me 5 ads straight. And then now the lyrics needs premium and has a limit every month. It's really good because you can create playlists, stream podcasts, and make a blend with other people. Thank you, have a nice day! <3

Love spotify, and the service. I even love paying for it. Completely worth the amount of music you can listen to anywhere anytime. the app even creates playlists based on your listening. I use it all the time, working, running, whatever I'm doing. I've also discovered so much music I never would have found otherwise. great app!

Game changer! Zero issues with this app. Love the recommended content - found so much hot stuff just based on what I already listen to. My wedding cocktail and dinner playlist were set to meet spotify account. I can enjoy when I'm offline (handy on planes or other countries when data is expensive). Easily pairs to every day listening (bluetooth in the car, on the boat, portable speakers, e.t.c). Would recommend to anyone. Well done!!!

This review is for Premium (which I just signed up for as a student). Spotify is the best out there, from the interface, to song selection, to ease of listening and the quality of the audio. Exactly what I wanted, perhaps even more. If you're on the fence, I can say that you'll get your money's worth, and that's even before the Showtime and Hulu (for students).

It's hard to put into words, it would be easier to criticise, especially if I didn't like it. I love this app, the songs, interface, recommendations, the way that it keeps up with your mood and what you want to listen to, the way it's so easy to share the songs you listen to, not to mention, the podcasts. I found new favorite artists, and discovered new podcasts, too. I also like the one Spotify premium advert about finding what's cool for you.

I love the availability of the different playlist, workout, reading, meditating, studying, anything you can think of really. It gives me amazing playlist suggestions. For only 10$ a month worth it. I have figured out when the music skips (it hasn't in quite awhile) restarting the phone usually takes care of the issue.

Spotify is pretty awesome. It's got a huge library of songs, podcasts, and even some exclusive content. You can create and share playlists, discover new music tailored to your taste with their recommendations, and even listen offline if you have a premium account. Plus, the interface is super user-friendly. It's like having a personal DJ with you all the time!

If you are seriously into the adventure of listening to music, then I cannot recommend Spotify enough. There are very few artists you will not find here. It runs beautifully on my phone, which I can also use to control Spotify on the laptop that I have plugged into my home stereo. Awesome! Let's hope it never disappears, because I don't know what I would do without it.

I LOVE SPOTIFY!!! I've been able to find almost every song and artist I have looked for, even golden oldies! The only things I can think of that could possibly make Spotify any better than it already is, would be showing information about the music, such as the year it was recorded and maybe who the bandmembers are/were, and, mainly, PLEASE ADD LYRICS.... please? Lyrics would be great! But other than that, Spotify is wonderful and I'm so glad that I found it!

Great variety, good quality and does almost everything you could want. I purchased the premium and every month it takes out like ¬£7 or something. The free version is a bit irritating with the whole shuffling song deal but it's a company that want to make money and offer a premium service for those who want to spend the money. To be honest I get paid like ¬£9 an hour at work and listen to music probably 4 hours (if not more) a day. What's ¬£7 a month? I can't rate Spotify highly enough.

I waited forever to do streaming and it's outrageous! And they have everything. So much music, and I'm a record geek. But guided meditation, poetry, books, languages and podcasts. It's nuts. I got it for my mom, who is older and lives far away, so we could all share playlists with her and she likes that a lot. Shared playlists are surprisingly cool.

As a fan of um er copyleft(?) music apps n sights, I got tired of building my library up and then when I wanted to add to it, the app would not be working. So for a measly monthly fee this one has just about every song you can dream of...except for a decent version of Shock the Monkey but hey after my 2 month free trial, it's the ONLY song I haven't found so...

I discovered a wide variety of music that's new to me from here and around the world or long forgotten. You train Spotify by listening to a wide assortment of music that you like and by rating songs and artists. I wish Spotify would allow us to rate the composer, the piece, and the recording artists or even "I usually like the piece, but not this version." Sometimes you like the piece but not the specific rendition of it. Discover Weekly is great! But it focuses on styles you rated recently.

Beyond Phenomenal. Useful, efficient, works well, doesn't usually have any errors or glitches. Perfect for listening to music, and even more profound in regards to it's exploration abilities. You can actually create a radio station, from one singular track that you love, and it'll automatically curate and create a radio/playlist, filled with songs that are in the same genre, or related, or have similar sounds, and even after you reach the last song, it'll actually keep playing, infinitely.

Whether you want to pay for the subscription, or just use the add supported version, you probably won't be disapointed. If you hate adds or want to listen without internet, the $10 a month will probably be worth it to pay for all the music you would want. Spotify has a great catalog and the app does not hold you back at all. You dont have to pay for anything though. Go ahead and download the app and see if you like it.

Great app!!! Perfect for when you're on the go. The Kpop side of things has improved a lot but there r still some downfalls. I wish there was a way to group artists by genre if we wanted. It's hard to find my favorite western artists in a sea of all my Korean artists!!!! Also the inline suggest thing doesn't help us to correct information about albums/songs that were listed under the wrong artist. If these issues were fixed I would love Spotify even more! But I would definitely recommend this over apple or Google music

The Best Music App ever. Worth the premium service. I've been a member for many years & will never ever leave. I'm reading the reviews, but I don't understand where there complaints are coming from. 1) They have a repeat for just a song, album ot the playlist. You just need to learn how to use there service which is not hard by any means. 2) I have at least 25 to 30 favorites saved. Again, you just don't know how to use the service.

Finally spotify is officially available in India. Everything else is great, but why aren't we getting the songs by Ed, Panic!, Paramore, Bruno, Twenty one pilots, etc. The list is very big! We are paying for a better music experience and it's quite well but still it feels incomplete. The new interface is good. Waiting for so long and we want to enjoy more music from our fav artists.

Love it. Do have one request, though. When listening to the DJ, the songs are cut shorter, like a song will end sooner than the song should, and the next song is already 10+ seconds in, all at the same time... it's off-putting. Could you have it to where the songs are more true to the start and end? Can they mash only 5-7 seconds instead of the current time length... Thank you! Appreciate yall!

content: I have used Amazon Music, Apple Music and Spotify by far has the most amazing library available that you will NOT find on any other. If you want to go to sleep, simply ask for "Sounds of the Ocean", or "Meditation" they even have subliminal tracks which walk you through relaxation techniques. I have been unable to find any other platform other than Spotify that includes such a vast music, audio tracks including audio books (which can be purchased and added to your Google library).

Spotify is my favorite music app. When you select an artist, Spotify tends to play MOSTLY that artist's music and not jump around like other apps that I've used. You can ‚ù§Ô∏è songs and Spotify notes to play them more often for you. You can also make playlists with individual songs that you enjoy to create to your perfect line of tracks, and so much more. If you love music like I do, then you'll love Spotify. Click install and give it a shot!

Only complaint is the download function does not have a place where you can see what songs are currently being downloaded, and also there is no way to stop the downloading if you are on wifi. So if I'm on a weak wifi spotify will begin trying to download whatever songs I have selected for download and there is no way within the app to stop the download. Please fix that! It would be great if it was a option on the notification!

Aside from having to dig out my own collection of Tool, I haven't listened to anything but this app going on 3 yrs now. APC, Puscifer, & ANYTHING feat. Maynard, but no Tool. The ONLY band that's not available. I'd give you 3 stars for that alone, but I've read the band doesn't want their music essentially 'dismantled'. So it's not all entirely your fault. Or so I hope.. Otherwise, great app.

This is the only music app that I'll pay for. I have used it for probably 5 years. I love the playlists. Specifically, "The Newness". I know about all the best artists way before they hit mainstream...also the suggestions are always spot on! I only wish some of the music was mine to keep, like my old Zune subscription (showing my age) üòÇ.

does what it needs and does not charge extra for listening while phone is turned off I think I've been using Spotify for about a year and a half minimum. The ONLY issue that I might have with this is the fact that you cannot, at least from my understanding, remove songs from the recommended Playlist. Other than that, I've had no issues.

People say that the "free" version of Spotify is not worth it. I agree. But, considering that for Itunes you would have to pay for every single song or album, $10 a month is SO worth it. unlimited songs, and download offline listening, not to mention podcasts and radio? I couldn't ask for more. 100%, the best way to listen to music.

I'm an '89 child, that means I'm at the age where I am loyal to specific brands, FOR A REASON. I have been a faithful YouTube music listener. Finally, 2020, I gave Spotify a chance... I'm mind blown I enjoy it so much. Playlists are EASY to add to, quickly. I like that songs are adding their lyrics. I actually use the Genius lyric app with my Spotify. I enjoy the absence of ads, omg. The quality of sound is great. Thanks Spotify.

I'll never use anything else again! Spotify is a one-stop place to get all your listening stations. Music, podcast, Playlist and even able to make this your own, I love it! I will never be able to use anything else for music and my favorite podcast ever again. My fiance also loved my app so much we purchased the duo plan and now we listen to music together while we work at different places.

Spotify is excellent, but not perfect. On the other hand, nothing is. One of the few problems: if you spot an error in the song titles or credits, let alone concerning the performing artist, there appears to be no direct channel through which the suggestion for correcting the mistake could be sent. I' m far from being a computer wizard, but I still guess that such an improvement can't be all that difficult to make.

It's my favorite music subscription ever. I've tried Pandora and Apple Music both, but nothing compares to the expensive music library, unlimited skips, the ability to choose whatever song you like, AND the extensive year-end review, which is my favorite part! I love seeing how much my music tastes change through the year, every year, and how my life impacts the kind of music I listen to. Spotify deserves way more than just 5 stars.

Love Spotify, can't go a day without it. All types of music new, old & hard to find songs/artists. Create my own playlists or listen to one's that people posted. Shows me concerts near by which is great. I've been to many that I may have missed because they are not mainstream. Discovered new artists/songs due to Spotify's recommendations. Very reasonable price for all this & more.

Most used app I have on my phone. Really easy to use and make playlists. I pay for Premium. I don't like the free version because it restricts what you can play. I also listen to my podcasts and it keeps track of which episodes I already listened to which is convenient. Only complaint is that when they do a major update it can be hard to navigate. It takes some getting used to. FYI I haven't used any other music streaming app so I can't really compare it to anything else.

I have used this app for a long time and would recommend to others. They even give free Spotify plus every so often with a survey. The only thing that I find a little buggy is the 30 minute ads. Sometimes it will say 30 minutes and be 15 but.. it can be solved if you just change the Playlist. Other than that, I love pretty much everything about it.

By far the best music app on the market, and the best value for your money. I love how you can choose the level of sound quality, and I have no complaints about the "very high quality" setting at all. This app does a good job recommending songs too based on the songs you've searched for and added to playlist. Their algorithm nails it a lot of the times and I've discovered a lot of great music that I've never heard before, thanks to Spotify. üòÅ

One of the best apps I've ever used. The price is really affordable, depending on the package you purchase. I have 8 devices including my vehicle's. Downloading is very simple,and the offline mode works great. I like to use other people's published Playlist. Myself I prefer old classic country from the 50's-60's and my rock and roll is from the 50's to early 80's. Spotify even has music from Texas artists and forgotten songs. I hope you all don't change your programming. Just keep it up
it's an amazing music app different Verity's of music even some people who are no longer with us even old old music

This is still one of the Best Music apps. With e-books, podcasts and more. In the settings, you can overlap tracks so there is no long pause between songs. High-quality streaming and downloading options for when you are offline and the option you can turn off and on to be offline. Equalizer, sharing and as I said, so much more. The Dj, if you don't already know... will bring you back in time to where it WILL get you bobbing your head if not singing. Custom to you likes.

The app is perfect I have been using it for years!!! If you are on the free version upgrade to premium it is much better and supports the artist better than the free version. If you are complaining about ads go premium it solves your problem. With discover weekly discovered hundreds of new songs I liked over the years. The app is still great my favorite app of all time!

Easy to use, always able to find any song or artist I search for. I like the feature of to be able to use on multiple devices. The suggestions and prompts I get to follow a artist or check out a song based on my previous usage is really good, it's not often they recommend something or someone that km not keen on. I like the podcasts that I have just recently started exploring. I have the paid version because I think that we should be supporting the artists that make this music, as it is with these subscription based services these days artists get paid bugger all so I'm trying to do my bit to recognize the hard work and talent that these artists put in for our enjoyment, and with the number of hours and total gig of usage I go through each month the price is more than reasonable.

It's definitely my most recommended top music app to download. Since it very lovely and you can also download episode on it to play offline, although I have a complaint on the shuffle mode. Which is kind of annoying sometimes, but since I'm used to it now, I suppose it's alright. I do hope you can let us play songs of our choice without the needing to buy Spotify Premium ü´∂üèª.

I came here because everyone raved that it was so much better than Pandora but everytime I chose an artist to listen to, I got only their songs. Which would be totally awesome if they played every song. Not just their hits over and over again and then limit my skips. Whereas with Pandora, you don't get just the artist's music that you chose, but at least you get a similar variety and all that artist's songs, even their less popular ones in the mix of others. They both have the exact amount of ads.

Doesn't cause any issues, with the premium I downloaded my favorite albums and they play with absolutely no problems while I'm offline. Has the best playlists ready for me whenever I'm online. It's absolutely amazing.

I have had music collections since i had my first job in a supermarket! I had a casette collection back then. Moved up to cd and even minidisc for a time. I flirted with itunes for a bit but found the time it took to move music was just painfully long. So now with spotify I can cherry pick the song that I there and then and even download them on the go if I am out and about. How times have changed! I still like to fire up the old hardware from time to time; but in practical terms - a real winne

Loved it until recently where it regularly spends time loading but doesn't find the track/albums , cuts off and won't play and generally just not being a relaxing place to listen to my music. I pay for the family pack and expect more. Review would have been a 5 prior to these issues... The above issue is now fixed. Now I have a different issue.. when I want to listen on other devices, which I have been doing with no issues , it doesn't recognise our amazon dot! All sorted, thanks
replyContent: Hey, sorry to hear that. If you haven't tried reinstalling the app and restarting your devices (including your router and Amazon Echo Dot), we'd suggest giving these a go. If the issue persists, get in touch with our Customer Service by searching for ‚ÄúContact us‚Äù at support.spotify.com, or sending them a DM at twitter.com/SpotifyCares.

content: This is by far one of the best apps. The ui is sleek, suggestions work great , my family has no problem with paying the relatively small cost of the family premium membership (which covers our 4 accounts), great music selection, I've started listening to some podcasts. And it is just overall a solid app. The only problem I have with it would be how much space its takes up, but with how much I use it that's worth it

I have been a Spotify customer for 3 years, and wouldn't use anything else. All of the music I've ever wanted has been at my fingertips. I like the capability of headphones and bluetooth (Android). If I ever need any assistance, their customer service is also quick to help (within the hour), and try everything until the customer is satisfied. Well worth the premium subscription as well. If you're on the fence, just do it for the month, and then decide. I guarantee you'll continue to use it.

3 years later I'm editing my review. Spotify is my personal number 1 music streaming method. I use it on a daily basis. If you're willing to pay for premium this is probably your best option. If you listen to smaller artists they may not be on this platform, and the app can be buggy sometimes, but Spotify is a pretty damn good option.

Multitudes better than Pandora Premium. Yup, I just went there. Was loyal to Pandora for over 10 years. Spotify Premium (or whatever the paid version is) has better, more intuitive features and allows you to put together a dream playlist way sooner than Pandora could dream. The only thing I would change is for Spotify to officially have a thumbs down for songs. You can even customize your preferences to exclude songs with explicit content and also what quality your songs play at!

Easy to use. Nice selections. Sure there are ads on the free version, but nothing like YouTube where its 1 minute of the video, then 5 minutes of ads. And if you so choose, you watch a quick ad and then you get 30 minutes of ad free music. So if the average song were 5 minutes long, thats 6 songs in a row ad free. So well worth it. üëçüëç

Been a subscriber to premium for a few years now. I love this app. It's a great way to discover new artists & albums. The artists get some royalties from song plays and I can even save some songs for offline. I have trouble adding friends though... Can you find people? All said, amazing app and do subscribe to premium to get rid of ads and to save songs offline. üëå

Seriously the easiest way to listen to music. Listen to your favourites (and they'll be there don't worry) and you'll end up with suggestions that are pretty well matched with the stuff you like. I've found so many little known artists that I've fallen in love with and I wouldn't have known they existed otherwise. Worth the ten bucks a month!!! The app is intuitive and comprehensive. Recommended

Amazing music streaming app! Though I must say the website/desktop version on my PC works better and is easier to use. Also, the only option is to shuffle play the playlists? I was trying to listen to a musical and it would only let me shuffle. I don't know if I am the only one bothered by that. Anyway, nice job! 5/5 amazing app.

It's great! Gives you half access to all the songs you want to listen to! :) The only problem is the constant ads and how long they last. I understand the whole Premium concept and removing the ads fully, but the ads are just popping up too frequently like,, after 2 or 3 songs. It would be great if you could cut them down to a minimum, but overall, a really great app.
replyContent: Hey there, we appreciate the feedback. If you haven't tried Premium yet, we'd suggest giving our trial a shot so you can listen to music without any interruptions. Just head to http://spotify.com/premium to get started.

content: Absolutely love Spotify. Never had any problems for the few years I've been using it and overall just had a great experience. I requested my data a day ago and it arrived first thing in the morning the day after which was great since I didn't have to wait as long (15 days) as it said I might. Just a little disappointed in the Wrapped feature this year, last year's had way more stats for users to see and I was a bit upset about the fact that AI was used to review them. Overall, amazing app!

Edit: They removed the song limit! Five stars. Original: The development team will not address nearly 700k users who have hit Spotifys arbitrary cap on My Music. It's the songs you save to find later, not download (thats limited to 3k). Your songs are limited to 10k, which sounds like a lot; but when you've been using the service daily for years, eventually you will hit it. Apple music and Google Play music limit at 100k. Please fix this issue

I think Spotify is a great app for music, but there are couple of things that bother me. First of all, you guys add songs that we sometimes like and dont and there is no option to turn it off. Second of all, you only give 6 skips per hour to people on MOBILE. That's something that annoys me. Third of all, say if someone recommends a song, and you go to play it, but you can't play it because you need 'Premium.' I gave it 5 stars because I think it's great, but the 3 things I said is my opinion.

The Best!!!! I love it cause you put a singer and gives you all of the songs for hours with only one or two interruptions not like other apps that give you more commercials than music or you put one singer and you don't listen until hours later. Finally an app that I can listen to one singer or one group all their songs. Thank you!!!

Five Stars! The overall app is just amazing, I can listen to any music I want and create playlists depending on my mood or my artists. Although i find it silly that any device can play an individual song of choice anytime without premium, but on mobile phones you have to pay premium to listen on demand. I can just go to YouTube for that or load up my tablet or even TV! So, premium is kind of useless when you have other devices and even YouTube to do your work for you; so dont go premium guys!

Best way to listen to and discover music, and rock out. Hands down. Spotify premium is 100% worth it. Edit: 5 years later and I still believe this. Their radio has gotten VERY good in the past year, and they have some of the best tech functionality, like multiple devices controlling the same speaker queue.

I tried Spotify when it was first released and hated it, so went with Google play. Years later, Spotify was great, but I was tempted by a six month free trial of Amazon - it was only then that I could recognise Spotify's strengths & soon came back to it. It's definitely the best out there. If I could file and arrange playlists by theme and type, that'd be a great added feature, but I'm nitpicking really, because there's not much else to complain about. It's great.

The best music app to have in your pocket. The premium version is phenomenal as well. Lots of bells and whistles, especially if want an excellent selection of custom made playlists and mixes made fresh daily like a box of donuts and a nice big hot cup of your favorite coffee, all based off of your favorites and most listened to songs, albums, and artists. If you don't have a Spotify account, the best gift to give to your ears is this app, at least try it. Guaranteed to fall in love with Spotify

I absolutely LOVVE spotify!! It is definitely my go-to app for when I listen to music. My brother pays for the family plan (I think that's what it's called?) and I never get any ads. This app is really good and I highly recommend it. The only thing I wish to remove is although I never get ads when I listen to songs, I would like for them to remove ads on podcasts. Idk if its something that the podcast creators control but if not that would be GREAT! Other than that I love Spotify!!

Customer service goes above and beyond to fix problems. I had purchased a subscription card from a local Walmart and somehow the code was wrong. After reaching out thru Twitter I was contacted by Spotify. Less than 8 hours later I was sent a correct code after they verified my code was indeed unsupported. They were far more helpful than I expected.

Tried free for a week. I was so impressed with the similar music suggested I am now a full paying member. Love the range of music available in the genres I enjoy. Still a paying customer 2 1/2 years later. So easy to use and any song I'm looking for!! "edit" to update how long I've been using this great app.

Nothing in this world will ever compare to owning physical copies of an artist's music, preferably a vinyl album. But that being said, Spotify is the best streaming experience for listeners. No other service even comes close! My favorite part about Spotify is the Discover Weekly Playlist which is tailored just to your personal music taste. Their algorithms kinda blow my mind every week. It's a great way to discover extremely talented new artists that the greedy record labels ignore.

Works great! Free, or paid for more features. We ended up going with a paid family-type plan. Very reasonably priced. I particularly like the podcasts for sports programs. My wife uses the podcasts and likes the ability to save songs to multiple play lists. Our daughter likes that she can have her own independent lists as with the paid plan you can have multiple users. My wife also likes that at the end of the year it will make a list of your favorite music from that year and save it for you.

If you don't have spodify at this point....there must be something wrong with you. All the music you want, can download for subway and basement gyms, and not only that but sharable playlists, great new artist suggestion algorithm, local concert and shows information. Oh, how about add all of your podcasts in there as well? I could keep going, but you got the picture so im done.

Love Spotify. Helps me find similar songs if I type song names into search and play. Also, every time I return to a certain podcast, it picks it up where I left of, I don't need to scroll through so many till I find it. Works great. Also, on my samsung s23 ultra, I can like the song on the lock screen. Now, building my favourite song list has never been easier. I can't emphasise enough how well the algorithm works and finds similar songs. Led me discovering new songs I loved at 1st glance.

DEFINITELY RECOMMEND! Brilliant apps, gives access to thousands of artists and songs, yet to search for an artist i couldn't find. Brilliant value for money. If you listen to music often I definitely recommend subscribing to the premium service, which allows you to also download music and podcasts so that you can still listen when your data runs out! Still brilliant without the subscription.

Absolute must have! Sign up for premium, add your whole family for one low price and never use anything else again. So worth it. I haven't used another music app in years and have never listened to so much new music. Their selection is super eclectic and huge. I would challenge you to find something they don't have. Totally worth the five stars.

A good music app, has most of the groups I enjoy. Also easy to find new music, whether by groups I already like or ones I'd never heard of before. Only problem I have are the songs that occasionally disappear from the app. Sometimes whole band and all their work, other times just individual songs. Really annoying when I had them in playlists I listened to frequently. Well, that and some of the suggestions it gives make no damn sense, but that's ai for you.

The only way to improve would be to operate like Pandora does. I could plant a seed song and get a continuous steam of similar vocals, beat or feel. Depending on my mood I add names to each list and add other songs. Or not. The algorithm continues to add songs as I listen but mine will stay in there .. But I could collect 15 or 20 lists should cover every mood.

I started with the free subscription, but switched to the paid subscription for more unlimited options. It was the best decision!!! I use Spotify all day and night, because it has so much variety and I get everything at a reasonable price. When I host events, its so easy to create a playlist. Just upgraded to the Duo plan and added my fiance so we could both listen to our own styles and have a generated playlist put together for us ‚ù§ SPOTIFY IS A WINNER üèÜ

I have been using Spotify for many years now and have no problems with the app. One thing that I love is having the option to have several play list. Play list for your children's music, one for your spouse, date night, etc. I have yet to look for a song that is brand new/new release and it not be available. Very pleased

Personally believe the Spotify app is one of the top 10 apps in play store and I have many , many apps. App is easy to use, has playlists. Yes there are ads in the free version but hey it's free and I will probably be change to the premium version next year.. The music library is extensive but i am eclectic so would like see even more obscure/rare/ethnic music if possible.

Love the UI and UX. I can control the music playing on my Amazon Echo, Windows laptop, or MacBook, from my phone. I can choose to download and stream at a higher bitrate. Large selection of podcasts (can't wait for Joe Rogan to join). A couple things: 1. Let me slide up to reveal the full album art/music controls like I can on iOS 2. Unleash Samsung Developers. I'm not sure if it's your fault or theirs, but I can't control the volume of my MacBook from my Samsung Galaxy Watch Active 2.

The greatest benefit of Spotify is the broadening of your taste in music and discovering new music you love. Premium looks at what you like and just like a solid bartender, whips up something based on metrics, killer playlists and your metadata that you're sure to enjoy. We can only hope they are responsible with the massive amount of data they collect. Be sure to go to Profile>Account>Privacy and turn everything OFF. I can't pay for a service that's also banking by selling my data on the side.

You don't need Spotify Premium to listen, just Premium allows you to choose exactly what song you want, with no ads. The free version has ads and you cant listen to certain songs. I love the App, and it is a great tool for every day use! (I also use Sony/Playstation 4... The 2 company's have partnered and you can listen on your PS4 as well.

It is a nice app. It plays even my music (Heavy/Death metal) which is not so popular. The only downside is you can't skip many songs as you need to pay monthly for the full version. That's all well and good but some people can't afford to be spending money each month like that. Don't get me wrong I know they need to make money and that's fine I just wish it was not so locked down for free users. Ad's are not an issue you watch one and get 30 mins of music without them. All in all good app!

For years I had to fight to get the music I wanted in order. I used itunes with limited success; I downloaded, torrented, and stole what I could and made playlists in any free app I could find. Spotify changed that. I can stream or download whatever I want and organize it however I choose. They craft playlists for me of throwbacks and new discoveries, and notify me when new albums come out. I've been using Spotify for 5 years and I've never regretted it once.

This is great. Bands and artists are recommended for you to try based on your playlists and liked songs. Playlists are also made for you based on your listening. There are also podcasts to get your teeth into. You can also search for what you want. My only quibble is the amount and frequency of the ads. It seemed it used to be approx every 30 minutes. It seems now to be every 3 songs. You can pay monthly and have no ads at all, though. Love it!

I love the app, just wish there was a sleep timer. I usually listen to spotify while going to sleep and i dont want to waste my batery overnight listenig. Hope you guys can add one soon, would be really appriciated! Edit: Omg they added a sleep timer!! Favorite app now along with the listening parties. Last thing id wish for was an easier way to download local songs on phones or if you were able to share downloaded songs with friends by like bringing your phones together to let them download.
replyContent: Hey, thanks for the feedback. You can filter Your Library to show only your downloads. More info on this at ‚Äúsupport.spotify.com‚Äù - just look for ‚ÄúSort and Filter‚Äù. As for your other request, you can add it to our ‚ÄòIdeas Board‚Äô at community.spotify.com so others can show their support. Just head to the Menu > Ideas > Idea Submissions.

content: It's neat and it has a lot of music. Some stuff is missing but it's probably the bands' legal stuff and not Spotify's fault. Like I wish they had more King Crimson but Robert Fripp is a real control freak when it comes to his music, so... Anyway, good app. Only complaint is that before I had premium the ads were a real pain especially on albums you kind of have to listen to uninterrupted for them to have the full effect. Why should people who can't afford premium have to deal with that, you know? Make the ads less pervasive if they're really necessary.

My rate would be 4.5 for Spotify. Why I didn't give them 5/5? It is because sometimes when I play my songs on my playlist, it's pausing out of sudden. Like at the 4 or 6 seconds of the song playing and it sould be repeated on the next songs. I hope Spotify team will find the solution to this as there are many Spotify users experienced the same issue as mine. Btw it's not fair to the Spotify Premium users as we subscribe Spotify monthly or yearly. In Malaysia, I have to pay RM15 for a month.

After giving it one star in 2017 for being useless on my phone I'm now giving it 5 stars for its performance on my tablet where I can choose a precise track. It's got an astonishing selection of music (I don't know how they do it) including, for instance, obscure tracks of early music from the 15th century taken from one of my wife's CDs. She might as well chuck 'em, all on Spotify Much better than the advert-bloated YouTube Music which is always bugging me with adverts for its premium service.

LITERALLY THE BEST!!! Has so many songs, you can make playlists and listen to other users playlists, with premium you get ad free and offline listening, it gives you an option to get ad free music for half an our by listening to an ad, honestly better than other muic apps including iTunes, applemusic, Pandora, etc. You don't need to pay to have a regular account and it's really an amazing app

I've been using this app for years now and ditched Pandora because at the time it wasn't available in the Phillipines. Spotify was...plus on the Free plan (back then) instead of stupid commercials, Spotify played similar songs....some of which were bangers and I added to my lists. I've been on a subscription plan for years now and it's well worth my hard earned money.

Phenomenal ! I've just discovered Spotify and I can't believe how much it has changed the way I listen to music. No longer do I have to worry about downloading stuff. Everything about the artist, their best work etc are all automatically categorised for you. All you need to do is add them to the play list (I didn't know we could download the playlist). Imagine my joy!) All in all, a truly FANTASTIC app ! ‚ú®Ô∏è

Can't fault this app, i can listen to and discover new music so easily and it's also a one-stop app for all my podcasts too. It's feature rich, but without being overcomplicated. I decided to pay for month's premium (another great option, you can cancel anytime) and I have decided that i will continue to pay for premium access. Just need to get a better Bluetooth speaker now to appreciate the high quality streams premium access gives you.

If I was able to give 4.5 I'd. But here's a Generous (Lol) 5. Even though Spotify practically is the best Streaming Music Service there is, especially with WORLD CLASS playlist management, you guys are literally The Benchmark, I kinda have trouble with some aspect of Spotify which makes me wanna reduce my ratings. For first, Offline Songs that are available in Mobile Devices. We can play - somehow with all the trouble in PCs but that option ain't available in here, it kinda hurts. ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Honestly Spotify is the ONLY music app I use. It's best paired with Spotify Premium which always seems to have discounts. You can do a family group, student, and other things. Spotify used to be a little better if you weren't premium, but if you listen to music ALL the time, then premium is absolutely worth it. I literally have no complaints about this app. Been using it for years. you can create different playlists and share them, you can download songs for offline listening. So much for such a little amount of money.

I didn't think that the ads or limited skips really bothered me until my brother recommended I get the paid version of Spotify. If has been a really fantastic experience. I love the freedom it brings. The wide variety of music, podcasts etc etc etc makes Spotify premium excellent value for money. I recently signed up for the Duo option so that my husband could join the world of Spotify, he is loving it as well. Really enjoy the tailor made Playlists and recommendations. It's also easy to use.

I love ALMOSTüòÇ everything about this App! From the off-line play to the song suggestion. The song suggestions are absolutely AmazingüôÜüèø. Even for someone who lives in South Africa, I must say when I look for new African talent on the block, I just simply look no further. Just wish they could improve THE sound quality just a tiny bit, to more like their competitors; because the sound quality is what we can for AFTER All.

I've looked all around. I've never found a music app as good as Spotify. There's no limit to the amount of music on here. It's all high quality sounds, fast downloads, and relatively cheap prices. I give my props to you, Spotify, and I will never choose another music app. Keep up the good work.

G'day Folks,I really enjoy Spotify & its suggested similar tunes to my likes! I buy tracks I like from iTunes and put them on my laptop,which then end up on my Classic iPod. So,I am supporting the artists! I cruise on my yacht and am out of range for 6 months of the year at a time with no phone reception,hence, my system of aquiring music on my I Pod. It also means that if I subscribed to Spotify I would not get nearly enough of the day to day usage to justify an annual subscription. Tx,D.

This app is one of the best things in my life. I used the free version for a couple of years. when I still had an ipod and illegally downloaded music but then I realised that my time is worth more and investing 9.99 a month will definitively not break the bank. I love knowing that I have ANYTHING I could ever want, the new playlists I get recommended, and knowing that I am supporting small upcoming artists and the music industry in general

So first spotify's been really good introducing me to new music and other versions of songs and great library. The only thing I wish it had to make it a lot better would be something that works like Shazam and I think YouTube has its own version that you can have it search and look up a song that's playing to give the name and artist. There is an option I'm not aware of it but it would be great not having to Shazam songs on one app and then play them on this.

I've been using Spotify since 2016, used to be a free user, but now I'm paid user. Spotify is the best music app that I've ever tried. because it has the widest range of music from A-Z. you can even find indie tunes that you won't even find anywhere else. I love the fact that it's easy to use and just always there. Love the playlists too. Keep it up.

Hey apotify... I love your app, I can find all the indie artists here and podcasts are good... I started using premium recently. But i didnt like that we have to download the entire album if we want to download even one song from it. Plus there is not particular download section, so if we play a playlist, it plays the downloaded songs offline and stuck if any song is not downloaded in the list. Please please work on it to make a user experience better, I really love the collection on your app.

it so good, and I really love it I know it annoying to find adds and everything but trust me I really do recommend because it has help me and I always try to keep myself away from everyone and the music around my ears make everything feel like old times... and I am happy with all that.

I am immensly enjoying Spotify. The fact that i have also linked it to my PS4 is an absolute bonus. I couldn 't ask for more. The only thing that is somewhat disappointing is that music I select is already pre-selected and made into a horrendous playlist.The problem with that is that the person who made the playlist hasn't the faintest clue as to the artist and their music. Its actually annoying because they leave some songs on an album off. Other than that,I don't have any complaints. 5 stars.

Definitely one of the better music options! Mainly, the one feature that's got me such a fan is the ability to listen to music even after I close the app or switch to doing something else on my phone. Although I don't think I do, it's possible that I have the free trial of the Spotify Premium right now!? If I can remember I'll look into this and update my review.

I use Spotify every day, and since the beginning, definitely worth it. I really am enjoying it. If you are going to listen to a lot of music, then premium is for you, but if you only listen to 6 songs per day, then just go for the free version. There is no problems with glitching, and song turns on immediately (or if you are on the free version, it normally starts with an ad). I therefore rate it 5 star.

It's easy to use and it's got a huge variety of different styles and genres of music. I've got the premium account and my only annoying issue with the entire app is I'd love to be able to watch the video's to the music while listening to the music. I'd happily pay a bit extra to have the video's playing. Is this something that you're working on or not yet???. I really hope you are üôè. Adding 360¬∞ digital would be great too "Sony headphones".

Pretty much can't live without Spotify. I use it every day so it's def a fairly essential app for me at this point. Also, kinda surprised how many folks are upset about the limitations of the free version of the app. Those limitations are there so artists get paid for their work. You wouldn't want to go to work all day at your job and recieve no compensation, right? Same for your fave musicians. If you wanna pick your songs/ no commercials or shuffle, you gotta pay for the premium version.

Love it and wouldn't be without it. Used every day from news and political podcasts to playlists that are endless. I have my many playlists, and each grandchild has different tastes, so theirs are saved and named, as they are too young for their own accounts. But they do listen with ads on free versions with supervision. It plays in the car with no effort on my part

Spotify has made me multiple playlists to songs that I may like from ones I listen and genrally do and this is on the free version! To everyone complaining about adds, what do you think is going to happen while you are on free. They tend to forget the amazing bits. Personaly, they don't bother me. I don't think I get that many or maybe it's cause I'm to into the jam to care. At least they come after a song and not during it. You can stream podcasts, they have some great educational ones on there

I do not believe I'd be alive today if I didnt have spotify. Signed up for premium my 3rd day using it I listen to a very wide array of music every waking hour and most of my sleeping hours. I've never wanted to listen to a song and not been able to find it on here. I can create countless playlists aside from my almost 1400 liked songs list. Then every week I get 7 daily mixes based on my listening, plus a discover weekly 30 song list . Best use of 10$ a month.

Hands down best music streaming App Nothing else comes close. I've experimented with other platforms but nothing compares. When my friends tell me that they don't use Spotify I tell them that they're absolutely crazy. The podcast options are the best too. Joe Rogan's podcast is by far the best podcasts out there in Spotify is the place to get it. I am known to be a negative person but I have nothing negative to say about Spotify except for making me use 500 words to write this review. Holler?!!

You can either spend $10 a month and buy one cd or spend $10 a month on Spotify and listen to almost any album you can possibly imagine. I'm a musician and the number of great bands I've been exposed to by Spotify I cant even count. The recommended artists page lists bands similar to those you search for. You can download albums or playlists straight to your phone so you don't even need an active WiFi connection which is especially nice for driving through spotty reception. The android app sometimes crashes

Spotify is great IF you have premium. The base version tries to annoy you every way possible with adds and a limited amount of skips, and not being able to play the songs you want to, but if you get premium, it is easily the best music app. There are so many different bundles and deals which you can use to make it cheaper, for instance taking a family plan and splitting it between six people which leaves you spending about two dollars a month. Most reviews are about the base version. Get Premium

The overall performance is good but add a high contrast theme or light mode. The premium advetisement should be a little more discrete and lessen the advertisement played after everysong is played. Let it be after 5 songs at max just like a radio service giver. I'd rate it 3 stars for now but if it is to improve, this will surely be 5 stars üåü. Edit: Still no light mode but atleast advertisements are more discrete now. Thanks, Spotify. (That price increase wasn't cool but it's fine ig)
replyContent: Hey! Thanks for sharing your thoughts. It looks like other people feel the same way about the light mode. We‚Äôd recommend adding your vote at community.spotify.com. Just head to the Menu > Ideas > Live Ideas and search for "Light Mode Toggle". You can also add an idea to our "Ideas Board" by heading to Ideas Submissions instead of Live Ideas. .

content: Spotify is a reliable place for music and podcasts, and for someone who listens to both frequently through the app, the money spend for premium is well worth it! Even if you don't want to/can't pay, listening to podcasts with adds is not a huge bother, and with music you'll have to settle for a limited number of skips and only play artists/playlists on shuffle, but it's still a great service.

Spotify has worked amazingly for me, I love how we can pick and choose songs to add to playlists, and how I can keep up with my fav artists. The pre-made playlist are wonderful and super accurate. I like spotify alot better than most of the other streaming services like pandora and Iheartradio, but one downside is all the adds there are. It will tell you it will be 30min till the next add. Then 5min later I'm getting an add for Krogers. But overall I really like it.

Generally great. I would love to see the one liked songs list that is most similar to mine. As opposed to 'people who like this also listen to this'. I'd love to see what's on that list that isn't on mine. I would like to put a timer on allowing explicit content as the smart speaker streams from my account and the kids listen to it. Is there a way of getting around this? Random somehow doesn't seem random. Same songs often come up.

My hubs and I have a shared plan, and have access to so much music and podcasts,commercial free. I also love it that I can choose the device that I want to listen to my stuff on from the app. And building personal Playlists is pretty easy, as well as finding some you wouldn't have thought you'd like. Spotify, is very convenient for us, and for the price of our account? We are very satisfied.

Can't beat the curated playlists, that's for sure. Overall UI is nice, and being able to sync with other social apps is cool. Library is near perfect, with lots of obscure artists and tracks. My one hangup is playlist creation. It's a bit counter-intuitive to move tracks around, due to extra steps. It's one thing Google Play Music did much better. Otherwise, if you can look past that, I'd recommend it 100%.

Besides the fact that you get limited skips when your not on premium, it is a great app. My whole family uses it and we have recently updated to premium. It has every song and every artist and luckily for us some Islamic Qur'an recitations too. I use it a lot during the mornings for the recitations. It's amazing. And you don't need to have a non user friendly phone (iPhone ü§£) to have all the music you want üòâ.

Best app that lets you have an entire music library in your pocket. I'm on about 1600 tracks now saved, only ever had a couple of songs not on here (No mixes either) but with the addition of podcasts I'd say it's the best service of its kind out there. ¬£15 a month for family of 6 is great value and the year in review is a fascinating insight.

I've been using Spotify since Q4 2019 and it still is my most used app. Not just on the phone but across all my devices 'cept for the PS4. The generated playlists sometimes hit my spot and if they do, the suggested songs find a place in the songs I like. It'd probably be nice to receive the requested data in html format too for those people who either do not understand how JSON works or even those who are too lazy to work with JSON (Okay, I admit it).

I see a lot of 1 star reviews but most of these are complaints that the free version doesn't offer enough. I don't see any other free services offering much more than spotify does, so I don't see the issue. And furthermore, I've never had the ad issues that some people who claim to be paying have had. Not sure if we are even using the same app when I read some of these hah. But it is my go to for music and at 50% off as a student, it is really a steal.

It was really amazing using this app. But, from past month it's showing a lot of errors while logging in and my account frequently gets logged out. And now a days it's not even accepting my phone number which I previously used for logging in. Spotify Team please help me with this issue or otherwise the app is super useful and effective. This issue is resolved now. Thanks spodify!!!!
replyContent: Hey there, we‚Äôd love to get some more info about this. We‚Äôd recommend getting in touch with our Customer Service by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us". They'll be able to check this for you.

content: Replays song I want to hear, and finds every song I want to listen to. Restart songs as often as needed to learn a song, only thru premium though. Music, podcasts, books almost anything you can think of you can listen to. Even let's you know about upcoming concerts, events from your favorite artists. New album releases, and you can even put your music out there on Spotify for others to discover you!

Yo I do love Spotify which is why I'm rating it as a 5, but for some reason theres now an older version of Spotify on this store? You can tell because the logo is using an older, less "flat" design and it's missing tons of features. It's kinda funny that some people haven't clocked on it's the wrong version haha. Either way you can get the latest ver on the Amazon store - so don't fret too much people.

I love Spotify and all the music choices,and the audio books .Premium is great that passes the ads,and gives the opportunity to listen to audio books. The one annoying thing is that there is a listening limit on the audio books, and it takes an entire month to get time back. I think that if you have premium there shouldn't be a limit on the audio books. Especially since you are already paying for that option.

Honestly I don't think I would use any other music stream service. I have Spotify premium so I can't relate with those ads everyone else is pissed about but I can say $10 a month for unlimited free music is stellar. As someone with anxiety, music helps me calm down and I can always count on this app to help me chill out. The only few suggestions I would add would be: being able to change playlist covers on mobile and a better algorithm for Discover Weekly. Moral of the story, damn good app.

Okay so I love Spotify with all my heart and I use it every day. However, I do think it is pretty unfair that free users can only look at lyrics like twice. And, taking away the ability to add stuff to queue is really not making me want to get premium. Maybe let us broke free users have what we got the app for. Music. Not songs that we can't play how we want it to hear. Still love the app, just a suggestion. Xx

Spotify has got so much better over the last few years that it has become almost impossible for me to use any other music streaming app. I just love their way of presenting their catalog.
