Their podcasts do need a little bit of work. What I would like to see, especially in podcasts, is the ability to change the playback speed and granular control on the forward and back buttons. Their premium offering makes sure that I offline access to my music. Also, I love their private session feature.

Functions better on xbox than Amazon music, a lot of ads but that's only because they offer a free version and I appreciate that. They have a lot of small artist, more than Amazon music. Amazon music you can adjust the type of volume, on Spotify you can't which is disappointing. They have kept Joe Rogan on throughout controversy, (which I know they would lose alot of money if you censored him) I appreciate that non the less. I enjoy that they have very few ads on podcast even without buying.

aside from offline still being temperamental from time to time, the music you can find here that was almost impossible to find is finally showing up. couldn't live without this app in my life. keep up the good work.

Spotify is one of the most up-to-date in the know entertainment app that's out there. Everything is covered from from music to podcast done in a way that will take you to the experiences that you might not ever find. Thank you Spotify. *** I highly recommend Spotify*** My life wouldn't be the same without it. Michael Lojko

If I didn't have premium, I would enjoy this app infinitely less. It feels like there's too much of a pay wall behind the app, but it has a great number of features and I enjoy most that are added, especially the mixes like the daylist, release radar, & blends. There's one feature that I wish I had, and that is a liked songs category that shows songs only added to liked songs. I add a bunch of songs to my liked songs to review later and add to my Playlist, but often, these songs get lost.

Music is my LIFE! I love the way a song or melody can take you to a specific moment in time or feel a specific emotion! I love this app because I can find almost anything I want at any time I want. I say "almost" because some artists won't allow their music to be used on here üôÑ I'm looking at you Garth Brooks üòÇüòî but beyond that, Spotify is amazing and I have been paying for premium for many years now! You won't be disappointed.

Free version is great if you don't mind the ads I would like to upgrade to premium but cannot find the price listed anywhere. I can't agree to terms without a price. *Update, I have had the premium version for quite some time and my family and I absolutely love this app. We can create our own playlists or listen to suggested playlists. We listen to audiobooks, news, and podcasts as well. Such great variety of listening options.
"Great app for music with amazing playlists and recommendations"

I prefer Spotify for its well-arranged similar songs, the "hide song" feature in playlists and radio, and Spotify Clips (or Playlist Previews), which show short video snippets of the best parts of songs, helping you discover music quickly. I also appreciate gapless playback and crossfade, which enhance the listening experience. I tried Tidal for its HiFi quality but left due to its lack of proper music arrangement. I still have a lot to say, but I will end it here.
I love this app, gives me every music I that inspires me most.. Danko, Bless I Spotifyüëå

This app is so amazing. I don't even have premium, I don't pay these people any money, they are providing me a free service. And the beauty of this app is unmached. I usually play playlists that have all sorts of songs, but they sometimes will play same-album songs and it's amazing. Or when it's raining, it's like they know I want the softer, more mellow songs and they PROVIDE. But besides personal experiences, the app is fairly easy to navigate.

"The Soundtrack of My Life" "Spotify isn't just a music streaming platform - it's a gateway to emotions, memories, and experiences. With its mesmerizing Discover Weekly, Release Radar, and Daily Mix playlists, Spotify has become an integral part of my daily routine. The seamless integration with social media, podcasts, and audiobooks makes it a one-stop entertainment hub.

Spotify is the best application to musics, if likely you want to perfect a lyrics of a song. I advised each and everyone to go for Spotify if you're incase you're in searched of musical platforms to stream a songs. thank you...

This is my go-to app for music. My taste in music transverses genres and I am amazed at the variety here. They're constantly adding songs and I'm even able to find TikTok jingles, remixes, musicals, unplugged, covers etc. Podcasts abound too. I quickly switched to premium, but from what I remember the free version was good too. Ads were every couple songs. My complaint is you can't rank the songs so it's difficult to judge which version is best or which songs from a band are most popular.

I love everything about Spotify. Nothing, I am serious nothing,like Sinead O'Connor's song - nothing compares to you ! I can find any song from any decade in many languages, it takes me back and forth in time, it's a travel machine üéâ. The $11 dollars subscription is nothing compared to all the music and information, podcast etc you can get with Spotify. Keep growing and stay humble üíñüôè. Gracias üòä

For me, it's been wonderful. I don't listen to radio music much at all. I usually have to search high and low for music that I might like, and those bands are few and far between, lol. Spotify has a Discovery song list feature thingy, lol, that creates a list of 30 songs, each week, that it thinks you might like, based on music that you usually listen to. At first, I didn't expect mych, but over the past several years, it has found me some of my absolute favorite bands, and I recommend it to all

I have a monthly subscription, so I get no ads, and the ability to make Playlists and share them, or edit them, or even have your family make their own accounts within your own...I dunno. I think it's pretty great considering I'm always listening to something (i haven't ventured into audiobooks because, meh and i really love them in physical format). I hope the experience for free listeners is similar or at par, so to speak.

Spotify is one of my favorite apps because it has a variety of great music, the premium feature has great benefits like no adverts, listening to music for as long as I want and I can play music when offline.

I'm almost at the end of my free trial (I will DEFINITELY be sticking with it when runs out). The amount of music available is actually INSANE!! I can't get over the amount of songs that are available. I've discovered music from the late 90's & early 00's that I'd forgotten about I feel like a teenager again. No complaints whatsoever I love the app it's easy to navigate & use.
Great app!! Easy to use and navigate.

I love Spotify, but... Recently, it just seems buggy. Most of the songs don't play when they're supposed to. It's just kinda broken... But that's okay üòå And a feature that I loved, was when you'd search up songs and albums and it would just loop those songs, but I think it got removed? I don't really know. But, I still love the app. It still a great music app üòÅ Edit: THEY FIXED IT YAYYY! <3

Really like Spotify, music and podcasts all together ‚ù§ would recommend to anyone a vast library of media,all for you and you can subscribe and have a lot more options.Two years later still a great app.
love my Spotify ~ it's my go to music app. I play everyday.

Math doesn't lie ! You get every feature & function that the other 3 contenders offer, and then some with Spotify ! Loads & installs fast and smooth on every platform I've seen so far. This music app is by far the easiest to use, especially with all the features it offers up. Spotify's expanded library is second only to the Library Of Congress, really, check it out ! But the knock out punch it delivers to the other services is it's price, more bang for the buck at a price they can't match !

I can't count how many times I lost playlists in the past when a computer would die or something like that. Spotify maintains my playlists, Recommends tracks along the lines of what you add to each playlist making it possible to discover new music with ease. I absolutely love the yearly round up of songs I've played. It's always surprising to see how many times my favorites get played. For what I pay I'm extremely happy with the premium service. I hope Spotify is around for a long time.
Love listening to music and podcasts on Spotify.

I can't live without my Spotify. It's my favourite app and it's brilliant at song recommendations and compiling playlists, at discovering new artists and music.... It's an essential app. It's your Google of music!!!! My only downside is that I wasn't given the option to choose my username. How can I get my own username, Spotify? I would like to share playlists etc... But can't really do it with a super long alphanumeric coded user üòâ

No matter where I have traveled, thus far, I have been able to search for singers in the regions traveled. Additionally, I can get all my saved lists and still collaborate with my friends, sharing my new musical finds. And I have really enjoyed all the podcasts. I'm glad I switched from that other big name music system. I feel I have fewer limits on the Spotify network. Keep up the great work!

Great music app because I can find any song I ask for and right now I'm going through a phase of scream rappers and there are so many there I just add as many as I can to my playlist. But there is one problem that has occured twice. I had a liked playlist of 2,552 and I logged on in the morning and it told me my account was already in use when no one else knows my email or password, not even my mum. I thought it was a glitch so I waited for 2 days and then tried logging on but it didn't work

It is the best app there is for listening to music, the premium rates are not something high end and the quality after premium is just wow. Was shocked to see the rating and reviews, literally jumped out of bed when I saw 2.7. People need to prioritize with so many apps. If 150 for a month is much, but subscriptions accordingly. The content, podcasts, songs from all over. People can't get bore with so much audio Information. Subscriptions are reality now. So prioritize what to spend money on.

(Im rating this 5 stars so that people can see one of the bad parts of this app) The adding of random songs into my personalized playlists is annoying. Why even make a PERSONALIZED playlist if you're just gonna add other songs that I dont wanna hear??? It's super unnecessaryüòë. It's just like ordering a burger but with no cheese and pickles, but they add a cucumber and milk in it so that maybe you'd like it.

10/10 Would listen again. I love that they added audio books. I love being able to easily switch between music then a book. I think that there should be more listening hour included with the premium or the option to just buy the book outright, but that said. I think it is awesome to be able to listen to good selection of books with what I was already paying for just music.

*** Update. Seems to have been fixed. *** Have used for a long time now. Since a recent update, can't get through more than a couple songs on my phone without it stuttering and buffering regardless if I am on wifi or 5g. I have to close the app and wait a few seconds before opening it again and maybe it will be fine, maybe it won't. I've fiddled with settings, uninstalled and reinstalled, restarted the device. Nothing. Keeps stuttering.

This app is perfect by the vast music library, and recommendations. But I want a update Spotify, kindly add a friends feature in it, which could help me to be able to share some playlist and songs to my friends without leaving the app, you can also add a chatting section in which we can talk and you will get greater screentime. I hope everything goes well.

I‚Äôve been using Spotify for two years and have really enjoyed it. The DJ beta feature is a great idea and adds something new to the music experience, but I think it could be improved. Right now, it feels more like a shuffle or radio DJ rather than a personal one. It would be better if it could smoothly transition between songs, like a real DJ set. Adding an option for an AI DJ that creates a club or bar vibe could make it even more exciting.

I've been using Spotify for probably 6 or so years now. I've literally watched this app mature, it's been wild. Let's be frank. Premium is worth it. Listen to your favorite songs, as much as you like, whenever you like, in high quality. Make whatever playlist you want, how ever many you like, and without a single ad. I've also gone from buying premium for myself to buying premium duo for my wife and myself. The shared playlist idea is a VERY nice touch, since she likes my music, but wants hers.

Ive been a Spotify user for over 7 years and I've always been more than impressed. Premium is well worth the money (the cost of 2 coffees a month, treat yourself) the library is much larger and more complete than other audio streaming apps, it supports small artists and creators well, the algorithm is spot on and gets better and better the more you interact and tell it what you like to hear, and you can save endless ammounts of data to listen to offline I wouldn't dare use anything else üé∂

Wonderful app, normally. I have never had a complaint about this app, and I've been using it for years. The most recent update, however, has caused serious issues when listening with Bluetooth in my car. It won't play unless the app is open (never used to be that way). Now I'm unable to skip songs unless it's directly through the app - not good when driving. I pay for the app, so hopefully this will be fixed asap. Otherwise never any complaints.

This app is brilliant! I love the fact that you just guessed what songs I wanted on my Playlist! I was putting together all of the songs on Smallville, and, after adding only two songs, I received a message saying that you had mixed it up with other songs that, believe it or not, appeared on the series! Only complaint: there is only one Remy Zero album on there, otherwise, I love it!

Top notch!!! But I can't understand why I get the "couldn't load lyrics" for most my songs. It wasn't like that before. I always have the lyrics to every song I play until suddenly, I stopped getting them but getting that annoying remark instead. It's frustrating! I hope you guys will look into it. And please, it's not a network signal issue. Anyway, besides all that, the app is about the best music platform out there. Beautiful interphase, very easy to navigate. And top notch sound quality.

It's got a great library of music. Easy to download songs. Only gripe is a minor one with the option button next to each song. It's hard to press. Sometimes I end up restarting a song or move the track pad too much, while trying to press the three vertical dots. UPDATE: Haven't noticed but they fixed the issue I had with the option button. Way easier to press now. 5 Stars!

Finally, an app that has all the music I want, right at my fingertips, without having to delve deep in searching and taking forever to find a single song like on the Amazon music app and pandora. Also, y'all should add a feature to read the lyrics for the entire song instead of having to show for a few seconds and then switching to the info of the song.

Bluetooth stopped working for about a week. I tried deleting the app & re-installing.... did nothing. Was ready to switch to a new audio streaming platform, but suddenly.... it's all good. Everything works properly again. Nice to see developers that fix a problem for a change. (BTW - I pay monthly for the "Premium" access... so I haven't heard an ad in over 4 years. For real. Pretty dope for $11 a month.)

I've been using Spotify Premium since it came to the US, and love it! The app is awesome overall, but there are a few things that I'd love to see happen.. Mainly, I want to manage my playlists in the app, instead of on the computer. Why isn't there a drag and drop reorder option for playlists in the app? Being able to move playlists and folders around, as well as in and out of folders makes a big difference when you have a lot of lists. Oh and I've tried Stations and love it too. üòÅ

I am using Spotify all day every day, and it never let me down except for not having some songs in their Sortiment at times. Nevertheless, features like the discover weekly playlists, genius behind the lyrics, or artist radios really help to find new music on the regular and the easy to use interface is really approachable for everybody. One little point of feedback would be that it would be great if you could also save songs to your SD card and not only to your phone storage. I heard it was possible before, but apparently this feature is not available anymore in the newest version.

I love Spotify and use it for pretty much everything. However, the mobile app stopped working for me, for some reason. I have no clue as to why. Whenever I played any playlist, it would stop playing after the one song. And when I tried to pause and unpause, it jumped to the middle of the song. Luckily, a simple uninstall/reinstall fixed it. I think my app somehow got corrupted, I guess. Oh well, back to jamming out during quarantine!

Awesome recommendations. Managing playlists is easy, especially when I find new music that I like. I even like the basic version better than the premium, because I have more time to try something new instead of fixating on that one song. I can easily flip and switch through different genres. Streaming quality is good. Playlist collaborations between my friends and I is a lovely feature. The range of music is vast, and there is always something new to discover from other eras or countries, even moods and events. Switching between devices is easy, too.

Don't know how anyone could NOT like Spotify. EDIT: I've had Spotify from the beginning on a Windows machine. It was flawless for years. About six months ago I went to using a Bluesound Node 2i with Android to control it. Worked good but not great. Now, it is obviously broken and almost unusable. I've tried rebooting, reinstalling and anything else I could think of with little success. I'm hoping this can be fixed soon. Thank you! EDIT #2: Update Fixed It. Thank You!

I love Spotify. No other music service comes close. The app, however, has constant loading issues. It's infuriating sometimes when I just want to listen to music and I have to wait several minutes for the app to decide to work. Just fix that and there'll be no complaints. *EDIT* Load time has improved in recent updates, but could still use some work.
Easy to use. Huge range of music

it's really nice having all my music here. I wish I could export my music onto a list, ti make a transfer between services easier. I also wish that the syncing between devices work better. It's pretty neat, but I can't controll it on my lock screen. It doesn't show which song it is. So I end up having to unlock my screen to look at what song is playing. Other than that, I really love using Spotify.

The data base is seemingly endless. The sound quality consistent across all devices that I have utilized. The UI is essentially flawless. 7/19 Ran into an issue with my release radar. Customer service was awesome. Addendum: Nearly two years later, as a avid lover of a broad range of musical genres, and a always curious explorer of new artists, I would not want to even think about not having this service. The depth and breadth of the data base is unmatched and the price is beyond excellent.

I have always listened to music almost constantly, and Spotify was definitely a game changer. I can easily make playlists, or just click on a song and go to a radio based on it (or an artist). I am quickly able to discover new music and it's great for offline use, too, since you can save as many playlists as you'd like for offline use. One suggestion, though, might be to allow an "archive" feature for playlists we no longer use but would still like to keep for later use.

The music selection and service is great, the UI has been updated and much better than before. For Android auto, the UI is too complicated for driving situations. it should be similar to the WebOS version, showing favorites first. we shouldn't have to type anything or go in sub-menus to find music. Also, the most important is to show ONLY the downloaded music when there is no internet connection.

Like the app with premium. Without premium it's nearly unusable because of the ads. User interface has gotten worse over time. It's less intuitive and clunkier than 3 years ago. Multi device synchronization does not always work and rarely the app crashes spontaneously. Also rarely the app forgets all downloaded songs, without freeing up the disk space. Song recommendations are good and I really like the playlist radio functionality. The available amount of music is really large, almost every artist is on Spotify these days. One feature I wish for is being able to download individual songs. Currently you can only download entire playlists or your whole library. All in all a good music streaming app.

I love spotify. It's great and affordable. However, the past month it wont let me use most of the settings. It just says "unavailable now" but I pay for premium. I didnt mind at first, I knocked it up to a glitch but it's been a month and I still cant use features I pay for which is disappointing. I'm still leaving 5 stars though because I've had spotify for years and this is the first issue I've ever had.
replyContent: Hey, thanks for the feedback! We‚Äôd like to get some more info about the issue you're experiencing. If you have the time, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service. You can find them by heading to support.spotify.com and searching "Contact Us".

content: 10/25/18 Update: Since last two (or three) updates the list of devices available doesn't work properly. Sometimes it says I'm playing in a device while listening in another, sometimes it doesn't respond if I try to switch to another device, mainly my WiFi speakers. In past versions app worked perfect and even the design was better before. It's one of the best apps ever made. Awesome catalogue and it's legal music.

I love Spotify. I've been a premium user for years, and I haven't had many issues. Nothing has been able to find music I like better than Spotify. I've tried using YouTube Music as an alternative, and it just doesn't auto-generate playlists at all outside of new songs. Recently I decided to download and stream in the highest quality, and the app was intuitive enough to re-download songs I already had in higher quality. That's surprisingly intuitive.

I'm not a fan of streaming services. I'm one of those audio snobs who spend tons of money on the right equipment, and thus despise lossy audio formats. I still do, but at least I can stand Spotify Premium's streaming quality. The service is great to create playlists with friends, and to listen to your music anywhere, no matter the device. Love the Android app's design, and it never fails on my Nexus 4. I can't be a more satisfied user and customer.

I'd probably die without Spotify. At the very least, I would lose my sanity. I don't like the latest update though, where they made the user interface with the library and search buttons very tiny and stuck to the bottom of the screen. It's very hard to read. 6/2020: Still paying for premium. I've never stuck with a service this long before. It is still fantastic. They rolled back that hideous update in my previous response.

I love the music selection. Can find brand new songs to songs that came out in the 50s and back. The only thing I can say bad is when I set to listen to my music offline. For some reason after the last update it turned off and I had to redownload all songs to listen to when Im not in a wifi or 3g area. And sometimes when I want to listen to a song even ones I have saved it doesn't play them or takes forever to play them. Which is very frustrating when you want to listen to a certain song.

Just think of a song, genre, feeling, whatever and at the touch of a button you have thousands of songs to choose from, the options are limitless and Spotify makes it so easy to listen to your favorite songs and find ones you'll love, they have a amazing things here, love it. Would be awesome if there was a way to organize playlists into folders!!

I love spotify! Its definitely my go to music app. I used the free version for years and finally got to a place where I can afford the unlimited version. I don't think I could ever go back! The selection of artists, different radio playlists, the podcasts, and the option to see songs' lyrics makes this the perfect music app for me. I Highly Recommend!

Lately it has been glitching a lot, stopping my music when I'm not using my phone and I'm a Spotify premium user. It shows its playing but it's not and when i click to pause the music starts again and then pauses. I thought maybe it would get fixed but now I'm beginning to think I might be the only one with this problemü§£ Could you look into it? Thanks!

Thank u for fixing my issue. I didn't expect spotify to give support(a human not bot) at 2 am and they fixed my issue by giving me instructions, I am very very impressed ‚ù§Ô∏è.I appreciate for bringing back the 'move slider' and 'replay' option to the free subscription ‚ù§Ô∏èüëçüèª It would be nice to put a Feedback option in the app in "About"

I've had Spotify for years, and even though premium is over priced, I feel like it's the only way to truly enjoy Spotify. When it's free Spotify, it can be pretty frustrating. But it's the only platform I've ever used to listen to music, as I enjoy how customizable playlists are, how easy it is to navigate the app, and I enjoy the countless amounts of playlists that Spotify makes. Either specifically for you or Tailored to an emotion, or to a playlist.

I've been a premium user for at least 5 years now and I love Spotify. The app functions smoothly and it is nice to be able to listen to my music in the car without eating up my data. However, depending on the quality that you download songs with, it potentially takes up a ton of storage. I was very excited when they raised the download limit from 3,333 to 9,999 songs. It was a change that most probably didn't notice, but the few of us with huge playlists really appreciate it.

You give ads and say it's a 30 min ad free listening period but honestly, it's only about ten mins before you get another ad. I've had premium, I loved it. I still love the free version but please, if you say it's 30 mins without an ad, make it thirty, not ten. Thank you. Not only that. But the newest update keeps turning my music off randomly and won't let me turn it on when I'm in a Wi-Fi area where I'm connected. Its really pissing me off. I just want to listen to my damn music. Thanks.

Large selection, clean interface and easy to use. I like that you can make songs available offline, and change them as you see fit. My only feedback is the lack of well curated playlists. EDIT: Spotify has gotten really good at creating playlists based on my listening history. I discovered many new artists and songs because of their discover weekly and even last year's "ones that got away" list. It has recently been giving me.trouble where it just stops playing. Will try to reinstall.

I'm changing my review to reflect the happy news that default "shuffle play" is gone! Hooray! I hate shuffle play. My musical enjoyment and knowledge has increased significantly thanks to Spotify. Not everything is there, but you can always find fantastic music, both new and old! Also since my last review, more than a few old releases have been made available on Spotify. If you want a random bunch of songs, just use an existing playlist, or create your own.

does what it supposed to do, and does it well. only had minor problems with unplayable song, but probably the problem is with Spotify server.   Thanks to Spotify, I've discovered so many songs and singers in few weeks more than what I discover in the past 15 years.  I really like the fact that I can jump from one singer to another on the same song, just to find my favorite version. I discover singers that are not so mainstreamed, singers that are not so popular on tv or radio, but really have good voices. My music library was basically frozen since I was 30 or so, was too lazy to find new music and not really enjoying what the mainstream media has to offer. But, hey thanks Spotify, they're all in the past :-D

I love this app, BUT it could be better. Being able to view a song with the album cover and everything but not being able to listen to a different song simultaneously is a bit of a bummer. If you could edit other people's playlists after downloading them would be a plus, I don't always like every song they have. Same with weekly playlists, or made just for you. Having a dislike button so that song doesn't play again would be nice. Other than that, its a very good app

Best music service! I've had Spotify premium ever since it released in North America. At first, it was quite buggy, but they were open to suggestions to improve. The app had several annoying issues then, but I don't have issues at all anymore! Spotify has the largest selection of music; almost everything I seek is there, even underground stuff. Tons of podcasts, too! People with these random issues in the reviews need to reinstall. I'm using a Samsung Note 10+.

music, make playlist, easy ways to discover new music from home and around the world. download tracks for offline listening. audio books, podcast, guided meditation, language lessons. improved menu for browsing and searching. Only problem i have is, when you shuffle your library it tends to repeat the same few songs. maybe I have to much music put that's not the point.

One of my top used apps... #1 for music. Huge selection of podcasts on every topic including personal development and finance... on top of curated playlists (many updated weekly) and artist radio stations. My only gripe is that you can't find everything you are looking for, especially if you are a real audiophile, looking for high quality versions of your favorites. So don't get rid of your music collection just yet.

I used Spotify free for perhaps 2 years. It was mostly good. All the ads were incredibly obnoxious and dramatic, but besides that the app was very good. I didn't mind not being able to pick or skip songs. I just made the jump to premium and I'm really blown away at how much more the app has to offer now. I just wish I could see all songs I've liked in my library by artist without following thw artist. I'm not following someone who I only liked one specific song. But it's a fantastic product.

Update: Thank you! So much happier with this app now!!! Still no option to block explicit songs - surely adding a toggle for this feature can't be too difficult - for a subscription I pay a fair bit of money for - I would appreciate being able to use it around my kids without worry. Also, the shuffle feature is glitchy. The music selection is great but overall the app is not worth the subscription fee.

This is most definitely the best music app out there! I've tried pretty much all of them and Spotify seems to combine all the best features of the other apps, but in one app! You can have Spotify curate a playlist based on songs, moods, or artists, just like Pandora... But so so much better because you can also choose a specific artist, song, genre, mood, and so much more. It really is the king of music apps, in my opinion. üòªüòªüòª

I've had spotify for a long time and I love it. Im not a big fan of the revised library UI, it'd be fine if it rememberd my filter choice (it does on occasion, but not always?). The app is also, at random times, unable to load in android auto until the app is force quit. Seems to to occur when I've previously played on a Bluetooth device before connecting to Android Auto. I reset my phone at one point, but this problem is still there. Other than that it's a great service.

I really Spotify. It is very stable compared to other music services, Spotify Connect is great, works fine with Google products such as the integration in Maps, the clock... The only thing that I don't enjoy that much is the audio quality, It isn't bad but I am an audiophile and I am not satisfied with it, but that's a minor complain. The music library it's ok, but not as good as the YouTube Music one. I don't like the music recommendations, I always get the same. Overall, I recommend it. üëåüèª

Update 3/11/19; Having some issues with Bluetooth controls and Spotify crashing. didn't have this issue before the most recent update both to the app and my phone. Not sure which one is causing the issue. Original review: Amazing service. I have been using Spotify since it's original launch several years ago. It has only improved. I don't even use itunes or anything anymore. If you love music, you will love Spotify.

I like it, but I'm having a problem, you said 6 skips every hour? i only have 2 skips and then boom gone, then the next hour, I won't be able to play the music i want, this thing always pops out. "Choose songs to play again Tomorrow" Bro. I'm suffering, I can't listen to the songs i want, this has been happening since the start of July, please fix it, i dont know why if i waste all my skips, I won't be able to choose a song anymore. i swear i will curse here right now.

Not only does the music stop after a song or two, but there's no edit for playlists. My android can't edit the arrangement of songs in a created playlist, but I'm told that the iPhone and ipod can. Need this fixed. Edit: All of the problems that I talked about had been fixed a long time ago. Forgot I wrote the first review. This app is my go-to now.

I've been using the free version for five years and then four years of premium. It is absolutely worth the price for the easy streaming and offline listening service. They are up-to-date with all the new songs, and they even have podcasts & audio books! (What?!) This is my one and only music app. Worth every penny for such a great app with no buffering! (Sorry iTunes).

It has great content but it's so full of bugs. I have it on my laptop and an old phone and new phone. All very buggy. Crashes a lot. Loads slowly. Lags at start up. Tells me I'm offline when it's not. Tells me no internet connection when connected to Wi-Fi and all other devices are working. UPDATED 2021: Its really amazing but it's still lacking the updates that will fix it. Updated 2022: it's epic. Very stable app and it's unequaled compared to other apps.

Update: Love it! Especially the family plan! Old review from 2014: I absolutely love this app. I give 4 stars and not 5 because of one feature - not being able to change tracks like you can on the desktop version. If I have a Playlist created, I HAVE to shuffle play it. Sometimes I just want to listed yo one specific song and it's too much trouble. Other than that, I personally don't mind the advertisement. Awesome app!

Been using this app for more than a year but just too lazy to write review, until now. So, I'm too lazy to make my own playlist, and thanks to Spotify, i don't have to. Plus, i get to know new songs, there're also audiobooks, podcasts, etc. For me, the monthly subscription is worth it because this app is really helpful. I don't have to stressed about choosing songs and i can easily pop up a playlist.

I understand the need for ads in free version, but they could be spaced a bit further apart, especially in the sleep/meditation genre. And searches could be less particular & more wide-range. Also, the ability to search different Spotify areas would be helpful; Songs, Playlists, etc......the ability to search 'My Library'. Otherwise, it's GREAT! I hear what I choose, the layout is perfect, can use other apps at same time & can categorize my saved songs with a method that works for me.

Best music streaming app. It's worth the $10 a month for premium. However lately, I think the app updates have bugs or maybe it my account specifically. The app will randomly shut down and I have to reopen it to continue using, it's especially frustrating when I'm driving. I'd say it would happen evry 10 to 15 minutes. Also when I put my saved songs on shuffle, it doesn't shuffle all of them. I have over 2000 songs and it will maybe give me a shuffles queue of like 30 or 40.

Almost every single 1 star review I've read is about the free version, which has ads, forces you to listen to songs, and limits your skips. I've been a subscriber for years and it's most definitely worth it. I've tried other services' free trials and Spotify beat them by a long shot (albeit this was years ago when I was exploring options like Amazon prime music, Google music, R-something, etc). Spotify has a great selection of music and an intuitive UI. You won't find a free music service anywhere near as good as Spotify (or any other paid service), guaranteed.

The app is very nicely organized and browsing and discovering new music is easy and stress-free. It recommends different songs to you based on the ones you have saved, and, more often than not, the songs have been spot on for my tastes. Definitely worth the premium membership because I can download the music to my phone, listen to it offline, and don't have to listen to random, annoying ads. I totally recommend it as an amazing music app.
Nice app to listen the musics .!!!!!! I love it forever....‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

In my humble opinion, this app may be the best and most reliable when it comes to finding and managing your music playlists. Then again I haven't used many of the other apps like Spotify. Without premium however, the ads can become extremely annoying and repetitive, so it is either best to buy premium or suffer through an barrage of poorly made ads, I dont mind this, but can be a deal-breaker for some I imagine.

I absolutely love this app. Spotify continues to improve, listens to its customers, and is easy to navigate. Maybe incorporate a click and drag feature on the phone app for songs? That way we can add Playlists to other Playlists. Considering I have about 30 of these lists, that's more of a personal problem. I've definitely gotten out of hand üòÇüòÇ. But seriously, this is THE BEST song/radio/podcast app by far.

I love my Spotify premium, and I've had it for nearly 2 years. Within the past 6 months, my app keeps randomly pausing. I followed their instructions, did a clean install, turned off "optimize battery usage". Still happens, even on pre-downloaded playlists. The past week it pauses at least once a song. What's the point of paying $15/mo for an app that doesn't work as well as free apps or radio?

Love the app. Near seamless transition between audio output with Spotify connect, really good developer base, and amazing selection. I have exactly one (picky) complaint regarding Spotify with Roku TV. The volume control is really strange and a single push up or down on the phone translates to drastic change on the TV. I have to use the remote to control the volume correctly.

Long-time user here. Spotify has become my hope source of digital music in the past few years and it's only getting better! I love most of the features. <3 The new "canvas" feature has some potential in generating ambience, but would be a lot better if the transitions were synced with the beat. You can already detect the bpm of a song. Use it! ;) it might be good 1:1, but i'd experiment with other ratios too. Cheers!

There isn't a single music service that is even half as intuitive! Everything feels right in the world again. It's like coming home! If you're looking to explore streaming apps for the first time, my advice is just skip everything else & choose Spotify. Nothing comes close! Edited 2/26/22: After a short break saving $ by trying some free trials, once again it's like coming home. Now that Spotify's added lyrics, nothing's missing. My only gripe is to seperate podcasts from the music entirely.

I love Spotify honestly. We have a family plan for everyone in our house which is a super great deal. With subscription you can download any/all of your playlists so long as your phone has room for long road trips where signal is garbage. Also being able to hop from phone, to computer, to xbox all on the same song near-seamlessly with a simple click is pretty cool.

I love the app. So many cool features to enjoy. But hey you know what would also be cool? If you guys made like an alarm clock feature. Where you can set your alarm clock in Spotify so it'll play one of your own playlist and stuff! I know it's already possible (I think) to set a Spotify song as your alarm tune on some devices but not on all of them. That would be so cool :) Have a nice day!

Unfortunately dub it as Spotiyaf only because the app seems to crash often and or get hung up. Even with a new phone. Might have to do with online VS offline streaming and quality. However have set to default. Paid version is worth it , just wish it didn't hang up or crash as often. I do love the variety and playlists that it can create from music you have in your library. Adds new music as well so if you like it, you can add to your library which I often do.

I can truly say that Spotify is the only app I can think of that has their stuff together. It provides me with what I expect from a music streaming app such as playlists, access to all music, and so on. Spotify creates playlists on their end and suggests them based on your listening habits. I also appreciate the ability to "download" and listen offline for if I am on a plane. This app also features live video clips playing on some songs. I keep finding more songs everyday with this app!

okay I have made like 3 accounts and their all messed up, like WHATTT?? it only lets me play a second of a song in my playlist...but it works on my tablet for some reason? I tried to restart my phone to fix it but it didn't work. then I tried it again STILL DIDN'T WORK. so I made another account, it worked for some days until it did the same thing on my first account. then I made another one, a few minutes in BOOM IT STARTS DOING THE SAME DAMN THING. fix your app PLEASE.. (I luv the app tho)

This app has reinvigorated my love for music. It makes music of all kinds accessible, portable, and easy. I've discovered so many new bands through Spotify. They curate special playlists for you including a 'Discover Weekly.' This has been my one and only music app and database. I've created many unique playlists. I really hope Spotify never goes under - because this has changed the game for music lovers everywhere.

Edited review: we have been members for over 8 years and seen how Spotify has evolved to master the music streaming demands of internet users. I love the option to have separate playlists, and the freedom to download music to your device without restriction is amazing. Thank you! I see no reason to use any other service (except Sirius and Pandora for the car, of course). I have the ad free account. Love it.

It'd be great to be able to edit playlists order within the app without the need to do so on the PC version, just as iOS users can do it. Other than that, is such a nice app! Update: latest version for Nougat has a bug wich doesn't allow the user to interact with the pop-up menu of the options. It doesn't let me add songs to playlist whatsoever!

Love the app,love the personalized app-made playlists, love that I can download them and create my own playlists, also love the "my favorites" folder, although I would like to know if I can move the songs to a different order? I didn't find a way to do it or if it's even possible. The prices are very affordable for what you get and also the variety. ü§ó

I'll leave the old ui thing have improved so much over the past few years I even forgot about the bad review. Glad I kept using the service! Spotify changed the UI and now it takes up a lot more screen space when browsing songs and it also no longer conforms to the Android standard look and feel. personally I don't like the new look. There is also no option for browsing local files anymore so I can't just add them to a Playlist or queue, I need a whole different app for songs I own.

I've used Spotify premium for a number of years since I moved from iTunes due to synching issues with my iPhone. Now I'm on Android, I've seen the app improve more and more with features such as 'behind the music' for a few tracks. This gives you some insight into the song you're listening to. The most listened to tracks of the year is also a great playlist feature for re-discovering music you've listened. Brilliant app Spotify team. Well done and thank you!

So why 4 stars? I'm a premium subscriber and it's worth every penny. But everytime I skip a track, the new track will stutter for just a split second with much less bass, then resume as normal. As such skipping tracks is horrible and breaks me away from my absorption! I've factory reset my OnePlus One to no avail. Minor really, because its a kickass music platform and otherwise excellent app. Edit Aug 19: I've experienced no bugs for a long time, the app is user friendly and has great features.

I have been using your app since 2013-4 I believe. Paid subscriber. I love the app. Can't live without it. Music is an everyday thing for me. But there was just a small issue recently. While casting the music from my smartphone (sony) to an android tv (sony) The volume jumps up all of sudden from say 16 up to 80 or a 100%. First time It scared the hell out of me. Happend a number of times already. Would like to ask the devs to have a look at this problem. Either the tv or the phone apps.Thx!

7 years since last used as got that frustrated with the constant and numerous problems. I must say that the improvements are vast and impressive such that within a couple of weeks I subscribed to Premium. Loads of early accessible songs and I love the feature that automatically plays similar artists. It can be used free of charge but for a couple of quid a week I am now more than happy to pay for this. Highly recommended

UPDATE: I used to love Spotify but all it seems to do now is freeze & crash- I'm on android(Samsung Galaxy).I don't know how many times I've had to uninstall and reinstall but it never seems to solve the problem.I also don't like how I can no longer see how many tracks are in a playlist.I wish Spotify could sort the issues out cuz it used to be ace! Spotify is part of my life - I couldn't live without it! Every time I think something can be improved, they do it in their next update. Love it.

UPDATE: Great program. I love being able to listen to pretty much whatever I want. There are several foreign music selections that I can't find, but I have been able to find more than I expected. I have Premium now but the free app used to have trouble shuffling - I select "Shuffle Play" it will shuffle the first fifteen or so tracks (out of 1000) and intersperse those fifteen tracks with random selections throughout the playlist. Not sure if that is still an issue but Premium is fabulous.

Have been using spotify for over 3 years and am still consistently more than satisfied with every day I use it. I listen to music for at least an hour a day, in the car, at home, at work, and spotify never fails to keep me up to date with new music specifically tailored for my taste. Most impressive is their incredible algorithm that throws together playlists in seconds that I always end up loving. The best part is, all the songs are new to me & I listen to music a lot, from Jazz to rap to rock.

Been using this app for a few years now, and it has totally revolutionised my listening experience. An abundance of music choice for any time of the day or any mood. Easy to use for the gym, great android auto integration, simple UI, a great selection of premade playlists, and smart playlists based on your listening habits! My only qualm is that it can be a storage space heavy (even when you haven't "downloaded to device") so Android users with smaller storage spaces might find themselves having to go into the app data to delete data frequently, but otherwise arguably the best app I have on my device

Spotify is hands down the very best of all the popular music apps by far. You can make playlists specifically full of only and/or all of the songs you want to hear, & that's exactly what you get! Unless you want otherwise. The radio station- type feature gives you a better option than Pandora's sad attempt at providing similar music to what you chose for a station model. The podcast choices are great, too. And even the basic free version is worth having because the ads are so short. <3

This is a great app, I dont have alot of complaints to say about it other than a weird bug where it sometimes pops up and plays my recent playlist randomly. I've woken up at midnight twice only to hear one of my playlists screaching a song on it. I've tryed uninstalling and reinstalling it but unfortunately it dosen't seem to be helping much.

Edit: after removing background optimization from the app via Android settings I stopped having the issue before. Has great support for all my devices: PC, Android, smart watch, and Google home, and they all work together. Would be 5 stars if it didn't randomly stop playing music once in a while when in background, and if I was able to play my folders on mobile (only works on PC).

I was really enjoying the uninterrupted music of the last six months or so. Suddenly, after these last two new updates my phone cuts off every three songs. I don't pay $15 a month to have my phone cut off every three songs... Edit! It's fixed. If you have this problem try uninstalling and reinstalling. (I didn't delete my music.) Edit... it's now doing it again. May be time to find a better music app. Edit 11/28/23: The app and my phone get along great now! Thanks!
easy to use, wide variety of songs,,love the playlist function

By far, the most comprehensive music streaming app that I have had the (ongoing) user experience of working with. Extensively. [It should be noted that the aforementioned statement is one that I have made, only after maintaining and frequently utilizing a minimum of a 30-Day subscription to Google Play Music, Pandora Premium and Amazon Music apps].

This is the first multi. media app I have used and am impressed with the variety of music, etc that is available. Any glitches I am sure are do to the user, not the apps performance, as I am not at all tech savy. I wish I knew if showing lyrics is an option, and if so how do I enable this feature. If it is not available I have to drop 1/2 star.

By far The Best music app available. Has everything I could possibly want, all my favorite underground artists, old skool, and songs you can't find anywhere else. Anytime I have searched for a song and couldn't find it here, it magically appears within a couple days! And the auto generated weekly playlists tailored just for me are always right on point with new tracks that keep my music fresh so I never get bored. They even notify me of new releases. Truly Amazing!!

The Soundtrack To My Life! ...This app gives me a lifetime of music in one place. Sound quality is clear and robust. Great on my phone, PC and PS5. Crossfade feature works flawlessly. I do wish the app offered more music videos. It would be an awesome feature if premium members could have a huge library of music videos, old and new ...and we're able to make playlist. I would love that!!! That aside Spotify is hands down the best music app in the game!

Great app. I spend,on average, about 10 hours a day on the road and use Spotify in both offline and online mode. At night, I listen to podcasts. I literally have the app locked into the background so I never close it. Honestly, if they charged $5 more a month, I would still pay for premium. My last review was 3 stars due to certain features missing and all of them were added. However, if you're looking for features, it would be nice to see podcasts auto-download.

I pay ¬£9.99 per month for a service. A service which is supposed to provide me with the ability to stream music when and wherever I want. Don't get me wrong, the array of music is great and the features however, every time I try to use this app initally, it will either freeze, not load anything or crash. This has only been since the last few new updates and it's driving me up the wall. Really putting me off using Spotify

Absolutely revolutionary! In a time when we aren't easily impressed by a new portal to our favourite music or even a way to find new artists and songs based on our tastes, Spotify seems to be, so far in my experience, a virtually-complete library of our musical works...not to mention much more affordable as an offline solution than data overages!! To be honest, keeping in mind I have hundreds of songs purchased on iTunes, as most people do or have done, I used to illegally download my music - I feel better listening to music on this app knowing compensation makes it's way to the artists that raise our very lives!! Listening to music this way is easier, seamless even, and the quality and volume are perfect everytime :) Brian R.E.B.

imagine a utopia where you could carry around 95% of all time's recorded music in your pocket, & create an infinite number of precise playlists for it, all for the price of a movie ticket a month. almost heaven, no? what if i told you you could have if now, just by downloading this app? one of my only complaints: it doesn't let you combine two playlists into one. but overall, spotify is by far the best music-collecting & listening experience i've ever had. a superior product doesn't exist.

Spotify is mostly good. The app has many features, most of which I am sure I am not familiar. However, as a basic user, I have come across some features that I like and some that I dislike. I love playlists and the ability to search. It is fantastic. I can have favourites, driving, kids and workout playlists. It really helps me to live my music. The other feature that I use is podcasts. However, it needs to pick up from where you left off, not start from the start.

Indispensable subscription (Premium)...amazing quality and speed of streaming, even when off my WiFi. I use this service a lot when driving, and if you have even a decent 4g signal, it will still stream at a very high level. The library is huge, and the navigation is intuitive. I just wish there were more traditional Christian hymns...not just the rockified "contemporary" versions. There are some, but they're buried deep under other categories. This service is highly secular.

I love Spotify, but there are a couple things I have to say. For one, there's a bug where if I'm making a new playlist (which I tend to do quite a bit) that causes it to stop when I'm using the search bar to add songs. It stops the song that's currently playing, and sometimes rewinds it completely, as well as not even letting me search the songs I needed in the first place. Please fix this soon. Secondly, I would greatly appreciate it if you added a "See Album" feature like the See Artist button, because I tend to sort my songs by album, and I'm sure others might find this useful as well. Thank you.

An indispensable app for me. It's just so easy to use and has almost all the music I could want - "almost" because I occasionally couldn't find some niche or obscure piece I heard somewhere ages ago, and want to hear again. Audio quality is very decent and updates are pretty frequent. A Premium subscription is very reasonably priced (here in my country, at least) and easy to get even without a credit card.

amazing app, honestly my favorite for music discovery save for youtube. They have 90% of the music I look for, even obscure artists. My two complaints would be the shuffle feature NOT being random and it plays the same 25 songs on a 700 song playlist. They also changed the search function in playlists, instead of just scrolling up for the search bar, which was very convienent, you have to click the dots and find "find in playlist" among 10 other options.

Too many ads. They pop up like every 7 songs and there's 2 of them back to back. But, if you're willing to pay for premium, it's a wonderful app! I bought premium a few years ago when I got tired of all the ads, and it's definitely worth the money if you like listening to music often, or podcasts. I rated this a 3 before premium, but with it, it's definitely a 5/5

Definitely the least stable app I have installed. Frequently it takes 30s or more to switch tracks, load a playlist, load a menu or even pause the music. I've had these same problems on multiple devices and everyone else seems to feel the same way. It's been like this for over a year and with such solid competition around i'm thinking of ending my 8 year subscription...

Buy premium. Its the best $10/month you can spend on music. Great value for the money. I have used this app almost every day for the last 2 years across multiple devices. Whenever I get a new device, Spotify is the first thing to get installed. People need to stop whining about something as trivial as changing the shade of green for the logo. Constructive criticism: I *do* wish that I could manually rearrange the order of tracks in a playlist, as well as the order of the playlists.

I'm absolutely head over heels in love with Spotify and I always recommend it to friends and family. I pay the extra to extend it to my partner and he loves it too. We can both have our own customized profiles for our different music tastes. I LOVE the offline feature, save it all on wifi and I'm good to go for days although I always go back online to checkout new releases, my discover weekly and when I get that random song stuck in my head because I know Spotify will have it. ( Okay, to be fair there have been a FEW songs I haven't been able to get or some that got removed but I still prefer this app over anything music related.) It's a great price for the amount of daily use I get out of it.

I have been using Spotify for a little over 6 years now and it is the only online medium I bother using for music. It's music library is immense and the ability to make your own Playlist or listen to a musicians radio is great. I've been using the premium service for a while and that removes ads but back when I used standard addition I don't remember the ads being terrible but it is possible that has changed.

I have never been so fully impressed by choice and clarity of music as with spotify! And the relief of finding your music on any if your gadgets no matter where you are!!! I have no idea what other people listen to these days but I have long abandoned music CDs, memory sticks etc for music. Note I just hear a song I like, then find it on spotify and download it and others in its album!

best app ever! I love that you can download music and play offline with the premium plan (so no data charges). There hasn't been one song yet that they haven't had! (Although taytay has gone, which was a bit sad) I have had issues, however, with different devices trying to get the downloading working properly. Sometimes have to try multiple times and it's touch and go as to whether it will kick in and work.

Very easy-to-use UI and the availability of songs and artists are satisfactory. Premium is a bit expensive but it's easy to manage the subscription and therefore you can adjust the cost to your activity and use of the service. The free version is a little annoying with the ads and commercials that play between the songs but no more so than any other free-to-play service. use it frequently and when I can't afford premium I simply cancel my subscription and reactivate it when I can.

On my new phone (Galaxy J7) I'll be playing a song/album/playlist and it will stop. It could be in the middle of the song or at the end, there's not a consistent time or anything. I have to go into the app and manually play the next song. I'm giving it a 3 because other than that its decent and Spotify has generally been a good program, but this really hinders my enjoyment of it. Installing it and getting it again didn't fix this. Hopefully it will get resolved soon.

This is a great way 2 listen 2 music! Some of its cool features is u can remove explicit content for kids, and if u download songs u can hear them offline. There r podcasts too, if ur into that kind of stuff! Love it!!! But sometimes it doesn't play the whole song if u don't download that song which is annoying. But other than that its great!

I love spotify. I can always find the artists or songs I want to play. Also you ster me in the direction to new artists that are so good that have become my favorites as well. Thank you spotify. Although I'm having one problem I am using my chromecast to play spotify and I don't mind the ads but when the ad is done it stops completely. It won't start back up and that's annoying. Also when you go to hear an album it skips to other albums by the same group. Thanks please let people download as muc

LOVE Spotify! We were on Google Play before, but after several plans for glitches and snags on Google Play we thought we would try out Spotify, so glad we did! the interface is slick and easy to use, the song recommendations are (largely) spot on, and the playlists they either create for you or recommend to you is a great way to discover new music. If you are really into your music, rediscovering old favourites and coming across a few new ones - this app is for you.

Great app and service but there is no way to turn off explicit lyrics. I use my phone at work to show speakers to customers and it's playing all day long. I don't have time to be constantly checking to see if a song is explicit. Also there are some albums from artists that the don't have in their library. I would like to see the 2 missing Fear Factory albums Archetype and Transgression available to download. *** The new update does allow for explicit filtering.

Great app. Clear quality music. Fast download speeds. Easily to use and family friendly. Private playlists. Awesome recommendations. Can find even the newest music. New albums on release day. Lockscreen option very easy to use and quick to change or pause music. Awesome Bluetooth with my car and headphones on pixel 3. Cant be without spotify for long.

Its great, we use it all the time and never have a problem on Samsung Note 8, Samsung Note 4, iPhone 6s, iPods, or any device! Music quality is great also. Love the many choices of music, and options. I think it's one of the best out there if not THE best for song choices and freedom of music. They have songs from all Genres that other apps simply don't have. Commercial free, and choice to play any song you want, or create your own playlists and change them any time, or choose from other lists or stations with similar taste, is all a great option for a small monthly fee. Of course you can listen for free if you are okay with ad's and don't mind the shuffle play mandate instead of picking any song you want to play immediately. The paid plans are cheaper than satellite radio and by far better with blue-tooth radio or speakers. Even a family plan allows multiple devices to have the paid plan and listen to their own different music each at the same time if they want, for one decent price a month. They also now have an option to block explicit music for those of us who don't want to hear explicit music, or have families & children. Only thing I hope they add would be the options to once again organize music in playlists by artist or genre and also an option to mix it all up. Sometimes the shuffle button doesn't work so well. It needs programmed so the shuffle button won't play the same song twice unless it finishes all songs in the playlist first, then it can repeat songs in shuffle mode. I've had it play the same song 2 or 3 different times in my playlist without playing other songs at all :(. Please fix this! Thanks developers for a great music app!

Music always touches my soul and i am so much fond of listening to music üéµüé∂ like an addict. Spotify is the application i only use for the music excluding video streaming but I am not underestimating podcasts üòÖü§©. Really spotify gave alot of opportunities to people to share their ideas, stories, thoughts based on something better and beyond imagination. Music is love üíï, when it hits you, you really feel free and out of space. My brain storms like many ideas storming in my mind right quick.

I've been using this awesome app for 7 years. Spotify is most definitely better than ever. I like that I can play it on different devices. I also love the daily mixes; it brings new music to me. I listen to all kinds of music, and I get daily mixes that reflect that. I also really like the podcasts. I have discovered so many new things, thanks to Spotify. Also, I wanted the lyrics back, and it is!

Perfect app even without Premium. All the songs I could think of were on here, and if not, there are ways, though a little complicated, to get those songs on. It also has things you probably won't find anywhere else like automatic Genius lyric breakdowns, vertical videos, and concerts that pop up on your favorite artist's profile! I don't think I'll ever use any other music app.

Loving my subscription! All the songs, artists & albums I need, no ads is the way to go, premium is the best. Playlists are great, but I switched phones, it took me awhile to get them back. My stepson & I are on the family plan so I got his mixed with mine, but that's fine at least we didn't lose all the songs, which was a lot! Great app!!! Worth the cash if you like music!!

If you love music but aren't into iTunes or Google store, this is way better than Tidal or Rhapsody. Take it from someone who's tried all three services. Spotify has all the favorites, and a surprising amount of very obscure artists. I currently have almost 3000 songs saved, and I dont know if I'm ever going to stop. But I know I'll never have to, because Spotify gives me the power to save anything I want to my phone, whether I'm curious and only download it for a day, or it becomes my new jam.

I love having Spotify! Very, very rarely they won't have a song I'm searching for. I think what would make this app even better is if we could select multiple songs at once and create a playlist, instead of adding a song one by one to a playlist (on phone (Android) and computer (Chrome book)). Other than that, I'm very satisfied with it!

Great app if you're premium. If you're not, you'll enjoy using the web player much more than the mobile because there's better perks to it such as choosing which specific song u want to listen to. Spotify downloads songs fast, u can play song files as long as u know how to sync files from PC to mobile, great quality and simple interface. Only downfall is that it can get buggy some times. The player doesn't necessarily display the song you're currently listening to.

The best music streaming app as far as user interface, free version features, and content. Once I showed Spotify's agorithm what I like to listen to it has done a decent job playing music(much of which I haven't heard before) that I enjoy especially in my daily mixes (totally worth liking your most favorite songs). I rarely end up exceeding the 5 skips per hour for free. (Though Premium is worth it when I have the expendable income) The only complaint I really have is that I have to clear my phone's cache and app data from time to time in order for the app to work properly.(I once had nearly 2gb of app storage data on internal memory and I don't even save music to my phone (Sometimes it will get stuck trying to load the home tab or my library tab forever.)As far as the political side of things go, PLEASE support your favorite artists by purchasing their media either physically or digitally. It takes a LOT of listeners for them to make any sort of substantial royalties on here.

I love it.. it's the only music streaming app I have. Plus I like being able to play my games or search the Web while it plays in the background.. Only downfall for me is there are so many ads playing besides the music, unless you pay you can skip songs unlimited times. That's the only good part of YouTube Music, you can skip all the ads after 5 seconds.. Still my Favorite music app!!

I used to be hard core committed to buying all of my music on CDs. However, after deciding to try Spotify for just a month, I was completely converted after the first day. Not only does it play all of my favorite jams and let me make custom playlists, but it also finds new songs for me based on what I'm listening to if I want something I haven't heard a billion times. And it has a gajjilion pre-made playlists to fit any mood. And I can easily synchronize my devices and control my computer's sound system from my phone. And the best part is that when I find a new artist I really like, I can still buy a good old fashioned CD. Great product, great value. I love it.

I love Spotify premium! I would just say that it could be easier to organize the playlists for those of us who have very many of them. I listen to all genres and I like to organize my music by genres, moods, artists, albums, etc. It'd be nice if the playlist menu had an option to have categories to sort our personal and shared playlists (separating private from public).

Where do I even begin. I love this app, been using it since 2017 and now its a complete music app, every song under the sun, podcasts, great recommendations of songs, offline listening, cheap subscription, even cheaper as a Uni student. Now they added customization of lyrics before you share them with different color backgrounds and options for text to be centered, to the right or left. Does it have the best sound ever? No, not exactly but for a normal person its more than enough. Great app.

Without premium, this app is good. You can't skip more than 12 songs an hour I believe it is. It may randomly play songs that you don't even like and you do have ads. With premium, you have no ads, unlimited skips and can play any song you want, whenever you want. Including offline if you download the song, which only takes a couple of seconds. I would recommend this app but I would recommend its premium feature even more.

Haven't been on Pandora for a few years now but from what i've experienced, a much better music streamimg app with less ads, a better, more customizable user experience, and better suggestions based on listens. Haven't found many artists that aren't on spotify, even a local band i know was on it, without his knowledge, so I just hope, as a musician, that musicians are being fairly compensated because it is my favorite way to listen to and discover music! Besides a trusty friend filter of course.

This app is amazing. No questions!! When you heart songs, it will go into a playlist of all the songs you heart, with is great. Son suggestions are also included depending on what you listen to, and I have found music I really enjoy. Some songs aren't included though, and if the option to suggest songs to add is included, that would be amazing. Lastly, sometimes you can type in lyrics and the song you are looking for will pop up! This helps me a lot, thank you!! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Best value for money of any service I've ever had. Works very smoothly, the minimalistic UI is neat. Music discovery capability is great, most of the music I listen to I found through Discover Weekly playlist or just through song/artist radio. I also have some of my own mp3 files downloaded to this app. Sure, the app has some annoyances, but all minor in my opinion and many can be worked around. Again, best money I've ever spent.

I am a Spotify fanatic. I used to obsess over my iTunes account and managing my playlists - worrying about missing out on new music and whether I wanted to buy songs or not. When I switched to Spotify I tried the premium account for a discount (you can usually find a $.99 for three months deal) and I have never looked back. I have tons of playlists, access to all kinds of music I would never have discovered and I really enjoy the song radio function. It's worth that little bit of money!!

Its Spotify. What do you need to know? I found my old iTunes library recently and laughed about how I tried to make sure it fit on phones and media players I can stream all of it without taking up huge amounts of space with Spotify. Instead I can fill it up that space with apps and games I'll never use! And movies. Because no one has created a solution for movies and TV that is as simple and easy as Spotify. I'm not paying for 10 streaming services! You own Hulu now Disney, don't start another service!

Love it!! I've had spotify premium for about 5 years now, and any problem I have is easily fixed by the spotify support team. I just recently started college and there was an issue with getting my $5 premium, but they resolved it in a really nice and timely manner. They have great music selection and does everything I need- and more! I'm now an avid podcast listener because of their great selection of podcasts, as well as music. Highly recommend.

Spotify is by far the best app I've used to listen to music on. It's free (unless you're using premium version), plenty of songs, great music quality, ability to listen to podcasts as well as music. I would like Spotify to have a feature where you're able to remove downloads for just one song at a time, a simple way to get Spotify themes (not just dark mode/light mode etc). Other than that, in my opinion, this app is better than any other music app. I rate this app a 5/5

Spotify has the best selection of available songs from every genre, you can make playlists with as many songs as you want and in the order you want and the best part, with Premium, absolutely no commercials, never interrupted. The best app for music, IMO. To find all music from each artist, right click menu on song, find Go to Artist, scroll down and click on Discography. Click on an album and all songs will come up...

I use the free app, and love it. The commercials are not as bad as any radio app. The selection of artists and playlists is beyond any other music service app. Rare and obscure artists, songs and groups can be found here. The independent artist list could be bigger, but I already have over 5000 songs and 20 playlists. Seems to keep getting better.

Spotify has great selection of music to choose from, though sometimes I wish to listen to more music from certain artists of which I do know have a large array of music. Of course, I understand that it's up to artists and their agents and stuff like that to share things, but it's kind of a bummer to see an admired artist but only find one album or song available...

Well worth the money for Premium. The discover weekly mix of new music üé∂ provided every Monday is something I look forward to every week. I have honestly found so many new artists through Spotify. Also, the genre & mood radio options are abundant and super helpful when having people over, working, or anything else you can imagine. I have created a ton of playlists full of songs without ever paying for a single song. You can download and play anywhere without Wi-Fi. All in all, worth it!

So spotifiy... Its advertised as a free music service. It does this and doesnt at the same time, its free to use but some features are locked behind a small subscription fee, this is completely normal, as the company need money to keep it available for free. I have used spotify for a few years now and personally i have had no problems with it (other than the things i miss like unlimited skips or direct play). I also like the link to PlayStation its really helpful to keep my music in one place.

Its good,and I like the catalog and it seems to do a good job finding other music I would like. The app is a little bit buggy on my android car stereo though. I have had to uninstall and reinstall several times. It does get annoying that I have to re download my play list sonetimes, but when it works its cool. Update: my android car stereo has gotten more stable with spotify. I love this app and the service!

Spotify is by far the easiest music application ive ever used. Of course, its best with the premium membership, but it is worth it by far. As long as you're listening to alot of music and finding plenty of new music all the time, you won't regret getting premium. Checking things like charts and new releases is simple. The only thing I wish is that they had an easier way to see announcements and new releases by your followed artists, since at the moment there's no real use in following someone.

I listen to spotify whenever i can, in the morning, on commute, with friends, with family, at home, when travelling, its 1 of my most used and favourite apps, I'd be lost without it. My discover weekly is always a winner and the radio apps are perfect for finding new music. Having used the premium app for years now, it's worth every penny! Thank you Spotify!!! My music library wouldnt be the same without you!

The album I grew up with is not available as a CD, so I can't rip it to my players, but with Spotify I was able to reconstruct the album going through the songs and putting them into a playlist. Now I can listen to my favourite album anytime, via my phone (minus 1 song, I was unable to find anywhere on the site). Highly recommend Spotify for their diversity of music available.

I'm one of those people who need new music that I don't know by heart, every few days. I use it to focus and if I know it, I sing it, so this is an excellent app for me. I have the free version, and sure, I hate the commercials, but they are literally barely fifty seconds long, and I don't normally need tons of skips, so it tends to work out. That being said, I miss thumbs down. I don't always have time to go in and remove the song from the list, but other than that, aces!

I love this app, the things that it lack is equalizer for low-end phones (for free version). Other than that this is is one of the BEST apps I've ever used (it's personally no. 2 to be specific). Thank you so much ‚ù§Ô∏è Edit: can you add a feature where when you press a record's picture there's a lyrics you can put by yourself or you provide it, would REALLY appreciate that because so many personally want a lyrics, and not all want a behind the lyrics

Spotify has made it so much easier to handle all of my music and playlists and gives me an opportunity to discover new music and has an amazing archive of old songs for almost any situation. It's also given me the opportunity to expand my listening and use podcasts to meditate and learn new things or even just listen for entertainment. I don't know what my life would be without spotify!

I absolutely love Spotify. For a family of music junkies, it's the perfect app. I love making playlists, finding new bands, checking out my release radar every Friday, and getting to see my spotify wrapped every December. I do wish they told you how many times you personally listened to a particular song, though. That's my only complaint about the sight/app. Otherwise it's fantastic!
