replyContent: Hey, we're glad you're loving the app, and thanks for sharing your idea! It's well worth adding it to our ideas board at https://bit.ly/3iNXKK3. Others can then vote on it or add to the conversation to show their support

content: Spotify is my only option when I crave music . It's the platform that I prefer no matter what. But nowadays I have noticed that the lyrics of many songs are not available! Whenever I scroll down to look for the lyrics it shows not available. This is actually more annoying to me than the ads. I can bear the ads ( to an extent) but not this. @Spotify pls look into this and solve this problem as soon as possible.

I listen to a lot of music. If you name the genera I have probably listened too it extensively. My data however would suffer on YouTube, so, I decided to try this out. Having The plan I have I dont get dinged for listening on this app and it's really nice to hear new songs. The only thing I would like is to night be bombarded with the "30 minuets add free" when I swap playlists. Aside from that 10/10, 5 stars, and 100%

It is easily the best music streaming app available, but Spotify has 2 major problems: 1) The algorithm spotify uses makes it very difficult to find new music. If you find a new song you like and try to find similar songs, the playlist Spotify creates is going to be 50% or more of music that you already listen to on a regular basis. It doesn't matter what genre or time period you are trying to find 2) There used to be the heart icon to add songs to your "liked" songs, but they took that away :(

I'm 45 years old, an old fellah when it comes to music. I still buy vinyls and CDs, maybe spent too much on them looking for good songs only to be left disappointed. Then I discovered Spotify, with a small monthly payment and more songs than you can imagine at your fingertips and eartips. I've found so much amazing new music this year because of Spotify it makes it worth every single cent spent worth it. Don't let technology get in your way old man, get stuck in, rock on, rock out, music is what it's all about .... only an old fart could quote that.

I LOVE Spotify! I have the premium version of Spotify and it's worth every single penny. I have hundreds of songs downloaded to my playlist. and I mean HUNDREDS!!! And, NO I didn't receive anything for this review. I simply am a huge fan. I've never had any connection issues or any issues, as far as that goes. Premium in this case means premium! If you love music the way I LOVE music, you will not be disappointed!

I fkn LOVE Spotify!! They are extremely convenient. You can make a playlist, choose a list starring any artist, choose a playlist made by someone else or podcasts. You can save and follow playlists. Save and download songs or an entire playlist. And when you reach the end of the list Spotify auto generates songs based on the playlist songs so you never have to be in silence, like if your driving and can't choose the next song or list. I also bundled it with my Hulu so I'm definately a happy camper!

Best part of this app was when I discovered the queue function. Best best best (Almost 3 years after that comment and I'm super frustrated with spotify right now. My s8 always stops playing music when the screen shuts off. I've tried everything I've read online to make it stop but no. My last resort is to uninstall and reinstall, if it doesnt work, I'm cancelling this service because I'm not getting a new phone anytime soon.)

When using free account, the advertisements sometimes are quite annoying and repetitive. Suggest more variety of advertisements, so people won't feel so annoying while listening to the music. Just signed up for premium membership, it is so good with no ads. However, there are still some songs I could not find in Spotify. Would Spotify improve some functions like suggest to add missing song songs in the library?

I love using spotify! Its my primary way of listening to music. Easy to search, organize and listen on multiple devices. I paired it with Shazam and it's super easy to add songs I hear to my specific playlists. I use the share feature often and text songs/podcasts to friends *my only request is to be able to share songs with other friends I follow on spotify (haven't found a way to do this yet). Started off with the free version then finally upgraded to premium *totally worth it. Thanks Spotify!

Best streaming music app and service available. I've had Spotify for 10 years, in that time there has been continuous updates, improvements and reliability. I had a 6 month Apple Music Trial so I came off it for that period. When I came back I realised how much I missed it. Multi-User support. Seamless integration with Sonos, Google Home etc whereas I found Apple to be super paranoid, even when streaming from my Mac. 10/10 can't recommend enough.

My favorite music free music app. I've seen one or two reviews where it won't start up as soon as you open it. I had the same problem. All you have to do is take out your sd card, start up the app, then put it back in. Simple enough. Anyways, I'm only taking off a star because it doesn't support Chromecast. Make it in the update please! üòÑ

Music makes the most mundane task bearable, and the ability to have various playlist to fit any mood makes it even better. And if you don't want to take the time to search for songs to fit that mood, there are a variety of premade lists to fit both mood and musical taste. You will definately want to choose one of their subscriptions, however, to skip ads, play the song you want, play in background, and download your favorite playlists to play at any time.

when i could no longer afford Pando**, I downloaded Spotify and it gave me many of the features that I was paying for on the other app! you can listen to singular songs instead of full albums. you can listen to whole albums instead of stations. You've got podcasts, too. and go ahead, turn off the screen, you will still be able to hear your music on this one. Love it!

Because Spotify is amazing I am willing to use my own limited time to giving my personal review on this app. This app has customizable options giving you the options to listen your way. The Spotify app currently has podcasts and music. They can be downloaded to listen offline. The app is driver friendly if you use it with a voice command phone and best to use with a voice friendly map/driver direction app when one is needed. The variety of music or podcasts now yours to discover by taking advantage of the suggestions based on your played history. When searching you can select the genera you want to listen to. Spotify I just want to thank you for the time I spent and going to spend with you. That is if you keep staying awesome.

Great app and service. They have nearly any music you can imagine. I like how Spotify is actively looking to include new artists and musicians every day. The app sometimes lags a bit when selecting podcasts but this is almost meaningless, specially considering the sheer amount of music and podcasts you can access. I've been using their services for about 5 years or so and won't be stopping any time soon!

What can be said that hasn't already? Gorgeous app with an incredible selection of music and great sound quality. The recommendation engine has matured by leaps and bounds over the years, and the original podcasts and series are incredibly well done. An amazing value for $9.99, at least as far as the streaming economy goes (sure, you don't actually own anything) and a rarity in that it just works, damn it.

great app, it's good free though the adds do get annoying, but hey free music when don't adds get annoying? just got premium and zero adds, you don't have to pay for each song you download like Google does just a monthly fee for all the music you can dream of, and great recommendations for music! Though I will say if you just buy a few songs or albums here or there you might find it better to just pay for them over this, but if your a music addict like me? HELL YEAH FIVE STARS!!!!!!

I've used Spotify on my computer since 2011. I have loved it since my brother introduced me to it. When I got the mobile app it took me a while to get used to not having some of the same privileges as you do with the free version for computers. Great option that they now have student discounts and partnerships with other apps such as Hulu. Overall, it is a great app and worth having to listen to music, podcasts, etc.

I am a huge fan of Spotify if you buy the monthly premium. The free service is too limited for my tastes. With the premium you have access to pretty much all music and there are many different play lists, radios, made for you stations, and community lists to take advantage of. I like being able to favorite songs and then shuffle through the entire list and I like some of ancillary services they offer like podcasts and stand up, it is pretty good as a podcast platform. Worth it if you are paying per month otherwise the ads are too distracting and the offerings are too limited

Honestly, spotify is great. In my opinion, it should have above 4.6 stars! Anyways, I'm gonna talk in detail about my experience. So, I've been using spotify for a month now, and there has been only one problem on the pc version. Often, the app does not respond, and you have to delete and re-install the app. The PC Web Version and PC App Version have way more features than the mobile. For e.g., you can skip freely, listen to one specific song, move playlists, change pics, etc.

This app has transformed the way I listen to music. It has a lovely black user interface and streams flawlessly whether in the car, at home, or at a friends place. You take your music collection where ever you go! Add a Chromecast audio and voil√† you can use it to stream to every room in the house wirelessly. Also the suggestions it makes are great and introduces you to new music. Enjoy!

This is hands down the best music app Ive had. The dashboard and menus are aesthetically pleasing, the music volume and audio files are all normalized, and the variety is outstanding. I actually look forward to listening to my personalized discover weekly playlist to find new music. ( although naturally there will be some pretty weird and/or untasteful jams) Even the free version is pretty well put together compared to others in its category. 10/10 great app.

Spotify is hands down the best out there if you want to stream music. But, I've noticed lately that they are greying out songs in my playlist so I can't listen to them anymore. I'm guessing it might have to do with the labels or the artists themselves not wanting certain songs to be out there for free. I just go to YouTube to listen to the ones I can't anymore. Also, I've had to uninstall and reinstall the app because songs would stop out of nowhere, even with full service. Still 5 stars though!

I love listening to music on this using my phone, laptop, t.v., etc. The only thing i would fix is the amount of ads. after the 30 mins if free listening, you jave many ads, i know many people get annoyed of them. if there were less in the sequence, that'd be great. Also, you need to add SoMos redition if the song "Or Nah" i think its better than ty dolla signs way of singing it. Overall, i love this app.

Nice to be able to listen to any song I want & to download to listen offline. New album out? I've got it! So many great features. Love Discover Weekly. They pick some of my favorite songs & ones I've never heard but really like. I wake up with a song in my head & can play it while phone is multitasking. Can't do that with YouTube. Spotify rocks!

Good music selection, love the playlist and song predictions the app does to try and find new songs and artists you'll enjoy based on what you play. Saving songs to listen to offline is great for someone who wants to save data on the phone- but you'll have to pay for a subscription for that. For me, the sub is worth having no ads, unlimited song skips/selection and downloadable songs. Minor bugs but overall a good app.

Like others have said Spotify keeps crashing since the last update (I'm using Spotify Premium). I can't even use the search function anymore and I keep getting a message I'm offline, while I'm not. This happens on ALL of the Android devices in my household (old and new; ranging from Android 6.0 to 8.0). Please fix! Dropped from 5 to 2 stars till this is fixed. UPDATE: the problem seems to be fixed; searching is sometimes still slow though. Back to 5 stars!

I've used iheart radio and Pandora before, and no offense to those who like those two apps, but they were not that good and I wasn't satisfied at all. But then I came across Spotify and I love it so much. It's so easy to use and I can make so many playlists and save so many songs and it's just great. Even though I'm not using Spotify Premium and the ads are annoying, it's still a great music app. Recommend it 10/10

I've been using Spotify for 2-3 years and loved it. Recently I've experienced some problems with the app. On both my phone and laptop I've been forced to log in everytime I go to listen to music, after I log in all my downloads are gone and I'm forced to redownload everything. This has been happening everytime I go to use Spotify for the past 3 weeks. Is there anything I can do to fix this?

Subscribed after friend's recommendation. It is utterly user-friendly. Managed to download all my favourite songs even those popular ones in the past. Or even different languages/ dialects songs. You can keep the songs in separate playlists (folders). Add or delete songs like how you do things on your computer. Have been enjoying the songs daily ever since I subscribed to it!

Never let me down so far! Premium is worth every penny, being able to download playlists and listen without Wi-Fi and data is a life saver!!! Also discovering new music through daily mixes is awesome and helps expand musical taste and changing from one device to the other without stopping the song is just a plus. Absolutely love Spotify, does everything I need, want and didn't know I wanted!

Unfortunately I have to change my review here. For the last year the spotify app has been the worst app I have. Stopping mid play, not loading any data, force closing etc. Its unusable, so much so that I might be canceling my decade long subscription and moving to other streaming apps. I hope they resolve their app asap. Update: seems to have gotten much better, changing rating. Update- its back to performing as good as ever.

Forever love this app! But one problem: I accidently took off the Spotify song icon from the top pull-down bar of my Android phone. Like, when you pull down on your notifications at the top of your phone, it will show you what song is playing, and you can skip it, heart it, or delete it. But it's not there anymore. Does anybody know how to put it back up?

I Love how I can not only find all the songs I love both new and old, but it learns my preferences and suggests songs I've never heard that I may enjoy based on my listening history. That way I find so much more that enriches my life! I also appreciate how I can categorize the songs I choose into playlists that suit different situations like driving music, work outs, falling asleep or sad times. It's my new must for life improvement. Saves me hundreds of dollars trying to buy CDs just to get one song I really like!

Doesn't get much better than this. Everything a music app should be and more. As well as, a variety of cool stuff, such as artist info/bio's. Spotify, exclusives. Tour dates, venue location's. You're able to access ticket sales, too. A big shout out to the devs as well as, all of the artists that made/make this, all possible. Thank you for all the wonderful years of, service ;)

I've been using Spotify since 2012 and the app since 2014. Never had any real issues. It has shut down while using it before because I have my phone set to auto update so that's not really a big deal. Overall great app and I like that it recommends songs and playlists. It's worth getting the monthly subscription because I hate commercials, especially when I'm working out!

Updating my review to 5 stars. I thought the grass was greener on the other side and tried out a few other music apps and quickly came running back to Spotify. üò≠ Best functionality, music availability, integration and features hands down. I still hate that you cant select multiple playlists to shuffle or play songs from but that's minor compared to everything else you gain.

App is great if you have premium which you can get for a reduced cost if you are a student like me. App gets bloated over time with all of it's cached content. If cached songs are not stored on the phones own storage it runs very slow and sometimes won't work. Still a good app, wish they would fix the cached songs slowing down the entire app.

I use Spotify alot! I prefer it over other music apps like Pandora or YouTube Music. I use Premium, so I can listen ad-free and to my local music downloads from my computer on my phone as well. I didn't mind the ads when I had the free version, plus you get ad-free listening for an hour every now and then which is nice, too. I love how easy it is to organize my playlists, find similar songs, and listen through my Bluetooth with my Waze or Google Maps while I drive hands free. I love this app!

The best music app out there. For the monthly subscription, it is like having nearly every song, artist, album, plus so much more on my phone. My favorite feature is that I can connect to my Xbox One, and use the app on my phone to control the music on my headset while gaming. Another neat feature, if I play Spotify on my older Galaxy S6, at work, but I am not near that device, I can pull my Galaxy S8 out and it is synced to the other phone. Makes changing a bad song easy while not having t

Besides having an app that features so many great ways to find music I like, Spotify has unequaled consistency in its music library. I've tried Deezer and Amazon Music, but in a matter of weeks several of my saved songs simply disappeared from their libraries, which I suppose relates to expiring license agreements. Conversely, each one of the many hundreds of songs I've saved over the last two years is still available on Spotify. This consistency is why I'm so loyal to Spotify.

It is a great app for sharing music with friends and family. The catalog is huge with great quality, and the community playlists are great, but what seals the deal is Discover Weekly. It has songs I instantly fall in love with, and a couple of misses, but the hits definitely outweigh those! Best way to listen to old faves and discover excellent music, hands down. If you're into radios, then Daily Mixes are just what you need.

I love Spotify! I am subscribed because making playlists and getting to listen to any song you want from their enormous and ever-growing library is so fun. I also love the app's music recommendations; I've found so many amazing new artists because of it. The only thing I would change is how the heart button for playlists is on the left, yet the thumbs up button for radio is on the right (and thumbs down on the left) -- I've accidentally thumbs-downed so many good songs due to muscle memory of the heart button on the left, and you can't bring them back!!

I've loved Spotify for..at least 6 years! I recommend it to everyone and they done nothing over the years except gotten better! My whole family loves and shares and has Playlist with hundreds of songs, podcasts,etc.. and we LOVE the Wrapped reports!! I have the family subscription. I don't have the issues I see in some other reviews, or if I do, it's so rare that it's unnoticeable. For me to like it, it has to be quick, responsive, smooth, no5 glitch, no ads, and have everything. Awesome.Job!!

Last night Spotify didn't work on me which is an S8 Galaxy Edge phone, I 
had to restart the app so many times. When it still refused to open, I had 
to install and reinstall the app. As I reinstalled Spotify listed me as not 
a premium customer. Spotify if you would just make sure this does not 
happen again it would be great as the three years I've been using Spotify 
for. Overall this app is , love how you can adjust the level of download 
quality that best fit your phone or whichever you like. I also like how you 
can never go wrong with the type of music you tell cuz it's from the actual 
artist where you wouldn't have the bad quality wrong download from 
someplace else.

good app works on Chromebook unlike the posts say I have a add every 60m and can play what I what without the sub. I don't have it and fine with out it u can use it for hrs and only have 1-2 adds best music player for crome. TYSM for Spotify!

I loved this app until it started skipping every three seconds during the song. I hate to take it off but I can barely listen to my music any more, which is my life, without it messing up. And I don't even mind listening to ads sometimes when they will play. Please fix this problem. Update this problem has been fixed some time ago. Thank you, but there is still some songs I can't find. I can't pull all of my Shazam songs up either. Please fix those 2 issues.

I like Spotify because they listen to what I want and they play it! I also like the playlists they make for me . Really great setup. And no charge! A Lot with computer stuff they have stuff but Don't organize properly. That's why allot times people will get Cable tv over direct. Confusing and not set up so it's easy to find movies and use That's why people pay the higher price. Hope this info is helpful to you Spotify.

This app is so great! It has all the songs you could name and you can even make your own playlists! Yeah sure there are some ads but if you watch 1 you could just have ad free for 30 minutes! I don't think there is a limit for songs but either way it is very great! It is easy to use and figure out. I recommend you this app if you're looking for a app that can play you music, recommend you other playlists that you might like. And you can even share your own playlists to people all over the world!

I never knew about spotify until last year, and at that, didn't listen to a lot of music. When I discovered spotify, I was pleasantly surprised and impressed with what it offered and offers. I even decided to get premium because of how great of an app I thought and still think it is. I would by far offer spotify above other music providers simply because of how simple and useful it has become to me. Music on demand when I want, where I want, with playlists designed for me, with multiple genres.

Love love love. My favorite app for music. I have a recommendation or two. It would be super cool if you could create easier ways to organize music to playlists. Like creating four boxes that you can personalize. One for podcasts, for artists, for songs, etc. Something where you could add playlists in. It would also be awesome if there was a + you could click on when you want to add a song to a playlist(or playlists) while on the lock screen. Thankss

i bought the full version and its amazing. they have almost every song, and for the songs they don't have sometimes people have uploaded them to podcast files which you can also add to your playlist. the only thing i would change is so you can change the album covers and bios on mobile. because on computers you can, as for as i know except for chromebooks.

access to tons of great music, and intelligent curated playlists and suggestions that expose you to all types of great music you would never otherwise be able to experience. the computer version is much much preferable to the mobile version but being able to control my pc from my phone is an awesome remote feature. what a time to be alive, more music at my fingertips then i could ever listen to

(Premium): I exclusively listen to Spotify discover playlists. The algorithm has been very effective in finding quality songs. There is only one problem I have with the algorithm. Not having a dislike button leaves only the like button to distinguish between Great songs and mediocre songs, assuming the bad songs are ignored. I occasionally run into the perfect playlist... but there is one song that I would rather auto skip or remove manually.

Yes you do have to pay if you want to listen to your music off line without adverts. But I pay fifteen pound a month and have it on 11 devices between 5 email account for 1 price. you can download music which then syncs to your other devices with that email. I have different playlists that I have made. easy search for what you want. after you've used it for a month it generates playlists that you might like. so after a year the list is endless as I love any type of music best app for music.

I think this is the most amazing app. I use the family premium package, which I am very happy to pay for. It is well worth every penny. Beautiful layouts, attention do detail. I think the new feature they have added, song radio, choosing similar artists. It's a very social educational system, by introducing artists that I would never have stumbled upon myself. You can really get lost for hours listening to amazing music recommended by Spotify. To the developers of Spotify, I would like to thank very much at and keep up the good work!

I pay Spotify mainly because of the algorithmic mojo that is Discover Weekly, it always nails it! It's made me appreciate music in a whole new way. There are a few bugs here and there but the experience is overall better than all the other streaming services I've tried. EDIT: (previous: 9/13/16) Three years going strong. I've upgraded to a family plan which gives you 6 accounts at an excellent price. A lot of value per peso. Best streaming platform, would never switch.

Optimal with small issues, one of these are the songs in other languages (using different alphabets) it's harder to find artists and songs without knowing how to read/write those specific alphabets. It's to be a new update cause it was always translated before. I like it this way but it's a bit excluding, i would like the possibility to change that in the options.

Awesome selection of music, only using free version right now... noticed music keeps pausing/stopping.. always having to refresh phone/app after about 2 songs. Upgrading to premium is awesome!!!. Vast array of music and podcasts to choose from, let's me know when new albums/songs come out, auto generated playlists are great... Got into some new music b/c of that. Downloaded playlists and songs to listen to offline as well. Great app!!.

Spotify is an amazing music player. I've been using it for a few years now, and it has never failed to satisfy. One suggestion for a quality of life improvement, would be to create some sort of option to select your favorite song, that would be on the top of any playlist you put it in, and track how many favorites have been selected and have a bit of statistics in terms of which songs have the highest "Favorite" count. I don't know, just an idea.

even though there may be ads, the music service is amazing! I don't have Spotify premium but I get what I want without it and I don't think so as much difference in the paid and unpaid versions of spotify.I find all the music and play this that I want for each and every occasion. overall I think is better than any other music service out there. finally came to India I am relieved!

I think library song limit is lame. I like a lot of music. Sometimes the app crashes when I plug in my headphones. Don't have this issue with other apps. Other than that love it! Been with Spotify since 2012 Edit-- changed to 5 ‚òÜ from 4 ‚òÜ due to increase of song limit, addition of sleep timer [yay!!], and the option to completey block an artist. Keep it coming! Excellent selection variety. Thank you üòä

(New; it's all fixed! )(Edit: the recent updates have made it a little better) Im so sorry to have to change my original 5 star review down to 1. The new update has DESTROYED my personal library of songs and artists. I spent YEARS finding, curating and organizing my library of songs to flow the way i want and now, that's gone. Also, it appears that songs, artists and albums are no longer connected and makes it extremely difficult to search and find songs i want. This makes me so sad üòûüòî

I love Spotify. However it would be nice to have some customization of colors and layouts. Both for phone and pc. I don't know if you guys remember winamp but the most fun on that program was that you could personalize it to the maximum(also the cool trippy background) . It could be a really cool addition to the app. U could experiment with basic customization and im sure it will work wonders.

Music from all over the world. Playlists generated from songs you like can expand your variety within a genre by introducing you to artists you've never heard of. Links with Google home and similar so there is no need to open Spotify on the phone to have the external device play from your account with your selections. Has pretty much replaced iTunes completely due to its good integration across multiple device platforms. I have yet to explore premium, it's on the to do list but free works fine if you're willing to accept the few limitations. Finally the BIG point is that there is no need to spend time pirating music anymore, just ask Spotify to play it.

Spotify is a wonderful app for many reasons. Very simple to use, well organized. I particularly love the Discover Playlist. Every week Spotify presents a Playlist of songs that I might like, based on the kinds of songs I listen to. I've discovered a whole lot of songs that I really like - love, sometimes - that I wouldn't have ever known about. It's a great app.

Had Spotify for 3+ years now, across multiple devices, and Spotify has been my #1 app on each of them. Free version, premium version it doesn't matter. The best streaming app on the market. I've come across small issues in the past with brand new devices and the Spotify team is always quick to resolve any little programming to bring me back up to 100% for quick,easy-to-use, and reliable operation. Great variety of entertainment.Promotes new releases from old and new artists you follow.Love it!

The main reason I am saying this is because, unlike on the desktop version, you cannot pick and choose which song you want to play.  This is one of my favorite parts of Spotify, and one of the ways that it sets it apart from all other music apps... if only it were available ON their app without having to pay a monthly fee >:(

Spotify is the best music service on the market. Customizable playlists. Ability to search for any song within their portfolio. And a sophisticated AI able to serve you 30 new songs you have never heard before every week. I love it it's opened me up to many new songs and genres I would have never found without it. To top it off the Android app is top notch. Keep up the great work guys and thank you for providing such a fantastic music service!

I started with the free version back when it originally came out but at the beginning of the year I decided to try out TIDAL for 20$ a month it wasn't worth it, my music wouldn't load sometimes and would even cut out. So I decided to come back to spotify and go premium and I havnt had any issues yet, not to mention it's half the price.

The radio play list could be longer. Also wish you could be able to set up to aviod explicit versions of songs. But it is really great app... also wish you could use the app with more than one user at a time me and my husband share the account and would really like it if we could both use at same time without taking over what the other is listening to.

I simply can't afford to subscribe to it, so I am VERY glad that even for those of us who don't, it's still a really great service & app !!! I've tried a couple others ( for various reasons) & spotify is easier to use & has better options, esp. For non-paying users. This makes me love spotty , recommend it to others, & want to support it when I can!

Subscription price ok considering all the music, podcasts, and basically good assortment, that can be enjoyed in a month, and can share cost with family members too. Also the app itself is easy to use. Option download / not is good too so we can choose whether to play offline or to keep songs in cloud playlist so as not to burden phone storage. Also really appreciate and love the yearly end-of-year review! Simply innovative insightful and fun!

I used to use pandora and some other music apps, but so far Spotify has been my favorite to organize music and to find new music. Especially now that I travel a lot and don't have internet access, I pay little a month to get what music I've downloaded to listen to on the road. There are some limits to what I can do but that's with all the apps. I do like that you can share music and playlists, and I really like the mood playlists.

I just love the stupid people here who aren't willing to pay the $10.99 for the premium features but complain about not having the functionality when their free subscription runs out. Absolutely 100% worth it cost. My only complaint is that the functionality for shuffle could be a lot better. I have yet to find a band or even a song that is not on Spotify, better than any of the other music platforms including Apple or iHeartRadio.

For those who are disappointed with popping up adds and shuffle songs play: who pays the bill that orders music. Pay subscription and you will be owner of you playlist. Nothing is for free in the world. About app itself: Despite I didn't find some songs I wanted to listen to, it is the best app I have ever tried. It is not cheap but it is worth it.

Okay I have two major issues with this application, my first problem is that when you give an expected amount of "ad free music" I expect to have that thirty minutes. Not have one song play then another ad. The other major occurence is that when it comes to lyircs I try and go to Genius and look for them and then it just blanks out. But my review will still be high in all regards

I'm using Spotify on my Nexus 5, and recently it's been quite buggy. I would listen to downloaded song, but as soon as I lock the phone, the playback pauses for no reason. Even more - after pause, it sometimes jumps to the next song. Why??? That's been annoying, please fix it. Otherwise, it's a great app.

Sound quality through app is good volume is low Other than that I really enjoy Spotify. I downloaded the app within one week of its release. It's changed over the years going back and forth with what you're allowed to do but Spotify and the artist specified radio stations algorithms blow Pandora's doors off. Sound quality, artist selection, song selection (all downloadable) put Spotify in a league of its own!! Every device I have or will own will Spotify on it that's for sure√≤.

I'm revising my rating. I was hesitant to go all out with this app on the beginning because it wasn't playing well with Android. I think with Android version 8 and beyond they have the issues i was dealing with all worked out. I really like Spotify because I can listen to whatever I want online or offline if I download the playlist. I do wish there was a way to backup my downloaded music though so i can reload it if i have phone issues. Everything else is great!

Been with Spotify since 2010 and this app just gets better and better. Never any issues with syncing between the desktop and this, and the only two problems I've ever had, their customer service team were fantastic. So easy to recommend! Well worth the subscription... Can't understand the complaints??? 13 years and will be for many more.... (just wish Hi fidelity would be sorted out soon)

With the latest updates it seems to be working as expected. I'll leave my old review below until I have used it a bit more to confirm. ........ I use this app all the time, used to be pretty reliable but bugs are starting to make it less enjoyable. Currently it keeps losing the notification icon and at the same time playback does not pause on phonecall or Bluetooth disconnect. Also lots of the time it thinks it's offline when there is a decent connection and I have to restart the app to be able to browse or search.

Recommend it! I know tons of people who are happy with this app. Every app of course has its pros and cons, but what I really like about Spotify is the range of music, you can download music on to your phone, you can make Playlists, change the way you want to see your "liked" music (songs, albums, Playlists), you can now see the the lyrics!‚ù§, there are song suggestions at the bottom of your Playlist and if you really like a certain song you can go to its radio to find more music like it!üòÉ

Where would I be without Spotify? My most used app probably, I'm always listening to music and it's very user friendly too, that is if you have Premium. That is my one critique, is Spotify Free on mobile was a nightmare to use- I could get past the ads but never being able to choose what song to immediately play was a bite. Premium was worth it, though I do think overall the free version could do with ironing out some kinks.

A Great selection of songs when you want them, with no ads with subscription. It's worth it, and it learns what you like and creates weekly Play List's for you. All my favourite groups to listen to, all their song's. I miss going to concerts, this is the next best thing. Use it with a Google Mini, Echo, Alexa and voice command makes even easier. Thanks for a great product.

Best music app out there (I'm on the premium family plan). straight forward, easy to make/maintain playlists, have had no trouble finding even pretty obscure music. Favorite features include the 'download' button which doesn't clog your phone up with large music files but DOES make the downloaded playlists available offline. Also, the 'discover weekly' feature introduces new music based on YOUR preferences, I discover new music I like more frequently than with other music apps. Thanks Spotify!

in my opinion, the best way to get my favorite music on all of my devices. for 9.99 a month, you can't beat it. I can't imagine life without spotify now that I use it's download album feature almost constantly to keep my music fresh and new. also, being able to xast to my ps4 while I play games is nice. check out the bands paint it black, enemies, year of the knife, and conan.

Probably the best music app I've ever used. Premium is extremely cheap (especially if you're a student) and comes with so many other things, like Hulu. On top of that, they recently had a promotion where the gave out Google Home Minis.......FOR FREE. Spotify is 100% for their users and nothing compares to it. Skipping songs endlessly and creating playlists that you can share and having virtually every artist and song. Nothing beats it.

Honestly, if you want to listen to some music for free- it's great. An ad every once in a while but it has a great selection and sounds great. Plus there's always the premium option if you want a better experience. With premium: making customs playlists and downloading them is super convenient. Sure they won't have every song ever, especially if you're not in the US/UK, but it's still my favorite music streaming app.

I am old enough to not like this app for many reason, but... My daughter's and other friends music are here, is something like a radio station, were you select the music you wanted. Nice digital music app and sounds clean. You have to know if you don't make a selection of type or gender, all kinds of trash will come to your ears. Just spend some time on the app to get a better enjoyment of it.

Its so good! I found all the songs i wanted to listen to, unlike many of the other apps I used which didn't have those songs. I also love how they create playlists espeacially for you to listen to. There is only one problem, some of the songs do not show the lyrics, which is sort of annoying. The overall experience is definetly awesome though.

The Best music player I've had the pleasure of using when listening to tracks and / or albums, as once you purchase it for a one time fee, all commercials and stuff that always pisses you off are eliminated! Then it's just search, find, add, to a folder of your choice and set the equalizer to the specs of your infinite pleasure, and play. And if you should not like anything change it, remove from list add new rearrange to play in your order, its perfection. Pando, and such cannot ever compare.

okay I've been using Spotify for three years. it's changed so much since i first downloaded it but only for the better. Its so useful if you like listening to music when you work or just want something in the background while chatting. the onky things i dont like about it is the fact that "Thirty minutes of add free music" is only 15 now when it used to be 30 and how few skips you have. i love Spotify but im a cheap person so i dont pay for premium. I totally recommend it.

Been a loyal customer for years now, and it's the one music application that I am willing to pay for. I paid the $99 for a year, and I love knowing that it's already taken care of, and I can continue listening to my unlimited music. I bought the Mighty, and it's one of the best decisions I've made, allowing me to mix up my Playlists, and eliminating the need to be on my phone. Great job, Spotify, keep doing what you're doing, and making it a better application for your users ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
not sure why the app became so slow, went back to normal after a quick reinstall like i was told.
replyContent: Hi. Have you tried a quick reinstall? If that doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Just search ‚ÄúContact Us‚Äù, and they'll be happy to help.

content: Spotify is pretty much the best music streaming app. I have it on almost a my devices. It's amazing because you can listen to any song on the spot. You can make your own playlist(s) and add unlimited songs to it, or follow a playlist by other people, like Spotify, your favorite artist, or a Facebook friend. It requires internet and has ads, but the premium version removes ads and allows you to download unlimited songs, albums, and playlists. Be sure to get premium when its on sale for 3 months.

I love Spotify not only for creating playlists without wear to my own precious collection of music cds, tapes & records, but also for their spot-on suggestions. Spotify is also a source of music and performers, of which I wouldn't have learned otherwise. New discoveries go on our to do/shop lists for our favorite brick&mortar stores, museums, concerts and sports venues. $upporting the artists directly is more important than ever, because very little compensation is paid by the music apps.

Been using this app since 2015. During that time, I've also tried YouTube Red, Google Music, Amazon Music, and Tidle. Nothing compares to Spotify. Such a big catalog of music, and I've been spoiled with their curated playlists. Being able to create and share playlists with friends has also made this app a must for me since I'm constantly looking for new music. So many podcasts too! Joe Rogan did a nice job signing over to Spotify. Unwrapped feature at the end of each year is my favorite!!

I've had this app for a year, so I have a new opinion on it of course. I really like the app, It has all sorts of music but some songs that I search up aren't there or I can't listen to them, also when I'm listening to such a good song there comes an ad, I shouldn't complain though since I don't have premium but those are my only concerns. At the end you'll be happy with the app! Most of the time anyways. I highly consider getting this app!!!

I love how easy and simple it is to work this app and two ads every few minutes is pretty reasonable. I kinda find it frustrating that you can only choose a few songs until you have to buy premium or wait for a while. It also gets a little bit annoying that you can only select one song at a time to put on a playlist on a phone, but I guess you could easily hop on a computer to do all that. Thanks for the app even though it doesn't meet all the requirements I want, but I'm still pretty happy!üòÉüéµ

Love it! I've been having problems loading, lately. The app loads fine, show my recently played stuff and suggested tracks, playlists and albums, but if I search for one specifically, it hangs on loading. I've not actually completed a search all morning. Cell signal has all 5 bars, 4G. I tried rebooting the phone, doesn't seem to help. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling, but now Google Play won't download it. Update: I did a factory reset. üôÑ All is good, so far.

Wide selection across all genres and languages, being able to download to your device with the (cheap) Premium subscription, and the intuitive playlists it creates ranging from lists containing and similar to what you usually listen to as well as ones specifically set up to let you listen to stuff you might like but not know to search out. Best music app I've ever had!

I've used Amazon music and Pandora, but I will ALWAYS suggest Spotify over the others The only limitations: (almost) no lyrics, you can only add playlist covers on the desktop, playlists can be difficult to edit (rearranging songs, etc), it still suggests music for me that I haven't listened to in a year and a half. What I love: The capabilities of the queue, the number of available songs, the info about artists and "similar artists," the yearly recap, Spotify's playlists, and so much more.

I love it. Wish there was options to customize like different color themes or skins but it does what it is supposed to do and that's what matters. Also wish the songs or podcasts you download would download to your account so if for example you're switching phones the same ones can be found without having to re-download and use phone storage to listen offline.. No matter the genre or type of podcast you enjoy haven't looked for a single one that hasn't been found. Thanks Spotify you guys rock!

I've been using Spotify for about 8 years now and I've never been swayed by any other music Apps. It's easy to use, has everything I need: from rock to hip-hop to all my favorite podcasts and has great recommendations of new music based on my previous listening history. The price is right and I've never had a problem with it glitching out on me. If I could rate this 6 stars I would.

Highly Recommended. Mostly all the songs are available but, I wish there was some sort of thing in which we could request the songs we wanted to have but, overall it's actually way more better than any other music streaming app I've ever used. The ads are just a misconception. The ads are never TOO MUCH or back to back. They come occasionally which I guess is pretty tolerable for anyone who's not using the premium. Keep up with the good job. Edit : There's been a login problem lately, pl fix it

I been using this music app for about two years. I don't pay for the upgrade because I never seemed to get bogged down with ads, or I always thought it liked me since I never felt like ads were a big problem. I always find exactly what I'm looking for. And my playlists get a applause, whenever I share or let others listen, be in a car or Bluetooth speaker. Thanks Spotify. You're tip top in my book

Amazing functionality and control! Just discovered any device can be a remote for another on the same network! i.e. Spotify is playing through the stereo from an iPad, can control it from the app on my android phone! Also enjoy the native app navigation when using play-fi. All this functionality on top of a plethora of music... The only thing left to wish for is studio quality streams! Would definitely pay for a higher tier Bitrate with this kind of flexibility and ease of use!

In general, it's a great app. But there are two things I can't stand: 1. The fact that there's no podcast support on Android Auto. This is unacceptable. 2. When looking at new podcast episodes, you need to tap an EP to read its full description. Well, when you go back to the list, the app takes takes you to the top instead of keeping your place.

I'm sure a lot of people know about Spotify. If you're one of the few who don't know, do yourself a favor and get this app! Personally, better then Pandora. I enjoy being able to customize my play lists, and because it links with Facebook, never have to worry about remembering another password. Great app, great music and the ads are not so bad. Love this app, used it for my music at my wedding. So do yourself the favor and download the app and get your listen on!

Spotify is my #1 app/site for streaming music. And in my opinion (and all others who wants just the music instead of bootlegs or remixes) would know its better than Soundcloud. However, what I don't understand is the fact that the freemium version via tablets and/PC seems much more of premium (unlimited skips and little or no ads) than Spotify via mobile. Other than that, it's a dope music streaming app.

I have been a premium user for years and I love the app. However, there's been a new update that requires you to follow the artist in order for them to be put in alphabetical order. I'm not going to take the time to follow every one of the hundreds of artists I have saved songs from. Terrible idea. Also, when you press "save" on an album, it doesn't save the songs, it just adds the album to your album list. I then have to go through and "like" each song to add it to my library. Very inconvenient.

Pretty much everything i'm looking for songs,artists and other forms of entertainment (pod casting, what's new,etc,)I've got an expansive and multi genre of music. Spotify can and dose give me what I'm looking for, for the most part. I highly recommend their premium service it's totally worth the cost and hell it's really nice to have a service like this. üòéüëç

I honestly LOVE Spotify! It is about my favorite app! The music quality is amazing and there are so many songs!! Premium is fun, as there aren't any commercials and since I downloaded some of my favorite playlists, I could play them as we were in the mountains with no signal!! For me, though it is a little expensive, but they have great starter deals! Best app ever!

i love this app! it's my very official playlist and this is where i collect every song i like and love. although, maybe the developers can perhaps like the idea of adding another tab for the lyrics, for a romanized version of korean/japanese or other language songs so users can enjoy it more through singing along? i'm not sure if I'm the only one doing it, but i love singing along with spotify, it's just that there are songs that are in other language and i'm unable to sing along. thanks!! üíó

I love this app because it doesn't take too much data and you can stream all types of playlists, or find a bunch of songs you love and make your own so you can listen to all your favorites anywhere anytime. I don't like that there is a certain amount of times you can skip songs, the ads are short and limited, yes annoying, but those are pretty much the only downfalls. I would recommend this to anyone who loves music.

Love this App!!! Whats not to like. You can make your own playlists. Play any song ever recorded at any given time. Even play it over and over all night long if you like. Ever wanted to learn a different language, thats on there. Pod cast, local radio, yep thats there too. Can any other music app do all that. F NO. They can't. You could of downloaded it already instead of reading this.So stop reading my review. And download it and delete your other music apps. Your not going to need them.

I love spotify, don't really mind the ads anymore, I've grown numb to it, the problem I've had (very) recently is I got signed out of spotify, when I try signing in, I am greeted with the words "Something went wrong" I have no idea what's going on, but when I sign into another account, it works for that account. I've tried reseting the password, signing in without a password, and contacted Spotify about the problem. I do not understand what's going on, overall great app.

I like it because if you want to hear a particular artist, this lets us instead of making a station where it is like radio play lists. Post Review: I still am happy with this app. The only problem that I can think of, may seem kind of trivial, but it is still a burr in my backside. When I first downloaded this app, the artists, that you choose to put in your library, listed alphabetically (which made it easier) to find what, or who, you want to listen to. This list search is time consuming.

I love Spotify! I love how easy it is to add songs to a list. Its easy to use and has a large music library for you to choose. Even a playlist with music for cats üòÇ I did have to get the premium just because I listen about everyday, and I have major music ADHD so the six skips was not cutting it for me. The app easily pairs with a Google home device or an Alexa. Although sometimes there is connection errors. I love this app and I've been trying to convince my husband to switch from Pandora.

This used to be a really good app. But for some reason, now it loads super slow. It takes forever to run and it doesn't matter if I'm on WiFi or 4G. I don't know what happened. I use the premium service and it's just really clunky. But otherwise, the music options are good and choosing to play whatever you want is pretty convenient. Just wish they'd fix the lag on startup.

My entire music library right in my pocket. Terrific search function makes it easy to find what you're looking for. Brilliant discovery engine for finding new artists and songs similar to ones I already enjoy. It's making Christmas fun being able to switch from Scottish fiddle to classic crooners. Easy to stream it through my phone to my tv soundbar and have high quality sound. One of the apps I truly couldn't live without and worth every penny of the premium subscription. Love it!

I decided to try Spotify premium after I had memorized all the ads and I must say it's good and I wish to continue. But I only have a little request though. The shuffle function on Spotify seems to always play the same songs, there are like more than 600 songs in my playlist and I've listened to about 35 of them on repeat at most. Could it be possibly for it not to play those songs if they have played the night before, it just makes me have to hand pick songs that don't play often :(

Spotify has been around for a while, and for good reason. The app is smooth with no bugs. The UI is beautiful, and most of all the audio quality is the best of any streaming service I've ever used. Finally, the content is extensive. I've found some of my favourite songs here that I can't find anywhere else. An easy 5 stars, thank you Spotify

Well, since they shut down groove music, I think as an alternative, this is great because it has a wider selection than groove. Better interface and menus. Im not going to lie, Im going to miss playing my music in my xbox games, but it's a great app. Slowly lovin' it. Give it a shot. I'm not going to lose anything if you do or dont. (Upadate): The app is better than before! Can always play my music wherever I go, and on my Xbox in the background while playing my games! $10 a month.

I've had lots of different music apps, (Pandora, iHeartRadio, SoundCloud), to name a few. None have blown my mind and given me such a fantastic assortment of music that I enjoy listening to, like Spotify has. When you pick your music and artists, upon set up within the app, it seems daunting and time consuming, but they want to be able to make YOUR listening experience the best for YOU. The daily picks they come up with that are customized to the music you like gets better and better every day. So prepare yourself for the best app available!

Had this app for several years now. I've compiled my own playlist in my library. I BT it to my vehicle's BT. I think the sound inside the app needs a little more tuning up. Compared to Sirius it's not as loud even at full max. Some bands, I've notice, such as eg; Tool don't have many songs in Spotify library. However, overall it's a really good app.

I love spotify!! Being able to make a playlist to fit me and my moods(several of them) has been amazing. Also, sometimes I want to listen to just one artist, being able to just search and play nothing but that one artist and not, music that sounds like that artist, is another feature I love very much. Plus audio books and music eras.... this app is AMAZING!!!

I absolutely love this app. I have not run across any free app that offers more choices of music and specific playlists than Spotify. I will move to premium as soon as I can to access even more features. But even with the free app, I feel like I have a musical caterer. Hey, I have iTunes and YouTube music apps also, and they're great. But Spotify ranks up there with them. Even the free version. And the 8+ minutes of silence for Mr Floyd? Class...

LOVE Spotify. Love the new update where I can delete multiple songs at a time from a playlist. I'm a little upset that the "filter" can no longer be accessed by swiping down while looking at a playlist. That feature was convenient and I used it a lot, especially to locate songs in a playlist so I could delete them. I'd also love if we could delete a song from a playlist while listening to it without having to find it in the playlist.

Best Music App ! I absolutely love Spotify and have been a subscriber for 6 years. At the onset of the digital music revolution, I was trying out many music apps that promised to perform as well as Spotify and offer the end user free access to an endless database of songs artists, playlists, albums, etc. However, the downloads were flawed - viruses, compatibility issues. or only portions of the song were downloaded. Spotify has weathered the storm and emerged as the # 1 streaming service.

I LOVE Spotify! I've Been listening daily for 5 years now and I could NOT be happier! You can find ANYTHING on here! It really is great! And I don't EVER have problems with mine. Some reviews say theirs will cut off or doesn't work right but mine never fails! I've downloaded it on probably 8 different devices since having it and it always works! Multiple cell phones, a tablet, a roku & a firestick and never an issue. Thank you Spotify for simplifying my LOVE for music! *** Truly grateful üíúJen

A lot of people whinge and complain, but at the end of the day the major artists all have their music on here (to a certain degree) which suits my taste and a majority of people use this still. I listen to a lot if rnb and hip hop music and the playlists that spotify recommend always have the freshest tracks out. On all my devices, android or otherwise, spotify is the go to music hub at any stage of the week. Thanks for doing what you do!

I have tried every other service's free trials. Apple music, beats music, rhapsody, Google music, tidal, groove, etc. You name it, I've given it a try. None of them can stack up to spotify. It has everything and it does it better than anyone else. Every other one I tried brought me back to spotify. Every update keeps getting better. I love it.

It's the best music app you can find. Awesome playlists and many features. Very easy to use, very easy to find the music/songs you want and love. You can even control the app on your PC/laptop through your phone, which I find very useful. The recent few updates made the app even more customized to your preferences, and even easier to use.

I recommend this app to my friends based on its free music abilities as well as its comparison to Pandora... As far as "free" Spotify is great. Lately with Shuffle play there's been a lot of repeat music. But you do get a gem or two ever so often. I wish the app would make the randomization of the music broader, (you know) jumping from their first albums to their newer albums. The ads are acceptable as far as a free app goes. Maybe you should go with two commercials at the top of each hour it helps people keep time. Good looking app, I lost a lot of artists that I followed through the transition but it's cool. More information about the songs would be Awesome! Writers, composers, year, date stuff like that for real music enthusiast. But Great App!

Spotify is a good app to listen to music, without using as much internet connection as hearing songs from other platform. It has a wide range of songs and we can create our own playlist. But we're only able to skip max 6 times and to be able to unlock all the functions we have to purchase Spotify Premium which cost an amount of money.

I like the songs it suggests. I think it has the second best catalogue after YouTube music. That said, a lot of YT Music is amateur covers and esoteric stuff you can't find anywhere. Also, in really enjoying the latest redesign of The Android app when you subscribe to premium. Less cluttered, arguably less choice but makes it more focused. Less choice means less time wasted browsing endless catalogues you were gonna skip anyway & more time listening.

From 5 stars to 3. None of my bluetooth devices, headphones and speaker, are receiving any sound whenever I'm using Spotify and Spotify alone. Other apps and uses are fine except when I'm playing music through Spotify. It used to work when I first bought my S10e but after a couple of weeks, the problem started. Spotify has been updated a few times since then but the problem persists. PLEASE fix this issue! It's the app most used on my phone.

I love Spotify. I haven't discovered so many good bands before I was using Spotify. I have just one suggestion to make: please put the thumb up button when playing radio also on the left side, like the add to library and the heart. I often mistakenly push thumb down on something I liked because it didn't realise it was not the heart button but the thumb button. That would be a great modification. Thank you and rock on!

Video Podcasts are unacceptable on android at the moment. I'm a long time Spotify fan, more recently bought the family plan for the last year and a half or so with absolutely no complaints. As of now, I've only recently become disappointed with the finicky video podcasts. I have a pretty up to date phone (Galaxy S10+) and great internet. I've had many random crashes when watching Joe Rogan, even when the episodes are downloaded. The video playback does not work when connected to my car bluetooth
replyContent: Hey, we'd love to help get this sorted. If you haven't tried reinstalling the app yet, we'd suggest giving it a go. If that doesn't do the trick, it'd be best if you reach out to our Customer Service so they can look into this. You can get in touch with them by heading to support.spotify.com and searching ‚ÄòContact us'.

content: Best music app hands down. Also great for podcasts. Literally the only thing I would like to see implemented is a way to reorder playlists once they are made. Edit: they fixed the Playlist issue. You can reorder them, but its kind of a pain. Also, it sure would be nice if the podcasts jumped back to the last episode you listened to. They always go to the most recent one released. So if the podcast has 500 episodes, you've gotta scroll through 499 to get to episode 1 everytime you start again

Please, please add an option to sort and search my music by genre! Sometimes I only want to listen to music I already know I like, of a certain genre, especially when studying, and would really *really* like to have such a feature. Sorting by alphabetical song name or date added just isn't how I think about which music to listen to. Thanks!

This is a great music app since you can listen to music offline if you have premium & has large variety of songs. It has no annoying pop up ads when you have the free version. Only issues I've had is when using it with my poineer car stereo through the bluetooth on my cell phone because sometimes it had hard times connecting, not playing music through speakers, & disconnecting for some reason. I solved the issue by just changing couple of permission settings on my for phone for the app.

Being a song writer (starving songwriter). I'm a bit conflicted. But I think Spotify is the best thing since sliced bread. I love it. 9/1/20 Still loving it. I figuratively couldn't live without Spotify. I can truly say that Spotify is wonderful. It's the app I use the most and thats not going to change. It's 10-28-22 and I can't imagine life without it.

I love that I am able to listen to Latina worship music as well as "golden oldie" English Christian music that I haven't heard in ages. Best of all, it's free, as long as my phone is charged. Not to mention, my phone doesn't need a ton of space for music files; only the space necessary for the Spotify app. I'm also able to explore other kinds of music and artists without having to pay for a lot of CDs beforehand. I also love how I can use the Bluetooth feature to transmit the music to a speaker for easier listening. Where do I stop? :) Ok, I'm good. Much√≠simas gracias!! (Thank you so much!!) :)

It's my go to app for great music! When you think it can't get any better, it does! I love the fact you can download music to your devices with the premium option! And even the free version with computers and tablets you can listen to any song without shuffle play! Been on it since it first came to the U S and still love it! Now it even has some of my favorite podcasts like KS95! Just started listening to Podcasts..especially Armchair Expert with Dax Shepard and Smartless...both are excellent

Luv Spotify usually has all the genres I am looking for old and new , gospel, R&B, classical. Can easily store music in my library for future listening. Pairs easily when I get in the auto.Luv the new selection choices they pick for me to listen to. Easily go through and pick and choose keepers. Which more often then not, Spotify obviously pays attention to what I listen to as the choices are usually spot on. ( no pun intended).

Excellent application. I prefer that it allows me to play music from a locked screen and offers a decent selection of music. A minor criticism is that it frequently recommends the same tunes. But hey, I like the tunes, so it's not a big deal. It's simple to get used to the interface, and I can readily find music by indie creators. I haven't tested the podcast side of things yet, so I can't write about it.

I love Spotify soooooo much üôèüôè But lately I've been having trouble with it saving my spot when paused (usually podcasts, and only paused for a few minutes). It will just start from the beginning of the episode. It also hasn't been marking episodes as played? Def very small problems but kinda annoying when you dont want to search through to find where you were, and things I've only been experiencing maybe the last 2-3 weeks so it seemed odd. Also not a big fan of the newish format but w/e

I used the free version for a while, it was great, but I wanted more access and no ads. I have since upgraded to the paid version and have been very happy with it for years. Their support team was helpful when I had a password issue, and the ability to sign in with either the app or the full desktop version and use both seamlessly is fantastic.
Easy to use with music and video

I have Spotify Premium, and it is definitely worth it. Spotify is extremely easy to use and works amazingly 99% of the time. I have a few problems such as: a few artists, it wont let me shuffle their playlists or my liked songs (such as The Beatles, Queen and Simon & Garfunkel). But otherwise it works great and I'm really hoping it's just some little glitch!

Love it, I've had it for years and I've had premium just as long. What I love is multi-device support, ie: mobile, PC, console and even on smartwatches, which is great for seamlessly switching your music sessions from one device to the next. One of Spotify's strengths is definitely their personalised playlists for your favourite genres, daily mixes or your favourite songs. Spotify has something for everyone. My only gripe is the fact that there's no options for master/CD quality streaming.

I love Spotify! Its the very best music streaming app ever! I had Pandora for some time and paid for premium but their app kept crashing and never worked right. When I decided to give Spotify a chance I loved it so much I canceled my Pandora subscription and switched. Not only did they gave me two free months of premium but I can now use premium on not just my phone but for my tablet, laptop, tv, and console too! It's worth every penny! And now they are even including Hulu! Can it get any better?

*EDIT* Fix this bug. I've been a Spotify user for years and this is pushing me away. I can't see the song that is playing and I've reinstalled 5+ times in the last 3 days. Obviously many people are struggling with the same issue. This is a massive nuisance. My favorite app. There is never any problems with Spotify! :)

3 out of 5 stars; wouldn't change a thing. Just kidding, definitely 5 out of 5 stars. I listen to music and podcasts for at least 3 hours a day. There is only 2% of the population that listens to music on this app more than myself. I was one of the beta users for the "DJ-X" ai/algorithm. Using this new feature is scary dead accurate, and has eliminated the need to make any eclectic playlists.

I have been a premium member for over 5 years now, and I will NEVER pay for a different music streaming service. The layout has always been super sleek, the amount of songs is simply staggering, and the app made playlists are incredible, allowing you to discover so much new music. I truly knew I loved this app when they introduced the "Tastebreakers" playlist. It's a 50 song playlist, that is full of songs based around your recent plays, but with a few from genres you wouldn't normally listen to

Spotify is one of, if not my favourite, app. It has almost any song/ piece of music available and on the odd occasion that I want to listen to a podcast it is there. The podcast option also allows for people to upload songs tht they like but are not on Spotify for understandable reasons (like the South Park songs, which aren't something you'd find on any music app). Spotify is without critical error, which is more than I can say for most apps. It has music for every mood, sad, happy, tired, etc.

(UPDATE) The bluetooth ID tags work! I now get proper song information and album info on the car's LCD display!                                       A majority of listening I do is through Bluetooth. It would be wonderful if the app supported song data over Bluetooth (for example, in the car so it displays what's playing, the album, etc) This is already done on the iOS version... The other key feature is Chromecast support. Literally all of the music streaming competitors have support for this. Please add!

When I first got on Spotify I wasn't really sure how much I'd use it, but at this point it knows my music tastes almost better than I do. I'm heavily addicted to my Discover Weekly playlist. I love all the new artists and songs Spotify has brought into my life thanks to their playlists. At least point I literally only listen to music on Spotify and now that they have podcasts too I rarely use anything else! Amazing, cannot recommend enough, has absolutely changed the way I interact with and consume music!

Love it! I have all my favorite music! Every kind or genre ever created or generations of people who are unknown, undiscovered, undisclosed can be found in here in the app Spotify. Learn about artists, hear their music, pick and choose from a megalist of the best of all times! Create your favorite music for free!. You can learn how to create a new style, music, you choose the right way to create your favorite songs! Pod Casts is a great way to see your favorite musicians and your musicals üéº.

I think it is amazing you need Spotify premium to get the full experience though sadly Edit: 7/8/21. Spotify has been great but I'm really annoyed because I can't listen to my library of music anymore. Sometimes I can get it to work but it's like once my data cuts off even if the songs are downloaded Spotify won't let me play songs from my library.

The easiest music streaming app to use. I have no problems with Spotify on my Android phone, which I am constantly listening to. It is very user friendly and has a huge catalog of songs with Spotify adding more all the time, especially on Fridays, which I look forward too. I love making playlists and finding more artists to follow. I also love following my friends' and family members' playlists. Spotify is my main way to listen to music now. I definitely recommend paying for Spotify Premium.

I'd reccomend it to most people. I listen on my laptop, meaning I can't listen without wifi (no data on a laptop) but I'd reccomend it to everyone. Also, I love how students in collages or universities are allowed to have unlimited skips! (If you listen frequently, spotify will ask you if you are a student and if you are, you are allowed to have free backward skips, and unlimited all skips). My experience has been fine, except for once, the songs would get cut short. This was easily solved, tho.

As a visually impaired user I find it difficult to navigate some of the options. For example; you used to be able to long press on a song to add it to the queue which was far easier than having to navigate the small menu in the right hand side of the song. It would be good if you could reintroduce the long press feature. Otherwise great app.

Just love the breadth and depth of the library. I've re-discovered tracks I had long forgotten about. Works everywhere I want and coupled with a bluetooth headset I can immerse myself and float away from the day to day must do's. I've created loads of play lists to suit moods and parties. The offline download mode is cool for travel listening when not in the connected world. After an update, this app no longer works on my Chromebook and has been like this now for several months, downrated to 3*

Spotify is a great app to use. Perks are: -Has most/all the songs that you want w// many different versions. Downsides are: (if not on Premium) -Adds that pop up or interrupt the song are a bit annoying. -You can only skip 6 songs per hour I suggest you get Spotify Premium -Quality of music is better. -Saves your data when offline. -Able to skip as much as wanted

Spotify is my favorite music app! I love the customization available to users. The fact that I can create playlists, or listen to a station playing songs similar to what I want, or just browsing playlists created by anyone. It's always an encouraging moment to create/find a playlist that speaks to you at any moment. Plus I enjoy hearing new things from recommendations Spotify curates just for me!

I love Spotify, it's one of the best friends for a person who lives alone, always nice sounds around and I get to pick whatever I want, being on premium. I don't even have to know all the songs' names or anything, I just pick a song or an artist or an album and let Spotify do the radio thing and I just enjoy it. And I'm amazed at how well they do putting together my daily mix lists as well as their own curated playlists.

This is my main music playback app. I love it even better now that there is an option to not allow explicit content, at least in the mobile app. I haven't found the option in the computer software yet. Pointers? I'm pleased with the availability of music from different countries as well. I like listening to what's popular or traditional in other countries.

I've tried every streaming service under the sun. Google Play Music, Apple Music, Tidal, etc. I ALWAYS come back to spotify. It is my most used app, and I don't know what I'd do without it. The user experience is fantastic. I've found so many new artists I'd never heard of through their 'discover weekly' Playlist. Their 'made for you' section is incredible. Spotify knows my music tastes better than I know my own. 6/5.

i love this app, been using it for a few yrs now! the music selection is huge. if you just have the free one & dnt have a subscription then you'll only be able to skip like 6 songs/hr i think & every few songs a like 30 second ad will play but that's bad to listen to music for free. i just wish you could download @ least one playlist to listen to offline w/o having to pay for a subscription. but still a great app!!

Spotify is hands down the best overall music playing apparatus in my opinion, both when it comes to the free version and the premium version. I've tried them all, from SoundCloud and SoundCloud Go to YouTube Red to iTunes to Mixtape Monkey and so on, and none have the quality, easy-to-use UI plus wide variety of music altogether, plus such a cheap pricetag for the amazing benefits from premium. As if that wasn't enough, Spotify also offers a 50% discount to all registered college students!!!

I love this sm, its literally the only thing I listen to when it comes to music (other than YouTube). I'm kinda broke so I don't have Premium, but even then, the ads that play aren't overwhelming, and slightly longer adds in exchange for 30 minutes of add free listening isn't too rare. This is one of the apps on my phone that I can genuinely say I love and probably couldn't live without

2016--Its better than downloading songs from iTunes. Thinking about buying premium so I can listen offline and do the other features. Update: 2021--I decided to buy premium and I think it was a good decision. I bought premium so that I could listen to sleep sounds at night. And the fact that I can choose whatever kind of music I want and have unlimited skips and not have to deal with the ads is way better. Still better than iTunes because I don't have to buy songs that I like just to have them.

Sometimes I get tired of Pandora and just want to listen to a specific artist's songs. I'm glad I found Spotify, because it not only lets me listen to the songs I want to, but I can set the song on repeat & listen to it again, which is really awesome. It also seems to be higher quality than Pandora one when listening to the same song back and forth between apps. I love this app! Spotify forges beauty and wonder into the music world. -Andrew Reed

Have always loved this app. The recent update to the search feature has been amazing! Before you had to know the exact name of the song and artist to be able to find the song; now you can type in a line of lyrics and it can do a lyrical match and it is so much easier to find songs in general. So much better and the *only* update we all needed.

For a long time I was downloading music and tracks that didn't work off of the Internet and putting them on my phone just to find out they didn't work. Used multiple music apps such as music paradise and still finding it hard to get great tracks. Spotify has not let me down yet and I make and manage all my Playlists straight from my phone. It's so simple to use

Edit 10/15/2020: Since last update I've had no issues. I'll edit the entire review later if no issues pop up. Previously, Everytime I turned my phone off and back on, my offline files get deleted and downloaded to my phone rather than my SD card, where they were previously needing to be downloaded again and eating up a lot of my data. Contacting Spotify support on several occasions resolved nothing, I'm not even sure if they have a solution.
