replyContent: Hey, thanks for the feedback. Our support team would like to take a closer look at your case. You can send them a message again via their contact form at https://support.spotify.com/contact-spotify-anonymous, or tweet/DM them at https://twitter.com/SpotifyCares. They‚Äôll see what else they can suggest.

content: The BEST music app, to date. Pandora and iHeart, eat your hearts out. I deleted both of those accounts when I realized what Spotify had to offer. Music I havent seen in a decade or more are here. I can press the "Download" button on any playlist and it will automatically download the songs I put in the playlist so I can listen to it when I don't have internet. The only suggestion I have is, please integrate an option to play music for a set time, i.e. 30-mins, 1-hour, etc. Great Job Spotify!!!!!

userName: Mauricio De Maria Campos Diaz Barriga
content: I found lots of music I was not able to find in amazon or other stores. Also I was able to import all my iTunes playlist that took ages to create but now it deserves 2 stars due to very slow performance....and new terms to access my privacy...media contacts etc. Which might be the reason of slow performance. Not possible to move playlists into folders in tablet version

Amazing when you have Spotify premium, idk if its worth the full price per month, since im only doing the trial but if you're not too bothered about cash then this is a great app to use! Has 99.9% of the songs I search for, super good quality at that too but I wish that I could change the covers of my playlists on the app on my phone instead of having to download the app on my laptop and change the cover from there :/// But for the main and most part, it's quite literally perfect (for me anyway)

Great way to relax and listen to some great tunes anywhere, doing anything !! Spotify has any kind of music you are looking for !!! Premium account you can save as many songs as you want and label each group with individual titles . I have at least 6 saved !!! I love the podcast on here also ,I bet anyone could find many podcast to listen to and mark as favorites üòç I just can not say enough good things about Spotify !!!!!Thank you Spotify for all you do daily!!!!!!

When I found Spotify, I quit using iTunes and saved money in the long run. I use this app daily for all of my music and new artist releases the app works great on my car stereo through USB so Im not distracted while on the road. I've had this app and been a paid subscriber since around 2014 and more great features are being added. I really like having downloaded songs that I can listen to easily wherever I go. Spotify, keep this up! I have recommended this app to my college friends and lots others! One of the better working music apps out there. Thanks!

The only place you need to go for music and podcasts. The daily mixes it provides (6 of them for me) mean I have a playlist to match whatever mood I'm in. The free version is decent if you don't mind commercials and not having the ability to change songs too often but the premium version is well worth the price... even better for students!

For some reason Spotify and my bluetooth in my car don't get along? The names and artists get stuck on the first song that plays no matter how much I skip or rewind. Also this odd, annoying thing happens where a song stops playing mid-jam until I open Spotify and switch to the next song and then back, which is really terrible while I'm driving using bluetooth. But when I use the aux in my OTHER car, this doesn't happen. Idk. Sometimes when these things happen I wonder why I'm paying 10 buck a month for it. OTHER THAN THAT overall I love my Premium though.

I have Spotify on: an LG G3, a Samsung A8, an iPad 2, an iMac, and Windows 10. It is incredibly stable across all platforms - I use Spotify daily, and I think it's crashed once in the past 3 years (it was on Windows, and it may have been due to an overnight network update). The library is large and the ability to download songs/playlists is wonderful. If you're a frequent listener, I highly recommend Premium.

I absolutely love using spotify! I love that I always have my music wherever I go. Whether it's listening to it while playing games on my ps4, playing it through my smart TV, or if I need some workout music on my phone. It's everywhere. And for a reasonable monthly price. I reccomend it to anyone who listens to music on a regular basis.

Would get 5 stars but it is pixieing on me. Playback will stop for no reason and I have to take my phone out of my pocket and press play. In addition when I either unplug my headphones or play sound from another app such as YouTube the sound on Spotify keeps playing !! Both really annoying and obviously not meant to happen. Otherwise a great app. Got a deal on premium but the free version is great too .despite the bugs would not switch. To another music app because I am afraid that the song selection or GUI would not be as good as Spotify

It keeps deleting all my downloaded music and telling me I've got more than three devices logged in, which I haven't. It's very annoying when I'm out jogging and I lose my music. I have to listen streaming which costs me a lot. This has stopped happening as much, although still happened. Good for showing new music suggestions similar to your own music.

I love this app! Many new songs ans old ones. Plus, there are even anime intros/outros. There is something that im a little annoyed about though. That i can only skip through a specific amount of songs every hour. Tbh, i think its kinda a useless thing to add. But otherwise the songs are great, and there arent that many ads! Keep up the good work! üòé

MARCH 2019 EDIT!! AFTER BEING 3/5 FOR SO LONG I FOUND OUT THE ISSUE. I transferred my storage from memory card to internal storage and Spotify mobile became fast!! (The desktop app is 10/10 astounding. Mobile app is clunky garbage, nice appearance and UI, but super slow and crashy, also missing some features that the Desktop version has. Sometimes ill press pause on a song and it won't actually stop for another 30 seconds. Any way you could make it more similar to the desktop app?)

I love this app!!!! I listen to music every single day so, $10 a month is very reasonable. It's also super easy to make playlists. Also, when all the songs in your playlist have played, they start playing music related to your playlist and I like that because, then I am introduced to new music and I don't listen to the same stuff all the time.

Adore this app. It has music to suite all my moods and needs from car rides to work to peaceful soundtracks while I sleep. I wish a few selective songs were available (e.g "Who did that to you" by John Legend) but everything else I get honestly far outweighs that. The app itself is very easy to manage and navigate. I got the family plan for myself and my boyfriend and it is SO WORTH THE PRICE to skip ads and have as much unlimited use of our music as we want. Can't recommend it enough üëç

I'm totally enjoying the music I find on Spotify. Spotify has all the music I love and new music to discover to add to my playlist. Honestly I don't mind the commercials either. They make them so short that works for me. (Update) I've decided to get premium and I love it. No commercials to worry about and skipping songs forward or backwards is so nice. I highly recommend premium with a monthly subscription.

I've been using Spotify premium for probably about six years now. I absolutely love it. I love the fact that you can download your favorite songs to listen to offline, if you don't have unlimited data or if you are in a no service zone. I've been able to find almost every artist I've searched for. The UI and the recommended songs based on what you have listed to/liked in the past are really good.

Best music app. Premium is definitely worth it. In song credits it would be useful to see the year of original release. Often when listening to a 'greatest hits' album or other compilation, I have to google to find out which year the song came out or scroll through every album by that artist to find it. The year the compilation album was released may be decades after so although is still good to know, doesn't help per track.

Love this app it's the only reliable app to stream music whether you want to use for free with ads or subscribe and download your songs. Two things I wish it would have is the ability to pin more than four playlists and to edit the liked songs as in moving them around in the order you like the same way you do with other playlists. Other than that great app!

Awesomenessü¶à Best music app that you can get. Premium is the only way to go. No ads and all the music you could ever want right at your finger tips. Great quality whether your on line or not. Download the playlists that you want to have available offline and jam out as long as you want. You will never use all of the features but it's nice to have them. Basic app has too many ads and some of the better features are locked. I use the app every day and night. Follow your favorite bands and friends

I have been a faithful paying user since 2017 (I think) and I love Spotify. I can't live without. It's the app I've always dreamed of, since I was a music-loving child! I love Spotify so much, that it's the only think I haven't cancelled now that I don't have a job and struggle financially. I couldn't live without music, my music, the suggestions, the podcasts, the algorithm works wonders! I've even convinced more than one person to drop Apple Music and sign up to Spotify and they love it!! Bee

I've been using the app for roughly two years now and it's probably my most used app right next to Discord. It is easy to use, I can make my own playlists (if you have a full membership, which I believe is worth it), you and like songs, loop songs, and the quality is some of the best I've seen even when I'm using bad earbuds. It might not have every song you like, but it will sound great with the ones that it does.

Love it since 2016. I just wished I had bought stocks at that time... Bright future ahead for Spotify. Would be good to have the lyrics of each song so you could read them within the app. Also would be useful to be able to find music based on a beat per minute range for example look for chill music that have the same range of tunes or average tunes (I am no music expert so maybe I couldn't explain myself appropriately)

I love app. Iv had it for 5 years and will not stop anytime soon. One minor thing I would love to see as an added feature is when try to add a song to a playlist and all your playlist show up in the drop screen. Maybe if there was a way to search for playlist at that point to. Scrolling through every playlist sometimes can be tedious and being able to find the playlist faster would be a great help!

I've been with Spotify for over a year. I can usually find any music I'm looking for. I love the way they put together playlists based on the music you listen to the most for you. I also like the recommendations they give also, I've found new artists that way. The membership is worth the money for what they do for you and there's No Ads! The app is easy to use and making your playlists a chinch.

Definitely the best music service out there, if you're active and like to DJ for your people where there's no signal, it's worth paying for the premium service. I have over 1,000 songs downloaded at my disposal at all times so I can play whatever I'm in the mood for or whatever the mood is. Very user friendly interface as well, seriously don't know why I dont see more people paying for Spotify.

Very Disappointed. As a Spotify everyday user on a desktop computer, I love the service. The Android mobile app was just Very Good, and I liked it. But since few weeks, I noticed the mobile app caused a Huge battery drain (20% of my average power consumption), even when the app is in background (as a service/daemon). Any idea how to fix this? I already cleared the app cache and storage, uninstalled and reinstalled the app, but it doesn't fix the issue.

Struggled with trying to find the best music service for me and well I just couldnt move away from Spotify. I tried almost all! But what sets Spotify apart from the rest are the playlist! Always based on your tastes and they always throw a curve ball or 2. The daily mixes are my favorites either way, I'll be using Spotify for a good long while!

I really like that they integrated Musixmatch so I can see the lyrics while the song plays. It's also easier to access my local files now. üëçüèΩ Edit: Sometimes when I restart my phone, spotify moves all the downloaded music from my SD card to my internal storage. It fails to move the downloads or switch back to the card unless I uninstall and reinstall the app and re-download everything. I've had this happen on two different phones. It's a minor but frustrating inconvenience.

I have had spotify premium for about 3 years, and I have never been more happy with a music streaming platform. They are constantly changing their format to make it more and more accessible to the user, and with premium I'm able to create as many playlists as I want for any situation I want. I've used spotify premium as a sound guy in a theater show, I've used it to host parties and I often use it to stream my favorite podcasts as well. Overall, this app has been my favorite since day 1.

About the best music app I've ever had. $10 a month is reasonable enough to have unlimited access to music w/o downloading anything. Although there are some songs i have found that aren't on spotify, which is VERY few in between, but I've learned to cope. Highly recommend spotify. You'll only get the full experience through the subscribed version, Otherwise you'll fall victim to shuffle and commercials. you'll even have access to your playlist. Now with tons of added features that Make it bett

Best music app ever !!! But, I've had Spotify for years. The problem is that sometimes my debet card does not have the funds and my subscription gets canceled a couple of days later. So here's the real problem, after I deposit money on that same debit card it will not accept it as valid anymore. It's bad enough that I have to struggle with banks I also have to get another debit card and the process can be draining. Now imagine that the new card has the same problem as the first. Too much

I've used Pandora for a long time. My friends recommended this to me and i fell in love instantly. Many features that are way better than Pandora. For example: the playlist feature is very handy. You can make the selections you desire from the vast library of music and easily arrange those songs into the order you want to play them. Or you can put that playlist on shuffle and allow fate to decide.

I've been using this app for years. It helped me get through the day, I can even still remember it didn't have podcasts and algorithm on how we listened throughout the year before. But now, it greatly developed to an app wherein people can put it to great use and integrate in their daily activities. I just wish the songs, esp old songs, are renewed every year because some songs are unplayable anymore. Anyway, love this app so much! Regards, Razly Samparani, PH Spotify Avid User

Fixed: To be very clear, I love Spotify. I have been a premium user for as long as I can remember and music plays a big role in my life. The last updates made my experience in music listening a lot worst. I'm used to serching by artist and adding songs to my queue. I now waste several minutes of my day every time I wish to play something. I love Spotify recommendations, I got to know a lot of brilliant musicians thanks to Spotify. I don't need them on my artist tab. Plz fix this.
replyContent: Hey there. We‚Äôd love to get some more info so we can help with this. If you have the time, give our support team a shout. You can find them here: https://bit.ly/2zhNwyX.

content: Only real issue is sometimes it doesn't want to load an artist page from your library, but I also have a larger library than most, so it's possibly just a volume issue. Like, when I select an artist from my library, it pulls up a blank page with no songs or albums. Usually backing out of the page and selecting it again fixes it, but not always.

Hands down my favorite, most used app on my phone. I love the structure and format. It makes it so easy to not only listen to music and podcasts, but also makes it so easy to discover new music you would never have found on your own! This app does everything I expected and more! If you're using other music apps I could only assume it's because you've never used Spotify before

So far I love the app. I can listen free for hours on Spotify. With Iüñ§. It seemed that the app deliberately chose music I couldn't tolerate. Instead of less selections of the type of music I had rejected it seem to send it faster until I had no non prime rejects left. Then the prime free trial pop up would tell me I had no rejects under the free app.. I said oh no! I have 1 more! And I exercised my rejection of their app.

My favorite audio listening app. I used the free version through middle and highschool, and now I am a premium user, and its worth it every month. The only thing I think could be better, is adding a 'custom' setting to the sleep timer option; as it is now you can only choose a maximum of 1 hour or the end of the podcast episode. It would be helpful to be able to set a sleep timer for larger increments of time.

Best music app around and easy to navigate!!! The one thing that i can complain about is the fact that you can't choose songs from your playlist to play unless you pay for premium..And they will play random songs that arent in the playlist that you may have made but on a computer or playstation you can select the songs but not on the app.

I use this app daily for the music I listen to. This app allows you to pick songs from an seemingly endless amount of genres, playlists, and artists to place in your own personal playlists. If you have premium (which I higly recomend for $10 a month) you can download the songs to your device of choice and listen when you have no internet access. This app is truely 10/10 for me and I can recomend it more!

I'll give this a 5 star, i always add the trending songs on my playlists which no longer make me forgetwhat song im listening to. and when i listen to songs, i mostly listen to my playlist because all of my favorite songs are there. Plus, even tho im not on Spotify Premium, i can just deal with the ads because it only pops up sometimes. I use Spotify on my pc because i can rewind and forward to songs and tap the "Next Song" Button thingy all the time and for free. I had no problems with it too!

I love being able to listen to my favourite music. Although, to be able to do that, you have to make it into a playlist, you can't just listen to that one song. And I can't put a song on repeat, like I could on a tablet I had it on (I now have it my phone). Still good though, has every song you could think of. I would absolutely love it if they put a repeat button on this version though.

I decided to try Spotify Premium with the free 30 day trial which I had to do on my phone's browser since this app kept crashing.  I like the option of downloading music for offline listening, but the problem is that it consumes too much of my phone's internal space.  There should be an option to save this app to my SD card instead of on my phone's storage.  Every time I use a phone cleaning app, all my downloaded songs are erased.  It's already happened 4 times.  Needless to say, I'll cancel this out.

I understand that you have to get premium to rewind or play the song again. For example on the computer you can skip to songs, shuffle, rewind, its great. I dont understand why its not the same on a phone. But if your listening on your phone and you dont have premium, like what if a song you want to listen to is on a playlist. Which means you have to listen to the whole playlist until you get to the song you wanna hear! Please change this then I will give a higher score

A massive improvement since the launch. The UI looks good and there is a lot of content even if sometimes they remove some albums or stuff like that. 10 quid a bit overpriced since they only remove the ads and allow to skip music from mobile. They should offer something extra for premium members. However good, still better than Apple Music.

Dude. This is one of the BEST apps I have. Being able to create multiple different playlist and everything, is fantastic! I use Spotify all the time. Everyday, like for example doing some school work, or in the hallways of my school, doing chores, literally anything. Being able to listen to music of my choice is something that makes me very happy. Music is my life. I 1000% recommend this app for other people as well. Spotify >>>>> anything else

So simple to use, to add, delete and move music around as well as create new playlist. Love the fact that I can play my favourite tunes in my car by just connecting to bluetooth. Great quality and crystal clear sound. Been quite a few versions of tunes I couldn't find but who am I to complain when I have thousands of others to choose from.

My review in 2016 was 5 stars. I've been a premium family user for at least 3 years and a solo premium user since 2016. I have always enjoyed this app and use it daily during work. As other users are saying the app is not working how it is supposed to. My biggest frustration is the Now Playing bar, it disappears and there is no way to pause, skip, rewind etc while listening. Even closing and restarting the app doesnt help. I'm going to be searching for another service. Do better please.

great app! Spotify lets you find any music you want in many different languages and even from movies. you can download these songs, Podcasts and even videos so you can listen anywhere you want without wasting your data. after figuring out the type of music you like, it will create daily mixes for you to listen to when you dont know what to put on. the price is reasonable for how much you are receiving. I highly recommend this app for anyone who is a music fan, like I am.

Had a problem for months where it'd say you were offline when using data. Can't look up songs even though you're connected through data. Edit 12/25/18 Been an update to the app since then and also got a new phone. Haven't had the issue since. Also I can now select multiple songs to delete from my playlists so that's a really nice plus. Enough for me to bump it up to five stars.

I'm really enjoying the app these days. For a while I switched to Google play music and really liked that until they moved everyone to YouTube music. That is when I came back to Spotify and I'm glad I did. The app is continually improved and is really working great for me now, including casting to my Yamaha a3060 and all my Sonos speakers. I really enjoy the playlists that it creates for me, like all my favorite songs from 2018. I also like that it remembers what I've been listening to lately.

People who truly love music use Spotify, it has all the best parts about Pandora, iTunes, and YouTube combined into one seamless platform with none of the drawbacks. It's simple to listen to what you want and find what you like, whenever you like. Best $10/month I've ever spent. Plus you're a student, you get all of these services for $5 a month, plus Hulu and Showtime. Probably the best subscription deal around.

Discovering songs new and old that I never could have never afforded or had access to growing up buying cds and vinyl. Would be better if the artists could make more money through Spotify. My only niggles is having to drag and drop songs when I edit playlist to put them the order I want. If was a way to make quicker would be perfect, very time consuming. And I have to constantly block ty segall cover of everyone's a winner, it seems to come on my daily playlists/discover. Song does my nut in

It's July 8th, 2021.... Still love Spotify. I do wish that I could rename/save the 'Discover Weekly' playlist, since there are times when I can't listen to everything & figure out which songs I want to add to a newplaylist or simply 'like' so the AI will give me more of the same.... need more time to sort things out. Maybe a simple function that lets me add another week?? Must be lots of other Listeners who might like this kind of feature.... Anyway, the Discover Weekely AI is usually great!

The app itself is good and serviceable. I just don't like how it forces you to listen to other music if you're only in the mood for a particular album, and skipping a suggested song just brings up another suggested song instead of one from the album. But again, that's not an issue with the app, that's an issue with their service as a whole.

This has replaced everything! BUT it's become waaaaay too glitchy. Takes forever to load, sometimes can't pull up queue or search songs. Takes forever to switch play lists (if it even gets to that point). Doesn't "crash" per say, but doesn't function as smoothly as it used to so I had to change my rating from 5 to 3 stars.

Please make the menu available when offline. It is incredibly irritating not being able to access the parts that don't really require a connection. Especially with my internet connection meaning half the time I can't access it. Home and browse almost never load, I at least have to try again and again with my android device that has downloaded songs, however my second android device loads straight up most of the time, its a lower performance device only difference is it has no downloads on it. Might add their logged in to the same account. Thanks

Best music app ever! I love making collaborative playlists and sharing the songs I love with my friends, the group listening session is also awesome, I feel like the recommendations for songs to add to a playlists could be better but it's not a big deal. If they add more ways to find and follow your friends then it will be truly perfect, not everyone uses FB.

One of the best music apps I've ever used an I have by far used it the most. It has a decent free account but there are a few drawbacks. When you have your own music library on the free account, you find yourself listening to a handful of songs almost everytime you select that playlist, yet there are songs you almost never hear because you dont have a true skip function nor can you select songs. I also am confused how the spotify premium is so expensive in comparison to the spotulify/hulu bundle. I dont use hulu, but nor do I want to pay so much for only what I will use. Would suggest a price decrease for just spotify premium

I love Spotify! You can listen to music without having to constantly attend to your phone unlike some other music apps. All the music on the app is perfect!üëåThey have all the bands and artist I like and more! love how you can make a playlist, download it and then listen to it offline. It makes it super convenient for times like road trips, places with no internet, and more!

I highly recommend this app to everyone, it is great to hear music, podcasts or any other songs! I love how we can favorite a particular Song, add it to our playlist and then hear it in the future. Spotify contains all the songs, the voice has high qualities, plus, what I like is there are all the songs! They are always applicable. Highly recommend üòä

Update 01/17/2021. I got a subsction and now able to play a playlist in order. The subscription is well worth the money you pay. They are missing some music. Like the original vapor trails album by Rush. But that's it. I've down loaded all the album and song that I have ever owned or liked. I like that I can share the music with other people. I like that it works with navigation apps.

I enjoy Spotify and the student premium rate is totally worth it. I would love to see an option for saving daily mixes and just saving more things in general, like playlists as they are, without future updates. That way you don't have to worry if a playlist you like and follow gets removed or changes a lot. I would also like to be able access lyrics more easily for any song. Overall, I have discovered a lot of cool music and podcasts through this app while being able to play old favorites too.

Love Spotify. Literally my most essential app. I use it all day every day. Adding audio books was an amazing next step. Home screen customization would be nice for premium users. I do feel a little bombarded with podcast recommendations and would like to be able to move that down the page a bit in favor of music recommendations or even an upcoming concerts section for my most frequented musicians. The ability to opt out of LGB and other social issue based content would be nice as well.

Perfect, just what I wanted. I always said I'd never pay for a music app, but I'm on the free trial and I intend to keep Premium. Finally an app that understands Symphonic Metal and screaming like a banshee with laryngitis is not the same thing. I don't do podcasts, but I do listen to the Laugh List a few times a week. Suggested playlists are on point and making my own is easy... No random artists cropping up or songs I dislike getting played just because they're popular. 5/5.

Spotify is one of those apps that everyone should have. I absolutely love it. Do yourself the favour of downloading it. I guarantee it will be worth your while. Use the free trial and if you feel you want to be ad-free and have all the other bells and whistles of Spotify, like being able to download songs to listen to when not connected to the Internet, then consider going "Premium".

great app, always used and always will, I think they should make a points system, and they can be traded in for special features, but it's not that important. But what is important is how great and easy the platform is to use. it has all the current songs, they should also have section for unreleased sings by popular artist, but still not the point, amazing app.

the best app I've had for music. with premium I can download music, make playlists, follow playlists, search any song and play it right away with no ads or any annoyances. its worth the subscription, although the one complaint I have is that I wish it was cheaper, or a 1 time purchase. I use this app with musixmatch, which hears the song and pops up with the lyrics. makes it really fun if you don't know a song well or are singing with friends.

I'm giving it 4 stars, not 5, only for 1 reason. You can't select multiple songs at once to move in or out of a playlist, which means if you wanna build a playlist, it takes a lot longer than it should. It should be the same way your Gallery works, how you can tap and hold to move many pics / files at once. Other than that, spotify is awesome. Having millions of songs at your fingertips for the price of 2 starbucks coffees a month? Worth it =)

Love it! Loved it for a long time! Only thing I would like the settings to be changeable between autoplay where I left off, and going back to a previous song/beginning of the song. I switch back and forth between songs quite frequently on the computer and tablet - when I first downloaded the app - but they don't let you go backwards on the phone app. It's only a suggestion, but I would like that to be available.

Best app to listen to any genre of music. I always find new music weekly that I enjoy a lot and I love how it keeps you up to date on artists you listen to often. I've been using Spotify for the past 4 years and I can say that this is one of the best music apps out there; better than iTunes. Spotify has such a wide culture of songs, I believe you can listen to pretty much anything with this app. The streaming is good, you can play anywhere, and it's fair price on top of free Hulu.

One of my favourite apps!! Warning: I find it way more enjoyable with Spotify Premium, especially if you're planning on listening to Eg. Musicals (where you want to listen to the songs in order). Nearly every song is on it and I'm able to find loads of new playlists to enjoy, overall I use it for hours every day, it's the bestü•∞

Great! Just saying, it would be nice if you could change the playlist picture on your tablet, ipad, every device? anyway, really good app but you gotta pay for no ads and multiple other things. I am the opposite of a hater for this app!üòÉüòçAlso, there is a bug where in the song screens, your username is translated into a heap of numbers and letters, not huge but annoying. Love it! Also, it is kinda slow when you want to listen to a podcast and it is frustrating.

I read some reviews that people have made saying that Spotify is a bad app, I disagree. Even though I have Spotify Premium, I went through a time where I didn't, I thought the adds were annoying every thirty minutes but I never thought the app was bad. I could create playlists that had my favorite songs, shuffle them, and then be happy the rest of the day when listening. There was none of the problems that people have been listing. There were no inappropriate adds, there was no bad shuffling issues, there was a good selection of songs in the recommended section. I really like the app, just wish they had lyrics to songs still so I don't have to look up lyrics when I'm listening to a new song instead of giving backstory to the song lyrics.

Honestly, I've tried Pandora and YouTube (seriously, who hasn't?!), and Spotify definitely gets my vote for being the best Music app available, regardless of whether you're using it on an Android, an iPhone, or even your tablet or computer. Listen to a remarkably and incredibly gigantic plethora of all of your favorite tracks from the artists that elate you, the ones that calm you down, and even the ones that inspire you beyond measure, and feel joy like no other that you can do so from the comfort of your own home not to mention on the go! And when you're done reconnecting with all of the songs you listened to when you were a kid and growing up, not to mention the ones you've been hearing on the radio (mixed in with more commercials than I'd like to admit), take some "you" time and journey through the rest of their insanely generous collection and discover new favorite artists and songs, not to mention songs from artists you love but didn't realize they had released! So why are you still reading the reviews for this incredible app? Download, install, login, and prepare for the adventure of your life! Man am I SOO jealous!!

I've been a Spotify user for years now, love the app. Although recently, when I play songs, they'll skip or stop for a second and I'm not sure why cause I'm usually connected to wifi. And its only on Spotify; I listen to my music through speakers and headphones usually and I dont have problems with other apps audio, only Spotify. Not sure if its just me or if other users are having the same problem but I wanted to say something about it just in case.

I don't have Spotify Premium, but what I can say is that Spotify is great for when your out and about and wanting some music on your travels, it allows you to play any playlist you want, when you want with Freemium but you are restricted to 6 skips. So, as a comprimise, they let you make your own playlist on the go! Play your favorite music, at no cost and listen to some kickin' vibes, or down low Chill.

I have used both Premium and the free version. Both are good. Yes there are few adverts and you can't pick the specific song you want to listen to you on your phone (if you're a freebie) but it's really not that awful. You get used to muting it out and good shuffle of songs keeps your fave artists interesting. Well worth it if you pay for Premium as you can satisfy THOSE moments when you *need* to play that song!

Spotify is literally life changing. The variety of music to choose from, making endless playlists, being able to collaborate with friends to make a bomb playlist is actually insane. The best part in my opinion is when they reccomend music, discover weekly is amazing. I would definitely reccomend this to everyone and anyone. What's not to love about it?

Always loved Spotify and still do. The premium is worth it; however, I'm a bit disappointed when it's free. I find it odd that you can actually choose which song to play on your computer when using Spotify for free but have no selection when you're on mobile. I've been wondering why for a long time actually. Anyway, still love the app. Just got questions.

I enjoy the ability to play unlimited amounts of music of my own choosing on my laptop, and sometimes on the phone. Not as happy when I can't go backwards in a playlist on my phone, or when Spotify adds suggested songs to the list. It seems to add songs when you request a single song (and then you can't play that song again for a while), or it adds extra songs to shorter lists. But, as a free service, and in terms of the range of music available, it is my favorite.

Absolutely live Spotify, but I also haven't use many other apps either, easy to use and has tons of songs. I really like how they also take what you're currently listening to and make play lists out of it of songs that are similar to what you currently like. Overall amazing app and not a bad price if you are a student. I jjsy wish there was a way for it to consume less battery

I used to waste hundreds of euros on CDs and later buying albums online, now Spotify has all of them and much more for a price of less than an album a month! Being able to set up playlists for every mood/occasion and sharing them is simple! The only thing that is missing is Fitbit support. The Family subscription is an amazing deal as long as you live in the same house with five others you only really pay 3 Euros a month. Reliable, good integration on tons of platforms, huge on&offline library!

Smooth interface. Has more music than Apple music and allows for downloads on many devices. So does Apple music but you'll have to download songs individually and such on a android. Spotify works fine on both. I find new music on her daily due to the enhanced button above my library. Didn't find new music on Apple I just listened to what I knew. Spotify helps you find the music that's right for you then at the end of the year it will give u a review of your most listened and more. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

This is the #1 music app. I have a Spotify premium student account (which I think is someyhing like $5 or $7/month), so I can't speak to the free verson. I absolutley love sotify. One of my favorite things is the fact that Spotify's song reccommendation algorithm is better than any I've seen. I've used Pandora and Google Play Music and neither of them have algos like Spotify's. When you get to the end of a playlist, Spotify will just start playing another song that it thinks you will like.

One of the best music streaming apps available. Never had a problem finding music to listen to with an extensive library to choose from. Audio quality is good even with the free account. I used to hear inappropriate adverts but these seem to have improved. I also use the setting to not allow tracks with explicit lyrics, but some still get through, however, there is an option to report the track which I hope is acted upon.

I have been a Spotify listener for years now. I enjoy many genres of music. So creating my own playlists is the way for me. But when I do get to end, the music Spotify has added to my playlist is just right. I have always been able to find the exact songs I am looking for on Spotify too. I don't think anyone will be disappointed. Thanks for doing such an awesome job.

I'd place Spotify as one of the greatest apps for music lovers. I give this app the highest possible rating for it's ability to entertain, educate and help me keep up with my favorite artists. I immediately get notifications when my favorite artists release new content. I'll never use another app for music as long as I have a smart device.

I have had minimal issues with Spotify. I use it frequently. I use the Like playlist so much that it becomes boring, but turning on shuffle helps immensely. They suggest new albums and I really enjoy that. they suggest playlist and that helps my curious drive. they don't have all the music I like and don't have a huge selection of remixes but it isn't the end of the world. I am still inexperienced with transfering my music files. not sure if that feature is unavailable. overall great app.

This is iHeartRadio, Pandora, and Audible all in one. It's awesome! Full album releases, rewind, fast forward, monthly songs to discover, a playlist for ANYTHING you can think of, they even have audio books and language learning! Omg! You can share playlists with friends and listen to the same music! And the running playlists play music to the rythm of your running. Its pretty awesome! I'm so satisfied, I hardly use YouTube anymore!

I decided to get the premium version and when I did I had a few issues at first. I would start playing an album and then it would sometimes stop playing right in the middle of a random song. I tried both the Lite version and also this version but nothing was working. Now for some reason that has stopped and now it works perfectly. I'd highly recommend it, especially if you aren't always connected to wifi/cell tower range. It's also better quality than pirating music and more above board.

I play almost exclusively Classical music. The range here is vast and growing! I virtually never use my collection of CD 's now. At $9.99 per month it is less than the cost of a bargain CD. Had the program a few years - have been tempted away with' free offers ' on occasion, but always returned and the latest software is much better on my phone and tablet. Here we are 6 years later and STILL THE BEST!

The music quality is great ! Any playlist can be found in spotify . Although there is advertisement but the condition is fair enough because after advertisement, you'll get to stream 30 minutes of music without ads interruption. But there is an issue I'd like to report , it's about the ads that needs to be close . Those ads just won't close when I press the 'DISMISS' or the 'x' button. Please fix this bug ASAP becuase I'm gettin' real sick of it. Thank you !

I've been using amazon music for quite some time but their app functionality suffers as an offline music player among other issues, finally took the time to try this out, and while it is a bit different to get used to, Spotify is quite nice..note-make your own playlist, then download it to control what songs take up space, any songs you add later will auto download also. Last but not least the sound quality is 99% of the time better than amazon uhd. Con:I do wish it had true shuffle (no repeats)

Your app is amazing! The ads are ads that you need to watch for free uninterrupted 30 minutes or a reminder that you have 30 minutes of uninterrupted music, which if you ask me is pretty kind. One problem though, you guys add things to my playlist that I don't want and they play and I either have to use my skips, or I have none left. So I end up having to listen to that song and those unwanted songs end up taking over my playlist!

It's s great price point and easy app to use. They usually fix app issues very quickly, unlike others. I just wish they would add a swipe option to remove s song from your playlists, or the likes one. Would also like to know the codecs used on the music. I tried YouTube Premium and Amazon Music Unlimited and Tidal. Haven't tried apple music. But if/when I get an iphone. I'll check it out.

I love spotify. I was reluctant at first to get it because it seemed mainstream, but I really enjoy it now. The ability to download my favorite songs with premium is a great feature, and if I don't listen to some of the songs I've added I can easily remove them and pick different ones with out having to wait for my phone to delete it and re-download the new ones. A lot of smaller artist use spotify and even when I thought I wouldn't be able to find them, I did. 10/10 would recommend. üòô

I listen to and discover more music than ever before. The Spotify service is excellent and the app is pretty good. The discovery playlists bring new music you might like to your attention, and I've discovered many great artists this way. Spotify Connect, where you use the phone app to control Spotify on other streaming devices, is a really intuitive system.

Love the app. Great streaming. Generally everything I want is there. Suggests other artists when I'm feeling a certain type of music so it helps me intelligently to add more songs. My only issue? There's no Sleep option. (update: well there's finally a sleep option that was included maybe a year or so ago. So back to 5 stars you go, Spotify!)

I've been using the app and paying for the subscription for the last 5 years, it already suggest me amazing music and knows what I like to listen to. The app is very friendly to use and has many playlist depending on what you like and what you're looking for so it is a good choice. The only thing I'd improve is the quality of the audio although it is not bad at all, there are another platforms that offer HiFi or 360 reality audio.

So, I'm rarely ever even upset with an app. I'm pretty easy to please. But, for the last four hours, spotify has very nearly ruined my life. At the beginning of the evening, it was only very slow to respond. Eventually, it signed me out without prompt. It refused to let me sign back in, claiming I'd already used that email account (yes, I was "logging in," not "signing up"), and then began the phone crashes. I factory reset phone, failed spotify download twice, and now it won't even open. At. All.

Spotify is very important to me. It has all of my favorite music in one place with custom playlists and also good Spotify created playlists. The app is intuitive and clean - they frequently update as well. At the end of the year you get an awesome recap of your top jams and favorite artists, always a treat to look through that. Definitely use Spotify if music is an important part of your life!

I've been using Spotify app for a while now and I consider it the best app for finding music algorithmically tailored to your liking. I have found numerous artists via using features such as the weekly recommended tracks and artist radios. I'm a free user but the value is still there. The UI updates from the past year or so are a great improvement as well. Overall I find myself using this even more than my home music cloud due to its constant addition of even the most obscure artists.

Great for streaming in nearly all aspects, not necessarily the highest quality out there but more than good enough for personal use and then some. You CANNOT tell the difference between this and tidal on home speakers, car speakers, earbuds or headphones. Only thing I don't like is that there isn't really a way to theme is or anything. IE change colors, or menu options. But right now it's the best streaming app out there in my opinion.

I think Spotify is great as you can stream music where ever you go if it is saved to your library and it gives you some in site into the song and artist. It also keeps playing if your phone turns off. The only complaint I have would be that you do have to remember to pause the music if you are going to leave your device unattended but apart from that it is great!!!!

I've been using Spotify for as long as I can remember, which would consist of 6 to 7 years. And I came from using Pandora, and I loved Pandora. But when I started using Spotify I quickly realized that a paid subscription of $9.99 a month was definitely worth the investment. Spotify in my opinion is the best music platform on the planet. The playlist and the recommended songs and music that they recommend on a daily basis, continue to diversify my music taste. That way everyday is a new day.

Love Spotify. Great selection of playlists and good recommendations based on what I listen to. Family plan is great as my wife and kids can also listen to what they like. One thing I'd like from a parent point of view is the ability to block explicit lyric versions of songs; while I'm playing with my kids listening, but also against their accounts. Explicit lyrics are already indicated on the song so just needs the options added.

Seamless, love it. Also like the podcasts section. Question: I don't know if it's a glitch or not but when I look for and play something in "my songs" afterwards it only plays songs from that search, which is ok, but I can't undo that queue and automatically listen to everything else after I delete the search filter.

Spotify over Pandora and YouTube music any day of the week for me. Easy to use. Promotions to help make monthly payments small if you choose to upgrade. But even if you stay free the ads are minimal. I love the playlist they generate. I honestly just don't have anything bad to say about Spotify. I had an issue with my subscription one time, which I emailed them and got a response quickly. And it was me that was making the mistake but they was very nice regardless. I love my music so üëçüëç!!!!!!!!

Spotify is great. I previously thought of some improvements but can't think what they are right now. Okay now I've thought of some again. I guess one would be a light theme. Two would be to be able to see only those songs and artists you have already downloaded. Another would be to be able to change the views (lists, pictures) of my library artists, songs pages etc, and change the font/screen size. Thanks Spotify!

I love this app, had to leave it for a few years after plandemic started. When I came back my playlists where still there but the price I pay is more. I know there's other music apps & even free ones but I like the way Spotify works, its user friendly. However, I can't seem to change the position of my selected songs on my playlists. Use to do it but its not done the same way anymore & don't know how its done now but I'm sure contacting Spotify support team for help with that will do the trick.

I have always jumped back and forth between music apps, so I am very used to most of the popular ones. However Spotify was the least well known to me. I decided to try it out again recently after some years. I now Love it and I'm considering a paid subscription. I love that you can make your own Playlists, watch videos, show lyrics and especially I love to read the back stories behind some of the songs. One of my favorite features is the offline mode that allows you to listen to your music and playlists that you've downloaded without having to go online. I love using it via the Bluetooth in my car without using up data. I have a free 1 month subscription right now and I am really enjoying it. I truly recommend it!

A great app for listening to the music of your choice and even adding your own playlists. Adverts are included but that's why we can get this top app for free! Adverts don't bother me; if you listen to the radio then there's adverts on music radio stations so what's the difference? None; apart from on Spotify you control the music you want to listen to when you want to listen to. I love this app. I'm downloading again as I had to free up space on my phone. Now I can reinstall again. Happy dayz...oh yeah! Thank you Spotify for this amazing app.

After using and fine tuning Pandora for years, I gave Spotify a shot. I did not like it. At first. First thing I did like was that there is an option for CD quality audio buried in the options. This appealed to me, as a music lover. Next thing I did, I manually added song after song of various genres, to many playlists and saved many a album to my account. That's when I realized how great Spotify can be when you feed the AI properly, as your recommended music playlists gets better and better. In short it takes some doing, but for my money Spotify can't be beat.

I've been using Spotify and it keeps getting better, my only issue now is that you have to push the top to access repeat. I liked it when it was at the bottom,or maybe move the 3 buttons to the bottom so they're all in one place rather than spread out. They have made it easy to find music that i would like, the suggestions from radio are perfect

Spotify is better than its competitors in most aspects. I've tried most of the other popular music streaming services and Spotify is the overall winner in my opinion especially because of how well it works on different devices. One issue I have with Spotify is that it is not easy (or not always possible) to rearrange (eg. via drag and drop) the queue (the list of songs now playing).

Oh my gosh! How I've missed you! Such a good music app. I've used Google play music, which is par and acceptable, and YouTube music (waste of time honestly). So now after what I think has been close to four or even five years, I'm back. And oh my gosh how I've missed it. Thank you guys so much for listening to your customers. It's things like remote abilities, podcast, and being able to access your own library is just some reasons I should have never left. You're awesome, keep up the good work.

Been using Spotify for a long time now. I enjoy it quite a bit! Searching for songs and artists is as easy as it can get, and making your own playlist makes revisiting your favorite songs hassle-free! The only issues I've ever encountered were regional issues where some artists do not allow access to certain areas or countries outside of their own. Otherwise, I feel that my monthly payments are well worth the experience that I receive with this app.

Spotify Premium is the only music app I've been using for years now. I'd wish for more personalization features, and for a multi-user/social interface, allowing for something like a party mode, for instance. Still, I'm pretty content with the app's songs and music genre variety, it has a pretty good algorithm, and I have experienced no bugs at all.

I have a Spotify family plan. It is worth every single penny. I am amazed by all the podcasts, radios, and playlists availble on Spotify. There is so much variety in every genre a person can imagine. The features amaze me too, such as the ability to view and rearrange the order of a shuffled playlist. I have been in so many situations where I have needed to see what songs are going to play next to avoid playing certain songs with people. I am forever a Spotify Stan.

originally started of with the free version. it was very good. Dynamic playlist would recommend really good songs. An option to try the premium version for $1/month for 3 months was offered, so i decided to gibe it a try. It is one of the best services i am subscribed to. An extremely wide selection of songs can be selected anytime. I have yet to experience problems with streaming. Quality of the music delivered is second to none. I would definitely recommend this app to anyone.

A collection of some of the best music out there, surprisingly good, in fact. Surprised at the music available. If the music would just keep playing! On its own, it will just stop after 3 songs or 30. Doesn't matter if streaming or offline. I have cleared the cashe, uninstalled / reinstalled, etc. Happens on an Galaxy S8+ and Galaxy 7 but not PC. $15 a month for a service that doesn't completly work. Thinking of uninstalling.

Just perfect for everyone's taste in music with just few dollars ,that's in case you wanna get the premium version of Spotify(Spotify premium), which I highly recommend if you have some money to spare,because anyway it's not mandatory, it's there for you in case you like/want/need lots of personalization in your music in addition to offline playback.

Most songs are here. Awesome. If you have any songs you want added, there are tutorials out there that can add songs/audio files from your computer to your personal music library (meaning the addition will be privy to your account). Equalizer is really good. Interface can use a different mode that contrasts the current design for varying preferences. It's pretty tricky too when you try to view the whole library of music of a certain artist. Perhaps improve that as well. Overall, just greatness.

I have to join the chorus of unhappy users. The app just turns off for no reason, even if I'm not using my phone at all. It just happened three times in the last 30 minutes. UPDATE: I uninstalled and reinstalled the app and downloaded all of my music again. That seems to have fixed the issue. A little bit of a headache to do but worth it to get the music running again. I really didn't want to have find another music service. Plus, Spotify responded to email very fast. üëçüëçüëçüëç

Almost every song I've searched for is on the service, feel like the playlist features are robust. Would like to be able to change order of songs for playlists in mobile app. Also, for searches on desktop app which return a large number of results, would like to be able to mark off where I stopped so I can restart review of results without getting lost. Overall, love the service and would highly recommend.

I like how it is expanding its music library. I didn't use this before as it didn't contain the genre I am listening to, but now it is included and I'm enjoying using the app. The app is a little confusing at first, but once you understand the interface it works well enough. The widget closes down though, so when I get to my car and Bluetooth connects, I can't just press play, I have to open Spotify first before I can control it through me cat, but I think this may be a Galaxy S8 thing.

Spotify has been my go to music app since I've found it! The free version was nice, still being able to create playlists. Though the limited skips sucked. My family used it so much we just went for the family plan! Now we each have it without commercials and unlimited skips. There's no limit I've found for songs in a playlist. I have one with well over 1,000 songs. I also love the "Discovery Weekly" playlist made for me each week based on other songs I've listened to. I look forward to finding new songs on it or being reminded of old songs I've forgotten. The range of music is also amazing. There's been maybe two songs that I haven't been able to find on Spotify that I wish were on here. Definitely recommend this music app!

I've had a premium account for years. It's my favorite music app above all others. Music, audiobooks, podcasts, it's all here. But lately my playlists get hung up after 1-4 songs. I have to close the app completely and then reopen and restart the playlist which is frustrating when I'm trying to get into a flow of tasks but either keep hearing the same songs bc the playlist started over again, or having to stop what I'm doing to force close the app and go through all that every 3-10 minutes.

My family loves spotify. We pay for the family subscription and we all have access to a ton of music, ad-free. The vast majority of the time, the app just works. Word to the wise, if you will need access to music off-line for whatever reason, test it by putting your device on airplane mode before you'll be without wifi or mobile data. Sometimes there's some glitchiness that will leave you unable to access your downloaded playlists, so best to troubleshoot before you need it and can't.

Love making playlists, and love the remote access on WiFi! I am Spotify premium and I wouldn't change a thing! Nothing compares! The crossfade feature alone for me make sit my number one. I make playlists for running and arrange them so they flow into each other! Plus, I can integrate my library into Spotify 's and download it all together. Their daily mix is one of my favorites. Six different choices of randomly picked songs made by them for you based on what you' ve been listening to.

This morning I got a message in Spotify asking if I'd consider rating it.  I paused and thought to myself "Yes indeed, I would love to share my thoughts." I've been using it for almost a year now, first the free version and then earlier this summer I took advantage of a promotion to try out the paid subscription. I have been absolutely delighted with the service.  I pretty much exclusively use it to listen to praise and worship music and love the way it monitors what I listen and respond to and then makes subtle suggestions of new songs I might like. Through this process, I have discovered songs that are now among my absolute favorites that I would have never heard on the radio our found with my own searches.  I was initially reluctant to go to the paid service, but now that I have been using it for several months, I think it is so worth the $10 per month for the added flexibility, lack of commercials, and continuous availability. I usually listen to it in my car instead of radio and love the way it tracks you across all of your electronic devices. It remembers where you left off listening and even allows you to remotely control playback between devices.   Truly a great service.

When I switched over to Spotify from Groove, my songs got switched to the cendored versions which pissed me off. I have a LOT of music and so now I have a lot of songs I have to go through. Also, the app on the Xbox One could use some work. Besides that, this is a great app overall. There's more albums available here than Groove had.

The app is great. The only issue I have is with local downloaded music I had previously. They don't organize it like they do their catalog.. plus, if it's on my computer, it doesn't sync to my phone to listen to it on the go.. Apple music has this feature.. Maybe you can implement it too? I would prefer to use all my media through one app so if spotify can do that, I would have no reason to switch around all the time. Other than that, it's great.

This app is brilliant, but it's only decent when you pay for premium. The sound quality is at the standards, no advertisements, and you can download 100+ songs within seconds ready to be played while in a long car journey, or no Internet is general. Don't get me wrong, even though you don't have premium, this app is still the best one going, accept that you will need to suffer from long advertisements, and have no accessibility to music when offline. This app is worth every penny, and no regrets

For years, I have tended to stick to my own little bubble of music, only listening to new ones here and there. It wasn't until I started using Spotify that I found a lot of new songs through the tailored playlists and now, my playlist has expanded so much. Premium is affordable, especially if you're a student, like I am. I'm so glad I started using Spotify and I hope to expand my playlist further.

Back up to 5 stars! There were some app issues for a month or so last year but they addressed all of them. Found out they have decent customer service! Long time user and find their algorithm for selecting songs I like to be unmatched across all other platforms. I love that you can also see what your friends are listening to and collaborate on playlists!

As usual, I am reluctant to try new things. But, making a switch from Pandora One to Spotify has made all the difference. There's a reason that Spotify is the number one music playing app besides Apple music. The app is very easy to use and offers a variety that no other service like it does. It does take a moment to load in, which can be annoying, but once it loads there is no trouble. Overall, a great app for music and podcasts alike. Would definitely recommend, and is worth it for premium.

My favorite music app! Well worth the money. The recent updates have really caused some issues for me though. I am listening to ine so g or podcast and it says I'm listening to something that I previously listened to. It will stay on that one for a few days and I have no way to interact with the current song I'm playing. Also will not pause half the time anymore, I've had to shut the app entirely down to stop what I was playing several times now.

My favourite app!! The only faults i can think of right now is that songs randomly delete themselves from my list sometimes, and also, disliking a song on a radio station should be reversible. sometimes i like the song and accidentally dislike and then i can never find it again! also, this may be difficult to figure out, but i wonder if theres a way to make radio station music progressively evolve and become more tailored to the individual, such that every station eventually hones in on "you".

I have no great ability with tech so I was pleased to find out how easy Spotify is to use. I have it on my phone,tablet and laptop. switching between devices is a breeze and playing on my bluetooth enabled HiFi is simplicity itself. I find there is a huge selection of music online and have not been disappointed with any search for obscure artists. I would recommend the premium account as you get no adverts and the streaming quality is better in my opinion. Highly recommended.

Very good app, literally the best of its kind. I can get almost every type of music in almost every language. But the queue control is missing, I dont know if it's a premium feature or a bug, they never mentioned it in the countless "Upgrade to spotify premium" ads. I use the desktop version, and its available there. Otherwise it's a great platform. I am currently listening to it while typing this . ; )

There are a few bugs here and there but definitely my favorite music app apart from Shazam! It would be nice to notify the user that you're about to download your limit and allow you to choose what to keep instead of just cleaning it all back to zero for us cold turkey. Oh boy, that episode really made my commute less pleasant than usual.

Recently added the free version and so far, I have found every artist and song I look for. Making playlists is a snap; but playback only seems to be limited to random shuffle play. I can't choose a track I want to play. Sure, ads get annoying; but with this much available music, it's worth having the free version. I really can't complain.

The only thing about this app that I think should be revised is that it's impossible to start over an album unless you are premium, so you can only listen to a song once. It's annoying and probably a quirk from the lack of control over the play list for the standard users (which, by the way, is actually a very good idea in and by itself). So yeah that app is great and you should get it.

Issue resolved! I have used spotify since it was invite-only and have maintained a paid subscription for a number of years now. Since the most recent update, spotify seems to cut out non-stop depending on if my phone (S9) is locked or not, or just after a certain amount of time. When hooked up to the bluetooth in my car, I cant change/skip songs about 70% of the time using the cars controls and again it just cuts out.

This app is super AMAZING!!! I use it all the time both on my phone and my laptop. It uses very little data and uses hardly any of your battery. The only time it really sucks is when i'm almost out of data and i'm out of skips. When you try to change the playlist nothing will load so you're stuck listening to the one you're currently listening to. It's not a major problem and it's not really the app's fault either so other than that this app is super awsome and I enjoy it very very much. XD

Amazing app! Love how easy it is to use and how expansive the music library is! Other apps I've used have had such a limited assortment of the music I love (soundtracks, classical, random obscure artists, etc.) And I really appreciate the fact that there is so much here! The only thing I wish I could do would be to modify the song order in my playlists, but otherwise, I have no complaints!

Honesly I love this app. I only use the free version so I have adds, which are pretty annoying. Personally I use the app with headphones most of the time so I remove them when adds come on, but they are certainly annoying when your listening on speakers while doing something. However the app is easy to use, has a large selection of music (there are maybe a handful that aren't available but for the most part it is not a big deal) and doesn't take up too much space. It's certainly my go to choice

I never do app reviews because I am very lazy. However, shout out to Spotify!! I've been using Spotify for over 5 years. This application has perfected the art of striving for customer experience. It provides me with the greatest selections of music. Its feature of the playlist, song, and artist radio's are my favorite. There is no need to even try other services, Spotify is the best.

This is my favorite music streaming app. You can download your playlist for free so you do not have to use mobile data. I pay a $10 subscription for unlimited music. The variety of music genres is great as I listen to a lot of non-mainstream music. I highly recommend this app over iTunes or any other music streaming application. You can organize your playlist to your liking. I also really like the podcast that are available on this application. Spotify will also connect to your Google Maps when you have a address programmed into the GPS. This eliminates having to flip back and forth between applications

I have the pay version of Spotify. It's been enjoyable and worth the 9.99 a month. I appreciate being able to look up various artists and their discographies. Yes, there some limits to those discographies, but for what is available? It's easy to find what you're looking for. I wish there would be a warning for when certain song licenses are expiring instead of them just disappearing. Other than that? The weekly discovery suggests new songs based on your listening history. I've found new songs and artists to follow because of it. So it's giving me the music I want, while exposing me to the music I need.

I was introduced to Spotify by a friend at Christmas time and have never looked back. All my favourite songs available, in a variety of genres, and so easy to compile a playlist. This is for music on the move, as well as at home. Wall to wall sounds - even the ads are discreet, and do not intrude on listening enjoyment, unlike radio DJs, who cut into intros and incessantly talk over songs. On Spotify you run the show. There's never been a better time to enjoy music.

The absolute best way to listen to digital music. I've had Spotify Premium for about eight years now so I don't even know/remember what the basic version is like, but I can find very few faults with premium. Like, when my playlist is over I'd appreciate it if you just let the music end and didn't play some random-ass song that you think is similar, but that's the only complaint I have.

I only have the trial version but I'm really happy with it. If you create a Playlist on a computer you can access it and have it play in random order on your app. You can't really pick your song unless you subscribe but for a person who normally listens to the radio it's a big step up. The discover Playlists are great too. I play music for my kids sometimes and the discover algorithm always throws in a couple Playlist for them while still giving me three or four to choose from.

I love the new design. The premium version is a 10/10. Also the music recommendations are always on point and so are the playlists made by them. The shuffle option could be a lot better, since right now it always plays the same songs. There are a lot of songs that are not available for certain regions, but sadly that's not something Spotify can do a lot about.

Great playlists, great selection, great accessibility. But I've been noticing lately that when I have WiFi turned on, the music will stop every 2 to 3 minutes, and when you press play, it restarts all over again. It makes it hard when you want to listen and do anything else at the same time. A little fix or help would be great

Love this app! The entire family uses it... preteens, teens, college student and parents. Membership version allows you to play any song you want to hear with unlimited skips. The free version was good enough for a while which allows you to shuffle your playlist with a limited amount of skips. I have been able to download every song I've looked up.. great app!

I decided to download a streaming app after I got tired of listening to the same songs on my phone and I started with YouTube music, which turned out to be a huge disappointment. Spotify gets me everything I need in a music app and more. Songs and playlists are set according to my desires and it's very user friendly as well. It's exciting, to say the least!

My kids were using the app for ages, so I wanted to give it a shot, too. I was plesently surprised. For me, the best features are: great library of music - spanning multiple time periods and countries, pretty good suggestion algorithm, and the 30-minute intervals between commercials in the free version. I belive there is a room for improvement - for instance, it would be nice to avoid playing the same commercial 3 or more times in a row... But overall - good job, my Sweden friends! Thank you!

I love Spotify. It's perfect for all my music needs. It's great for playlists for dance parties, and for any genre I've looked up, and I listen to a wide variety of genres. I love the recommended songs option in my playlists. The only downside to the app is when I wasn't paying for the subscription, then the ads were ridiculous, like any free service, but paying for the subscription is totally worth it.

Great! Some random bugs. Lately the music has stopped playing every X minutes, like twice an hour or something. Other than that, everything is awesome. I wish there was a feature for tagging music instead of having playlists, so I could just filter the songs I wanted to play, instead of switching between playlists.

This is a very good music app. One of the best I've ever had. Still, it has it's share of upside-downs. You see, when I install on a desktop, I get to customise my playlist to my hearts content, but when I install on a phone, all I can do is change the name and add songs. The picture is something that makes thr playlist appealing to others. If you could please give your installers the ability to customise that part of the playlist, I'm sure good reviews will be coming your way. Thank you.

Spotify has been been my top music app for a while now. I enjoy a wide variety of genres and I'm able to customize almost every aspect of my listening experience. The optional playlists that help me discover new music and new artists are an added bonus that I look forward to weekly. I do have the paid version, and some have scoffed at the price, but I'm from the generation where I used to pay more than the subscription price for just one CD. The Android widget on my home screen is cool too.

Absolutely fantastic. The app is great and very well made. I love the stations. The one thing I would add is easier song to playlist integration when creating a playlist. However, another amazing thing is the customer service. I recently had issues with my account and even in these times where everyone is at home Spotify customer service immediately responded and thanks to them I was able to regain access to my account. Thanks to Emilio, Patricia, and Marian! Definitely worth it!

Take this app for granted way too much. Fantastic music/podcast streaming platform. Use it every day, without fail, and i highly recommend it. I especially recommend the 6 person premium family plan they offer, which is $15/m and a great expenditure and an investment i dont think i will discontinue anytime soon! Though, I would stop paying $10 per month for an individual account, its just a little too much in comparison to the other plan.

Literally the best streaming app on the play store. The recommendations are awesome. They're relatable to the content you usually listen to. And the radios based on certain playlists are just too good. Any flaw? Yeah. One. Different countries have diff music that they can listen to. Other music is just unavailable. It's just this teeny tiny flaw that sorta, somewhat, ruins the experience a little bit. If that can be fixed, whoa, you guys would be way ahead of any other service.

You can browse a very wide range of music! You can also make your own playlist, listen to other playlists, artist radio stations, you can follow your friends and see their public playlists. There's playlists for workouts, studying, deep focus, meditation, sunny days, etc! It's awesome and with ads it's free!!! I love the music, options, layout. It's my favorite app üòÅ

Besides being an amazing app for listening to music with good quality and personalise your playlists, I had a problem with the songs in my library because I got hacked and I contacted the support team and they were excellent!! The frequent Q&A was useful, everything was really organized and even though I still needed help, I contacted them and they were really nice, really fast, straight to the point, it was done with security and I got everything back in no time! Really nice support system.

I love this app and service but recently it's been very buggy on my phone (Note 8). The music will randomly stop playing, it no longer shows up on my notifications bar so it looks like my phone doesn't know it's running even though the music is playing. This becomes a problem if someone calls me or if I play a YouTube video because there music doesn't stop automatically. It also always thinks it's offline when I search for specific songs even though I have signal or wifi. Hopefully the next update fixes at least some of these issues because I love the app in general and it used to work perfectly.

Its nice and all but for some reason it plays random junk on my playlist 
and not what's actually on there. Also when the ads come up that say "Watch 
this advertisement and get 30 minutes of uninterrupted listening" then 10 
minutes later another ad. I have never, NEVER gone without an ad for 30 
minutes. Now I know that's a lot of downs but heres the best things, you 
can listen to most music you like or if you have premium you can listen to 
anything better than other companies. Overall best music content but has a 
few very annoying things for non-premium listeners.

Great, even without the premium service this is a quality application that you can use to listen to any song you can think of. Don't listen to negative comments you have nothing to lose by installing it and i promise you won't regret it once you start listening to all your favorite music. Tip: on the home page access settings in the top right corner and change the sound qualjty to the highest it let's you. Increses the quality of the songs.

I absolutely love the app! My music keeps me sane and Spotify helps me develop and refine my personal taste in music on a dependable basis. I noticed another user reported this too, my music keeps jumping to the first song in my library. I looked online and didn't find anything so I'm reinstalling to see if it helps. I understand you guys are probably under some strain right now given the pandemic and all so I'm not worried about it, much love!

As a premium member I feel that Spotify has been a worth while investment for myself. Music selection is great. There are few things I cannot find. Podcasts are even better, most of my podcast listening I do here. Being able to download content and listen to it when I'm not connected is such a boon. The free version as you would expect is full of ads and pauses that are designed to make you pay for premium.
