This is one of my favorite music streaming apps. Screw Apple Music. Apple sucks. Spotify is where it is at. Update: Spotify has been great. I am coming up on a year and a half of using this app, and I have only encountered one issue. My songs were not saving. So I contacted the company, and they said that my device was not synced properly to their servers. They helped me out, and we resolved the issue. The employees were very nice and patient. I love this app and company. Highly recommend.

Words cannot express how wonderful this app is. I switched fr YouTube music and now I know what a disaster that app is. The navigation is flawless and intuitive. The best part is streaming thru my car. In compare to YouTube it sounds like a new system. I have a brand new car with a great sound system. It no longer sounds like my music is coming out of the tin can. It is blowing me out of the car. Thank you Spotify!

I like that you can create your own little playlist and share it among other devices. I give it a 5 star, but theres only one problem. When I click on my playlist, I see the "Songs we added" thing. I just pushed it off, like "Oh, thats nothing." But, when I clicked the play button, it only played the songs that I didnt add. I ended up getting really frustrated, because I couldnt listen to the songs that I added. It only seemed to work for the songs that the app added. Other than that, its good.

While there is the occasional artist or song that is unavailable on Spotify, you can find nearly any music you're looking for. Their algorithms are a little wacky, as far as playlists they create "just for me" that contain entire genres I never even listen to, and their lists such as "most played of 2019" contained some songs I don't think I even listened to once. But I don't use Spotify for that. I use it to build my own playlists. So it is 100% fine with me.

I was a Pandora user for a long time. I never wanted to even try Spotify because of it. Stuck in my ways I guess. Eventually I gave in and I never went back. I love their music selection. Love how easy it is to use. How I can subscribe to friends playlists. How I can hear similar music radio when my playlists end. How discover weekly shows me music I may like based on what I do listen to. Love it all. My only issue is occasionally the connection gets weird and stops the music. But it's not often

The only thing I'm not a fan of is the "song radio" feature, which I think was outstripped by other apps that I won't name here... I've never had a problem with anything else. Other than that, it's a great deal and a great replacement for having to keep a music collection, especially being able to download stuff. For artists that don't put their stuff on Spotify? I'm happy to buy the album. I pay for premium, so no adds. Completely worth it. Also if Google and Apple and Amazon, etc, etc, had gotten their stuff together sooner, I'm sure I would have gone with their service. Too bad for them.

I love this app more than I love my life, not trying to be dramatic or anything. And the fact that I can get spotify+hulu+showtime for $4.99? WOW, amazing. One con, though, the songs tend to freeze up and lag at times, which can be annoying. However, when that happens, I just restart my phone and it's all fixed.

On the computer or on a gaming console, it's absolutely amazing, I dont think theres a song you cant find and it's all free... for the most part. On the phone it's pretty restricting, you can only shuffle play your music unless you have premium. Your first 3 months of premium are pretty cheap but after that i believe it is 10 dollars a month. Either way, it's still cheaper than buying every song you want ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

I love Spotify, it's the only way I listen to music. The only reason I won't give it 5-stars is the new 10 second looping videos that play for many of the songs now. They don't serve any purpose whatsoever, and since my phone is usually locked when I use Spotify, I don't even see them. Whenever I do happen to have my phone unlocked, I just find the videos annoying. If they get rid of these videos or give us the option to turn them off, I will happily changy review to 5-stars!

Good quality music especially if you have wifi/data connection, the collection is vast, from classical to metal, you name it. You need to subscribe to premium though if you want to save/download your favorite songs to your device so you can listen to them without connection, which I think is fair. I also don't like the ads on the free version when listening to soft music or lullabies, it kinda break the mood, but of course if you want to listen to uninterrupted music, then better subscribe to premium. High five Spotify keep it up!

I love Spotify for many reasons, I have eclectic tastes in music, they offer limitless selections regardless of genre or era, has no bugs that I'm aware of unlike many free apps I've run across, it is a simple, well organized app that works across all platforms (at least Android and Mac). I enjoy listening to new releases of my favorite artists while working out. BTW, as far as ads go, I find these less annoying, I just tune them out or turn down the volume - can't fast forward like on your DVR, hahaha! The price is right unless you order premium! Sky-high! Ooof! I wish they'd lower their rates, hint-hint. Students, I am told, get a discount.

Been using Spotify for quite a while and it's one of my favs!! I love the song availablity and how easy it is to find many many songs I want and how each it is for me to make playlists. ("Only thing that could improve it is if there was a "shuffle" option, like a shuffle ALL music But that's all :)" ) EDIT** They added a "liked songs list" and thats kinda what i was looking for! That's really great! Love it! üòãüòÅ

My only criticism of this app is of the advertisements and the skip limit. There are too many adds and they are usually all about the purchase of premium. For the skip limit, you are allotted 6 skips per hour due to "licensing restrictions". Even two more skips per hour would be much appreciated. Otherwise the audio quality is great and the music selection is almost endless. One more issue is the bombardment of "personalized" playlists. The algorithm could do better and show fewer playlists.

I, I don't even think I can write a proper review for this app. It's by far the best app that I've ever downloaded. I tell absolutely everyone about it. They are amazing in every way (I've yet to use customer support but I'm sure they're amazing too). If you listen to music, this is a must have. Only downfall, sometimes the desktop version is a little wonky, but the web version sorts that out! Not a big enough issue to lose a star. I hope you guys keep this up forever, I will always use it!

Great app that has a massive library of music to listen to wherever and whenever. It's song recommendations seem to know you pretty well, and I have discovered many of my new favorite artists through the daily mixes it puts together for you. The ability to customize your playlists is very nice, I just wish the quality of life for editing songs on the playlists across devices were a bit easier.

Use this app religiously and it's great! This year's Spotify wrapped kinda weird though. There are songs that were swapped or something. For example: a top song I listened to was "Blackened" by Metallica, but the one I listened to was the "remastered" version of it. I guess Spotify data mixed that up, maybe look into it? It did it to a few other songs too

I love being able to have all my many songs downloaded to my phone so I can listen anywhere. The interface is easy to use. There are recommended songs to add to playlists at the bottom of your playlist interface, and while this is great, I wish there were more ways to easily discover more music. Easily my most used app. I use it daily, for well over 4 hours a day.

This app is wonderful for me as a college student, always finding new music to study to, no hassle of switching back and forth. I love the large variety of artists, from the biggest chart toppers, to up and comers. I've never had a bad experience with Spotify. I do use premium which definitely makes my experience much easier, and if I didn't I might even be frustrated with the constant adds. But with the student discount it's definitely worth it.

It's definitely worth the $10, or $15 per month for the Family Plan! Rather than buying a single CD/ album for at least that amount! Sure you have to renew your subscription, but that subscription is basically to have an entire library of complete discographies / genres / movie and video game soundtracks /playlist and more!! As well as the ability to have them downloaded for unlimited play, without using data! 10/10

I LOVE Spotify! It's 100 times better than Pandora. The completely free option is great if you have a PC, but it's very limited on mobile. You aren't able to access as many features on mobile unless you have Premium. The selection of music and podcasts is amazing. If you can afford to have another subscription I would definitely recommend Premium. It's totally worth it.

Here lately I can't get through 1 whole song without the song stopping several times. I thought maybe it was an issue on my end but after reading all the recent reviews I do not believe it's me. I pay for the monthly family plan and we have not been able to use the app for several days now. I've used Spotify for years and never had any issues. I'll change my rating back to 5 stars when I can actually use the service I'm paying for.

Update to my previous review: back to being awesome. Spotify customer service is pretty great. They respond to emails quickly, and so far, the app is back to working normally. Last update (1/9) really messed up it up. Now it takes ages to load or it doesn't even load at all. I spend my thirty minute drive to work trying to get Spotify to actually play. Before the update, it was AMAZING. I had no problems before the update.

I love this app! It's around the price of other music services for premium, has more songs, has a great web browser player, amazingly quick app, it's compatible with all music players (Google Home, Alexa, etc), features an available computer app, and the list of benefits for Spotify goes on for days. And the best part? It's FREE. Basically if you want a music service, this is the right choice, even if you want free music with a few ads.

I use this app for pretty much every waking hour (and then some.). The app has some issues with freezing and refusing to play anything unless I restart my device (this happens on PC as well.) and it'll occasionally get confused and switch my music off if I've been switching devices a lot. Besides those bugs that have been reported countless times it's a great app. 5/5 if they sort their bugs out

I did a trial run with Spotify and most competitors. After a week of each, Spotify was my number one choice by far. Had all the features that appealed to me. Very pleased with the app. I'm not a young buck though, and I'm not big on change. But I know the way we get music is changing, so I'm making the jump. Found it very user-friendly also. Recommended to everyone even old farts like me.

New to Spotify and totally love it!! My daughter has been trying to convince me to get this for years but for some reason I resisted. She got fed up with me yelling at my previous app, so installed it for me. The huge selection of music brings happiness to my ears. I Bluetooth it to my car and my work car; I don't have to reconnect it every time I get in, nor does it randomly stop (unlike my previous app). Also just discovered the sync to other devices! Woohoo. Definitely recommend Spotify

I love this app more than any. I have been a customer for about 5 years on premium and was a free listener before that. I play hundreds of songs a month with a "like" list of over 3700 songs and the ability to port them through most smart devices or take them on the go makes this the ultimate app for audiophiles. Thanks for making my devices better Spotify.

I have been using spoitfy for about 8 years and this is the most user friendly, consumer input adept music app out there. Kind to students as well as the older generation of humans. You can find almost anything on here, and is the best app to organize your music that I've found (100+ playlists and counting). Thank you for being there for me when I needed you most. Love you, Spotify.

I was late to the Spotify party. But I'm so glad I made it. Went premium a few months back and since then, listening to music and keeping my favourite tracks together in one place using playlists has become so easy! I only wish I had gone premium years ago.. better late than never. PS: if it was easier to share songs and tracks, I'd give the app 6 out of 5 stars!

I just wish there were unlimited skips. I understand advertising is necessary for the free version, but skips would be nice. Edit: I've noticed most major apps have found a way to decrease their size, datawise, for consumer availability. Would be nice to see Spotify do the same. Still amazed by how excellent service is, though, from the time of my initial review. It's practically impossible to make a better free music app in a capitalist market.

I love this app, Here are some reasons why: firstly, almost every single song you can imagine is on here. Secondly, there are about adds every 30 mins so no complaining here. The music quality is amazing. The volume, setout and everything is perfect. You can also create playlists and you have a library of songs you can choose from. The music won't stop unless you pause it or there's an add. Also, you can choose your favourite artists and Spotify will automatically recommend their music to you!!!

Spotify is phenomenal for those who enjoy personalized music. There are opportunities to build as many diverse playlists as you like, download those playlists to have available wherever you go, have specially designed recommended playlists, and so much more. Spotify can seem a little intimidating to navigate at first, but there are so many options. If creating your own playlist sounds tedious, they have hundreds of pre-made playlists based on mood, genre, time period, and other categories! 5/5

I enjoy the fact that I can listen to any song I want and even download it to my phone . Of course this is all for a small monthly fee, which in addition I'm able to have an ad-free listening experience. Also, I love the fact that the app customizes playlist on a daily basis for you based on what you've already listened to, what you like, and what you dislike. AND not only is it just one playlist it's multiple playlist. I think that's a pretty rad feature. 99% a time when I want to hear music, I use this app. When I want to hear a podcast, I prefer to use a different app than this one.

Went for premium because of benefits. Never looked back. It's been a couple years now. If you value your time listening to music without commercials, at a very seamlessly high quality. Download it, and enjoy the ease of use with your new pocket DJ. Thank you Spotify, for those countless hours spent listening to everything I could think of.

Literally THE MOST INSANE music app in the world ! Spotify is everything it says but it's disappointing if you don't have premium. But that put aside, it's just phenomenal ! I love the fact that you can download songs and listen to them offline and it's so easy to use. Great job devs keep it up ! P.S there's a slight issue when I listen to music while using another app, it sometimes just stops suddenly and I have to go back into Spotify and restart it. Otherwise perfect !

Been using it for a couple years now and it has just about all the music I listen too and is great with letting you know when new albums come out from the artists you're following. Premium is great as well I use it all the time when I'm driving or at work for music I never have to connect to the internet. Playlist are extremely easy to set up and find again after they're made. Probably one of my favorite features would have the be their recently listened too list on the home page, so even if you have 50+ playlists you don't have to dig through them everytime to find which one you were just listening too. Overall great app üëç

Hey spotify dudes. I love your app, but have very recently run into some issues. I totally have premium, but my music is not downloading. I went through all your troubleshoot suggestions and found nothing should be wrong. I think it's rather a technical error with the app. I've tried reinstalling, updating, logging out, checked my account info, etc. When I open the app, very briefly music will start downloading, but after a few seconds (3-4 seconds) a small banner will pop up at the bottom of

So I was getting tired of dealing with all of the little flaws in Apple Music, so I decided to give Spotify chance. And I was immediately blown away. It's at least 10x faster, there are way more options to play with, their radios are phenomenally better, and their recommended music for you is perfect. I don't know how I got this far in life without an amazing source of music.

I was one of the first users of Spotify, and I absolutely love it. As a family plan subscriber, I enjoy the Family Mix. I still use Spotify in the original way, which is making my own playlists, but others I know have said they enjoy using ready made ones on there. Release Radar is great. Discover Now has based all of it's new songs off of my sleep playlist for awhile now, so it's not very useful at the moment, but normally I like it. It would be nice to be able to tweak that by genre.

This app is great for listening to music, it allows you to make playlists and save your liked songs. It even suggest playlists and music based off of your music taste which is great for finding new songs and genres. I do have some suggestions though, perhaps making a speed option for songs, that way you can slow down or speed up your music too instead of just podcast episodes. In addition, maybe making it an option to choose the surrounding color of your playlist and profile. Thanks for reading.

The only negative is that you can not play a particular song. You have to shuffle threw and wait for it to play. You can't even make a play list with just that song so you can hear it whenever you want to because it puts suggestion songs in with it. Only allowing 6 skips is pretty bad also. There shuffling algorithms are not great because they tend to play some songs a bunch but other songs not at all in my favorites playlist. Don't know if you can fix any of these things but I would be grateful for it. Thanks Bonnie &Autumn

If I could only have one app on my phone it would be Spotify. The music quality is excellent for a streaming service and the ease of use is wonderful. Spotify's algorithms always seem to find new music for me to check out and the platform offers such an easy way to organize all my musical likes. It even does podcasts. If only the equalizer was like the iOS version which is slightly superior and has a "spoken word" preset which is very convenient for podcasts. The cross platform playback means you never have to miss a beat and you can control your computer's output with your phone. All around winner for me! Thanks Spotify for the best $9.99 I spend each month.

I used free Spotify for a while & I finally decided to go premium at one point and it's so awesome! It's amazing to have my music when I want it. Not only that, but they're always doing fun little (big too) things too for premium users. For example, I basically have Hulu for free now because of Spotify, & now I'm gonna be getting a free google home mini. Even without these things, Spotify is awesome. I love that I can make playlists with other people, & have music when I want it.

I'm too busy to stop and watch anything. I'm into music in a big way because it allows me the freedom to move and focus at the tasks at hand without distraction. Spotify premium allows me to explore new types of music and artist, were it not for Spotify offering different artists or music that are similar, I wouldn't have discovered much of what I'm listening to today, which is mostly instrumental but with new technology to produce sounds I've never heard before without interruption or adds

Spotify premium is great for listening to just about any song out there, it's great for making playlists. My favorite music app for sure. I don't know if they see my requests but in the past I requested for both: song lyrics to be available again and for swipe queuing to be usable on Android, not just IOS. They added both of these requested features and I am very satisfied and impressed. The one thing I would change is that the swipe queuing to be usable for all songs, not just inside playlists

I really like this app cuz you get some control and exactly what you want even with the free music which you don't pay a service charge actually it's cheaper than Deezer and more easier to work than Panda Pandora Deezer was okay but not great it does sound was different

Amazing music app since I can't live without music but, it had a period where it closed out if I tried sharing a song, not sure if the bug got fixed. Also every now and then it'll suddenly stop playing music and I'll have to manually hit play. But as far as recent music or making playlists and downloading music for later use without WiFi.. game changer.

Absolutely love Spotify! Always available when I need it. It's quick and easy to use, i use the premium membership, so no adverts! During the song it gives you a "behind the lyrics" giving you information about the artists and the meanings behind their songs ect... As well as the lyrics. Spotify has never done me wrong. Wouldn't even think about using anything else.

I've loved this streaming platform since 2009. Always had an endless selection of music and community playlists can really make you branch out and listen to so many different artists and genres. The only things I can fault are that a small percentage of artists aren't available and also recently lots of little bugs that can become quite frequent and annoying. Even to the point where I've reinstalled the app today.

It's very good. There's just one thing I don't like. I wish that going back to a song that was in the queue list was possible. I currently need to press "add to queue" and then to move them into the "next from: Lorem ipsum" section. Just in case I want to go back to my previously played song. Which I feel like a pretty unnatural behaviour. And very often I go back to my previously played song just to add it to my liked songs or to listen to it again.

I love it!!! Although I find it annoying that we only get 5 skips an hour, I like that it plays music I put on the playlist. I wish it would give me the option to delete the songs they add to the playlists without never playing it again.Also, I watch the videos and it doesn't give me a whole 30 minutes, it's more like 15. Overall though, I find this app to be amazing because even without premium, I have so much freedom in the app. I've used apps where you can even make playlists or like songs without paying a monthly fee. Thanks Spotify! P.S. Is there a reason the app stops playing my music sometimes when I enter other apps?

The best music app I've ever used. I use premium and for its purpose, it well overpreforms for what is expected. The extra little bits like the yearly stats and behind the lyrics add a great touch, and the music selection and quality is amazing. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a solid music app. Also, as a college student, it is discounted which helps a ton. Thanks Spotify!

Excellent and organised. I do have a a couple suggestions but overall Spotify is the way to go and is a win for both the artist and user. 1) See list of albums instead of list of songs when you press artist in library 2) It's hard to see what playlist radio you are listening to when you leave the list to look at other stuff, perhaps an improvement in that regard. 3) Get more genius placecards because they are really good! Huge selection of songs and user friendly is the winner here for me.

Great music channel lists. Can be repetitive if you listen to only one or a few. But there are plenty to choose from. Also find new artists and music on New music Fridays. Apparently you can create your own list with a free subscription too but I've never done that. It would be nice to be able to control the qeue and play individual songs I want to hear. Waiting on an AI ability (Alexa?) to sync music with IOT lights and have a party.

better than Napster in my opinion because you have the freedom to create multiple playlists instead of just adding the songs that you like in one mass playlist. Also, they don't tend to play the same songs over and over again that are already circulating on the radio. lot more variety in options than many of the other acts out there because of the features, like the podcast option for example

It has a Free version, which is good, you get to listen to music, create playlist, get info of there concerts, and by what you listen to, they give you suggestions. I personally have the premium version which you need to pay $5 per month which is not bad for what you get, with premium. Either one is great. I prefer the paid version. The updates they make are never bad. I like that it customizes for you your music. And also you can listen and do something else on your phone, computer... Definetly install.

Our go-to music app with a subscription options worth every penny. Great selection of music and podcasts available. You can find something from every genre imaginable, from storytelling to international music. I do wish the automated playlists provided when choosing "Go To Song Radio" were a bit more intuitive. Pandora has a better algorithm for that, but do not come close to Spotify's song availability.

Get Premium and never look back! I'm been with these cats close to 10 years and haven't regretted it. The system is great for discovery, the selection is more diverse than toothpaste options at the supermarket and deeper than Bill Gates' pockets. The app is easy to use and super fast too. You can control your pc/mac from your phone and share your fab playlist and tracks with ease. They only thing I could possibly do with is comments on tracks but that's a nice to have. Download it now!

spotify has allowed me to easily access, share, and experience music in its fulliest. i cannot think of a better app to use for everything I need: music, playlists, podcasts. my only comment on improvement would be if the slide-to-queue feature was available for andriod. i loved being able to easily slide a song to add it next to my listening. now that is a bit more "tap and click." if this feature was available and updated for the android app, i would be even happier with my experience!

I found the free version of Spotify amazing. Although there were ads, they rarely interrupted my music and I could search up any song I wanted. Unfortunately, there were no music videos available, although that makes sense as this is a music app, not a video app. On some songs there were lyrics available which was very useful for me when I was making dances.

Until recently my biggest complaint has been a lack of sleep timer. If I wanted to fall asleep listening to music, I had to use a different app. It sucks when I can't find certain bands or songs but other than that, it's great. Someone managed to get into my daughter's (her fault) account and locked her out. We contacted Spotify and they fixed everything in less than an hour.

Spotify used to be great at allowing me to use my phone to play through my computer, but in the past month or so, this feature is completely bugged out. It often doesn't update that the song has changed, and instead it just shows the same song as playing (with the counter going well past the song duration). Some kind of defect. 5 stars otherwise if this feature still worked. Looks like this was updated and it's working great again!

I've always been a bit old school with music and enjoyed having the physical copy, and I still do. However, Spotify has given a new world of music and makes it so much easier to listen to the music I love and even find new music. Worth paying the ¬£9.99 a month for. Only issue I have is that when making a playlist on my phone I have to go through and add songs individually which is very time consuming. Other than that, Spotify is the best and most used app on my phone.

I think it's really great for finding older music, which is what I use it for. I even find foreign music, which is great. Edit: the price has bettered with their bundle deals and family prices, and because I lost all my music storage I pretty much exclusively use spotify now. It wouldn't be the same without it anymore.

I switched to Spotify from Google Play Music as many songs I want to listen to aren't available on Google. I've been pleasantly surprised. The selection of songs is larger with almost anything on here. I also really love the feature where it creates a playlist of songs you've never heard by analysing the songs you like and picking similar ones. 10/10

üëå Most exceptional music application out there. You can't get any better than this. If I could say one thing I wish this app had would be the ability to upload your own music to playlists but not locally, meaning for it to stay there dispite wt happens to that file. It seems that only music artists have the ability to do this, but if everyone did that would be great. This feature would only be accessible by you and not seen by others. Essentially to have it like One Drive but only visible to u.

My sister had been telling me for AGES that I needed to just use Spotify. After getting a new phone I decided to give it a shot and have really enjoyed it! I appreciate how you can make your own specific play list and after its run through they give suggestions, I haven't had to use the skip feature yet. I also like how they occasionally have the option to watch a 30 second ad for 30 minutes without ads.

Spotify is music heaven! Music at your finger tips has never been so easy. I love being able to discover new types of music, adding and creating my own playlist, the way it recommends new music using the song radio, being able to have access while offline and all the endless choices of podcast all in one place. There's no way I'll ever end my subscription, it is a must have on all levels. It's our favorite gift to give to others as well.

I freakin love this app, but.. So this app is so great, the music and sound quality and everything and being able to just listening to music on car rides using Spotify is homey. But I wish the app could go back to when it first came out; when there was no such thing as Spotify Premium, you could play any song you wanted when you wanted to without having to shuffle. It was simple, perfect, and felt in control of the app. Yeah there were ads and still are which are fine, but if the app could allow listening to music without having to listen in shuffle/can choose any song whenever, without Premium or the limited amount of freebies, that'd be amazing. Other than that big concern, the app is worth downloading.

It's so good I haven't had any desire to use anything else. And, I've been using the free version and have nvr been able to get the paid version. Finally, I'll admit I've tried about all of the similar apps but they don't have what it takes to win me over from. ol' Spotify!! If you're someone who listens to music on a MP3 player and you download music, then, you might not find much use w/ it's free version.

Ive had spotify since 2017 and i use it every day since. Music selection is endless and new music pops up almost a day after its released. On top of the great music selection, being able to play offline with premium is makes road trips and work tolerable. I would definitely recommend doing the family membership if everyone in your household. I mean $15 a month and 5 people get a premium music, you really cant go wrong, especially being able to use it on every device.

I absolutely love Spotify Premium. There are a couple artists that are not in thier library, and even some songs that I would like to listen to also, but overall great. I have found new artist I like that I've never heard of thanks to recommedations from spotify. The only other thing I'm not too fond of is the fact it saves all the songs you listen to even if the download option isnt checked. A lot of space is occupied on the phone because of this.

I love Spotify. I've been using it for nearly 3 years, and it's super great to having to use space on my device for music. Streaming can be quite data intensive, but the feature to download specific playlists for offline access is great for getting around that. I stream maybe an hour to two hours of music a week using data, and I'm on a 1gb plan, and I still have plenty of data left.

I love my spotify. When I switched from iPhone to samsung and iTunes didn't work out so well this was the perfect solution!! I have told all my family and friends they need it. It's so easy to like it dislike songs from my main list. The one downside is it's not as good at self playing like pandora does. They seem to have their algorithms figured just a little better to see what people like. But everything else has been amazing! I'll never go back to any other music app.

I have been using Spotify for a while now and there have only ever been a couple of tracks I have not been able to find on it, even obscure dance tracks from my youth! Have had problems with it crashing after adverts but my devices are a few years old now so have put it down to compatability issues. I have never had premium. Thumbs up overall.

When i first got spotify about 7 or 8 years ago i thought it was too good to be true. "I can listen to any song i want?" With the exception of .1% of music i wanted to listen to, this was true. I pretty much been a premium subscriber since then and have continued to be wowed by the amount of music, download speed, ease of multi-device control, etc. My biggest criticisms are minor. I would love notifications for friends playlists and friends' listening activity on mobile. Overall, great app!

I've tried so many music apps. I used to just download songs to my phone and play them through PowerAmp. But I got tired of doing that so I decided to get the free trail for Spotify to see if I liked it. I absolutely loooove this app. It's almost perfect. It's so easy to use, every song I can think of is in here and if I want to listen offline I can. The only thing I wish you could do is shuffle ALL your liked albums in your library. But it's not enough to rate 4 stars over. I adore Spotify ‚ù§Ô∏è

If you're looking for new music related to what you're already used to listening to, Spotify is the way to go. Navigation is easy which helps in selecting a preffered playlist to listen to. In terms of Spotify premium, its pretty alright for the price especially as it gives you a 1 month free trial. If you're still unsure about going premium, wait till they put premium on sale so as to not spend as much for an extra month. Other than that, it's a great music app for finding new music.

since I changed my phone (Samsung Galaxy S10+) i wasn't able to use the app as before. having trouble when connecting with my car or even trying to change tracks. i contacted the support team and they helped me to fix the issue immediately. everything works perfectly now. I love Spotify. if you have issues try deleting all the app data, then uninstall and install again. you will lose the downloaded songs but it took me just a few seconds to get them all back over wifi. happy again.

I have only recently begun using spotify, I was reserved at first with the app, but if you're interested in using it I'd really rate it. Using playlists is the best way I find as the non premium version doesn't allow you to immediately play the song you're thinking of in all cases. It's got a great list of podcasts too and it's great at recognising music you might like.

Best app for music I think, all around. Doesn't have highest quality audio files as I can tell compared to a few others I've used, and I'm not a huge fan of Spotify's podcast section ( I just use other platforms, good selection though ). However spotify by far has the largest, most complete library of everything that's my taste. And I can't stress this enough: Spotify is the only one with a usable, and in this case pretty good, remote use feature.

I absolutely love Spotify, I use it every day to listen to so much music! The premium service and the app treats me well. The only problem/potential bug I ran into in the past couple/few years using the app is today the app randomly switched me back over to internal storage when all the music was installed on my SD card. Hundreds of songs started redownloading. I took a risk and force stopped it because it wouldn't stop downloading by itself. Now it's crashing, so I'm reinstalling it now.

Spotify is just so good in every way. Endless playback, with crossfade is awesome! You can find thousands of playlists or even make your own! You can set the quality up to 320 kb/s, compare that to Youtube's 128 kb/s. And I've noticed that if I play music shuffled, the next song is always simular to the last one in genre and melody! So get spotify, it's worth a try!

I have been a paid subscriber for 5 yrs now on the family plan. I've never had a single complaint about the app. Always connects to my car automatically when i start it. Music quality is great. I have the app on 3 different andriods and they all work seamlessly. Shuts down when i want it to. Make my own playlists. No songs automatically added. Makes a playlist of the most songs ive listened to throughout the year. Skip to any song. Never seen an ad. Well worth the price of the subscription.

It's been almost a month since I have been playing music on spotify premium . It's great but I have suggestions for developers: -please add option to not stop music when another app wants to use the speaker (so you can film it while the music is running) -also the Bluetooth headset does not always play music when it connects to the phone (I tried with many devices) Definitely prolonging the premium subscription if you add this changes.

Love it! Wish it was a little better to find new music. Pandora has better random song playing to find new music. I think it's a little silly when you do the family you have to live at the same address. Sometimes Spotify will take over your phone and randomly start playing, mostly notice when it's connected to the car. Maybe it's a car thing? But...I have had this app for years and still will keep using it over anything else.

Great music collection. Have not found anything not on this service and some if these services I cant find everything I look for. The only con I have the interface is a not as easy to use at first compared to other services, but it takes no time at all to learn your way around it. So the only con I have is very small and not big at all. Had to put it down to provide a honest and useful for anyone deciding on a service to go with. I have used all the major services like this and I choose Spotify.

Integrates with everything, unlike Amazon Music, Google Music, and iTunes, assuming you pay for Premium. Also has a huge library that is part of the monthly fee. The free trial gives you minimum playlist and music access, but doesn't allow integration. Recommendations are spot-on, unlike Pandora's really algorithms that are showing their age.

Algorithms make sure you're playlists are personalised to be suited to your tastes, constantly improving based in your listening habits. Expansive library of music, podcasts and more. Offline listening is another feature that allows for the user to customise their experience. My only qualm is that a sleep timer wouldn't go amis. The UI is clean and effective, clutter free music listening that focuses on the music. Can't get any better than that.

Good app with great music. Wide variety, even within a genre. Way too many commercials: they come too often and there are too many within each commercial break. I love the music and used to use it as an alternative to the radio, but now there are just as many commercials as on any over-the-air radio station. Even so, there is a MUCH wider range of selections and songs within a particular station. Lots of stuff you'd never hear on the radio if you can put up with the ads.

I love this app, having such a large library of music at your fingertips is phenomenal and worth every cent of my premium subscription... Though unfortunately I can not use the current versions as for some reason the Spotify connect on my car audio system won't work with them, works with the old one fine, but after the December 2018 release onwards, it just won't connect.. Would love you to fix this, but overall I have it working with version 8.4.77.779, just can't update otherwise it breaks.

So far its been awesome, I haven't knowingly used the song download yet but uts great to have streaming music 24/7 that I can do whatever I want with. Pause, rewind, skip, etc. Also even if I pause Spotify it usually automatically starts up when I get in my truck and am linked through bluetooth. This feature is nice as it doesn't seem to drain my battery to much but gives me the ability to listen and control the music through my steering wheel and dash. So far I like it. Only downside is the $

Pretty good, I upgraded to Spotify Premium so no adds, can download entire playlists to listen to music when I don't have data. So far pretty much satisfied with Spotify, except that with Spotify premium whenever the app updates itself to a newer version (at least in my experience) all the songs I've downloaded are un-downloaded so that I've got to download them again and it's a teeny bit annoying.

App works great with little to no technical issues. I've been using Spotify for over 5 years, and I have been been able to fine almost every song I've looked for including French music. Spotify updates their playlists very often and with the radio option you're bound to find music you wouldn't have found on your own. Its the most convenient $10.00 a month I have ever spent.

When I first used Spotify years ago, I hated it. I couldn't seem to find what I wanted to hear. Now, years later, after trying paid apps such as Pandora, Slacker, Amazon and Google Play, Spotify is by far the best. No app is perfect but this app gets a 5 Star rating simply because I can do more of what I want with it to tailor it to my musical needs. Thank you Spotify!

I loved this application when it first appeared! I was using Pandora wich was fine, I had no issues, I just came to enjoy the ease of setup and use of spotify more. The mix of music on my chosen radio stations was richer and more in depth with less commercial interruptions on the free version in my opinion. The commercials also felt a lot shorter in length than they did on other platforms. Building your own lists of liked and favorite songs was simple. I enjoyed it so much I bought the premium.

Love it!! I've been using this for a while but I always forget to rate it. I also want to use this space to point out that the YouTube music app is almost the exact same as Spotify but you can't listen out of app on it. If you need a personalized music app without paying for basic needs Spotify, not Youtube is the way to go :) sorry, but not really.

At first I wasn't sure about Spotify, but after a friend showing me everything, I ended up giving it a shot. Now I love Spotify. I've been telling my friends about it and they switched from ITunes and Pandora and they love it too. One thing I wish they could improve on is if you find a song you like from Sazam like songs from tv shows. Spotify should find a way to get it to download to your playlist.

The app is amazing. It is an affordable and convenient way to listen to music from a large variety of genres. In addition, there are playlists draw up every week with songs similar to the one's you listen to, allowing you to descover new music. There are some song that are not available on the app, however, I have only ever come across two such cases .

Spotify is one of few services that impresses and continues to impress me, mostly from a software perspective. So intuitive, great UX, so many useful features. I just use it and nothing bothers me about it. I play Spotify constantly through my Nose Bluetooth headphones and the experience is very good. Transitions between devices is really good. Please allow even more capability for user uploaded song files. I noticed that they can transfer when over the same network, but that only works for some devices. It would be great if my Denon receiver could play my custom files from Spotify. Keep going Spotify team!

Hello developers! It's my first time trying premium. I do love this app so far. But I think there is a bug problem in playing offline: While playing music, I don't know why but sometimes it suddenly stopped. It "frequently" stops. I don't even applied sleep timer. So this is a bug for sure. I wish you fix the issue as soon as possible :) I am playing music while working. Thank you and I hope for your consideration.
replyContent: Hey! We‚Äôre sorry to hear that. We‚Äôd recommend getting in touch with our support team by following the steps at https://support.spotify.com/article/how-can-i-contact-spotify/. They‚Äôll be able to help with this.

content: I'm giving an undeserved 5* because this is objectively the best music app available. Music selection is great especially for finding new songs. HOWEVER, worse app I've ever been forced to endure through when it comes to ads, they do not see free users to be an option, every couple songs there's 3 ads in a row. Algorithm could be improved so that i don't hear the same song multiple times within an hour, I assumed we would have figured that out 5 years ago when Pandora fell out of popularity.

Great UI and my overall experience with Spotify Premium for 2 years have been great! My only concern is with the "Start a Group Session (Beta)" thing. I thought that this allows 2 or more devices to connect and play the same song, and yet upon trying it last night with someone, only one person can receive the audio. I understand that this is like an "In person" thing, but with times like this, distance music sharing would be amazing. Just a suggestion, but Great App nonetheless :)

Fantastic app for listening on the go. I personally do not know any of the popular music and I often feel left out not knowing what songs everyone else listens to. However, spotify has their own playlists that you can even download for offline use (with premium). I use this app daily, while on the bus, at home or even at school. Would rate 6 stars if I could.

A very reliable app that I love to use to not only look into artists' music, but also to be able to experience the ability to listen to some good jams and complete anything that may seem boring or tedious. There are ads, but they don't feel as annoying since none of said ads are about games. It's a wonderful app and I recommend it for those that love to listen to music, whether it's in your workplace, while you game, or on the go. üëç

To everyone claiming to have trouble playing music. You dont have to "like" the music to play it in a playlist. on the top right of the song page there is an option you can use called 'add to playlist'. You can play all songs in the playlist. If you download them then you can even play them offline. Dont write negative reviews just because YOU, the user, dont know how to use the app properly. Great app btw. Never had any problems and I use it all the time. Keep up the great work devs

Wonderful, didn't expect to live and breathe this app but here we are! Great UI and seamless across all simultaneous devices. (Amazon Music has some catching up to do.) It's really not a deal breaker that I can't watch music videos because this experience is like sorting through your music collection to hear it and reminisce, not watch videos. The scrolling lyrics are enough while the rest of the app can remain static because, honestly, I'd rather focus my senses on the sounds and songwriting.

Reinstalled Spotify and could no longer access any of the music I had downloaded. Spotify does not even show any downloaded music. Feel ripped-off as a premium user. Update : Despite the fact that Spotify never replied or reacted to my last "moan" - something a customer services oriented company would or should do - I must say that I'm now happy as a customer. Great to compare the different performances. Great to download music and play off-line (in the middle of nowhere).

It is a very good app for music! You can listen to music in the background without so many adds for the free trial. Spotify doesn't give an add every minute. Spotify also makes reccommedations based on your personal taste so you can always find new song to your liking. It also lets you personalize your music. however, sometimes it crashes, especially on other platforms like instagrams (DMs).

The premium subscription is probably the only reason I like this app. It's barely tolerable without it, as you can't even pick a song you want to listen to without having to shuffle a playlist, and you get limited skips?? If you don't want to pay the $12 per month, just download music. With Premium? This is pretty good. Suggested music, music that youve listened to a lot so you can find it easily, and probably more I haven't yet discovered.

Used Google Play Music for years; didn't like YT Music when it switched over, so I tried Spotify. There's been some Chinese pop songs that are hard to find because their names/singers are only in Chinese (I haven't figured out how to type it in and pasting the titles doesn't seem to work???), but every English language song I have searched for I have found as well as all the K-pop I have looked up. Making playlists is easy. Overall it seems great.

I love spotify! I love listening to music when I'm mowing the lawn, at school, or just whenever. A like bass heavy songs, and the eq is perfect for that. Also I like how spotify makes playlists for you. I always look forward to listening to new songs. And I don't have to go through every artist page for new releases, they have a personal playlist for that! It's just so awesome!

10/10 would recommend, and I do all the time. As a premium member, I have access to all the music I could ever want, finding similar artists is quick and easy, and by following artists i like I get notifications about new music they release, so I can always stay up to date with ease. And if that weren't enough, it even makes "daily mixes" for me every day as a great option if I dont know what to listen to at the moment or want to mix it up a little. Hands down one of the best apps I have.

The app is really good if you have premium. It basically has every song, every artist, everything, even sleep music. The only two downsides are that if you go on another app while Spotify is playing, it stops after like 7 songs. The other is that only one person can listen at a time, which is pretty dumb if you're paying for premium.

I only wish there was an option to see a database of sorts where we see, by the numbers, who we listen to the most each month. The "[year] wrapped" events show that what we listen to is already tracked somewhere, so I don't understand why this can't be a thing. Instead, I have to use third party apps which is unfortunate cause it doesn't log anything before you get the app. Still an amazing app üò´

Through and through, great app. Best option for music out of the other music apps we have available to us. A cheap premium service that allows me to not have ads and listen to my tunes anywhere...but dear spotify headquarters,creators,workers,etc. You know your little genre selection feature in the liked songs area.I have many genres, but I can't scroll to select the other genres. I haven't a clue if it's my phone or if it's just a system thing that won't work right, but I thought I'd tell ya.

I prefer the premium subscription and am happy to do it. I love that the reccomend new artists for me to check out. Ive lost my whole music library more than once. It is expensive as well as tideous to replace, if I can even remember all of it. With Spotify I don't have to worry about that. The music that I've downloaded or have added to my library via "liked songs" or just saving is always there. If I do remeber something, an album or an artist , I just have to search n there it is....

I'd totally recommend but only if you get premium. Spotify so far is the only music streaming app that I've found ALL the artists I listen to, including foreign ones and being able to make playlists and label them has been amazing. My only issue is, Spotify is only good if you get premium. The constant ads and not being able to choose songs is honestly annoying and ruins the experience, so if you're able to spend the extra bucks, I'd 10/10 recommend. If not, this isn't your app.

I love this app, especially when I'm driving. It's so reasonable too. A lot of music in a month for the price of a CD. Easy to use and easy to navigate. Despite having Apple stuff, Spotify is the only music app for me. The only fault I have found is the suggestions and recommendations. Miles off. Old punks don't like Ariana Grande or Billie Eilish.

Cheap, easy-to-use app that offers more than any of the competition. This is the ideal place for most streaming companies. However, I wish there was an easier way to find playlists you like. YouTube lofi compilations make Spotify feel a bit difficult, and the current AI-powered playlists can capture moods but not events ("coding lofi", "workout music", etc).

Good music finding platform and I love that it is cross-platform compatible. I use Spotify on my Tablet and PC, and all the playlists and music I save, like, etc is synced between one another. Very easy to find the music you want to listen to and I love that I can listen to whole albums from artists that I didn't even know all too well before. Spotify has a radio section and if you are familiar with Pandora, it is basically the same thing. Only difference is, that Spotify has just slightly less audio quality than Pandora does, but I'm not knocking off a 5-star to 4 for that. Good app, good job Spotify team.

Always a skeptic, I was reluctant to try spotify. Over the years I've tried several other "music" apps that left me disappointed and unfulfilled. Not so with this one. Not only are my favorite tracks ready and waiting anytime I want, but their algorithms seem to pull up just what I'm looking for when I need something new. "spot" on!

I've had premium for a couple years now. This may sound a little lame, but the structure of the site helped me reconnect with music. It's very easy for us older people, especially musicians, to get stuck in a rut and become pretty jaded about what is, what was, and what should be. We sometimes get locked into "our" music, dismissing anything new, but bored with what had basically been the "soundtrack" of our lives. Get premium. Reconnect. There's so much new stuff that's really fantastic.

I could give this app an 11 for how amazing it is! Love it like hell and trust me here if you are downloading it now. I totally forgot to rate it (my badüòÖ) and I've used it for nearly 3 and a half years, now it asks me to rate it! It's just so good and even the ads that come in between aren't trashy and wordy and long. You can skip them with Spotify Premium and also just wait. If you listen carefully, you'll definitely find the ads funny! Can't describe this in words. Speechless! ü•∞‚ù§üñ§

This app has been the greatest music platform I have used. It allows you to search by specific artist, song, or album as well as listen to playlists or radio stations. You can make your own playlist or listen to one already made which is my favorite part. I use this for work everyday as we have a wide array of music preferences and this platform is the only one that accommodates everyone. I have recommended to 3 different friends and they love it.

I just LOVE Spotify! I love the daily mixes it has for me on all types of genres I enjoy listening to. They make searching for ANY type of music or sound easy and fun. I get to create different play list and download music onto it so I can listen off line. which makes it perfect for our road trips. I don't go a day without listening to my favorite tunes. But I do wish they had a sleep mode. Other than that, I TOTALLY RECOMMEND this app!!

My go-to music app for sleeping/gaming/working to have on in the background or if I find a specific song that I want to listen to and make playlists with. The ads are sparse enough that it doesn't bother me to the point of deleting it or feeling forced into buying premium and the music selection is great. Only thing I'd say it's lacking is it doesn't have all the obscure stuff like YouTube has but that's not worth taking off a star. Definitely worthy of 5.

I've had a subscription for many years now and while I sometimes think that paying for music sucks a fat one I really do enjoy having access to all of my favourite tunes. Spotify also provides a listen to or just for you which shoe cases music of similar interest. I've been able to listen to new music I may not of been able to plus it allows me to search those long time hits as well as new ones.

I don't review anything because frankly it's not worth my time. However, Spotify is the one constant I've had for 3 years now that has never let me down. It has huge amounts of artists and songs the algorithm for suggesting new music always blows me away I find a song I will love for years almost every week. I'm not a casual user and I can't speak for occasional use but if you spend all day listening to music you need this app

This entire time I thought Spotify was just another Pandora clone. I don't remember the specific deal, but the paid version was offered to me for free, so I thought 'why not???' Man am I glad I tried it! Spotify offers features which are multiple tiers above what Pandora does. If I'm paying, I'll skip as many of the songs the robot picks as I want. Artist pages, albums, genre, download the songs for offline, listen to whichever specific song you like whenever you like. I'm keeping it.

I have anxiety and music helps so much. Music helps me think and concentrate. I listen to music whenever I can. That means as long as I have service. I dont have premium, but I really should considering that I listen to music almost 24/7. I would if I could. I still love spotify with all the ads. There's not that many to be honest. I've had Spotify for many years now. I love this app.

Spotify is my absolute favorite app and service in general, I use it more than I use any app (including the phone and texting app). Im writing this review because I actually have noticed a problem with the new update, since this update, when I tap on albums or artists it often takes from a couple seconds to 7 seconds to actually load, it freezes. Its not my internet because it happens with other wifis and when using data, it didnt do this before. I'd appreciate it if this was fixed. Thanks :)

Before Spotify, I had no taste in music. I thought music in general was getting worse because I didn't like the music on the radio. I still remember freshman year when I got Spotify for Christmas and became a massive Rolling Stones fan, and I discovered a lot of other bands and musicians from the app's algorithm (it's not too niche, which is nice! Thanks for recommending me Television's Marquee Moon!) I love the playlist feature and I've made about 35 playlists. Thx for adding King Crimson!

Must admit first time user and I'm not hi-tech at all and it was so easy to use. Plus set up is a breeze! U have to ‚úî it out... Plus I picked up this mini wireless speaker and let me tell u that it is like being in a nightclub: more to the point: listening to the music and then having me choose to customize my very own individual play list...please. I'm amazed at how much I've been missing. So thank you for the musical enjoyment. Love having the concerts on my deck, Spotify! Really a class act!

I love Spotify. My favorite thing about it is how it allows me to create playlists and share them with my friends and even collaborate. Lately however, I don't know what's going on with the android app. Shuffle doesn't work properly at all with my playlists like it used to. It always plays the same few songs in almost the exact same order. I'd like to hear a better mixture of songs. I don't have premium, but it used to work better before. But other than that, Spotify is awesome.

I would be lost without my beloved Spotify, it is definitely worth the upgrade and it's even better since I can bundle my hulu with it. The only things that bother me are that for some artists, not all of their albums are listed or they get removed, or will be missing songs. I also do not like how they have a cap on how many songs you can have per device when you are paying for the premium subscription. I personally think it should be unlimited if you are paying for the service. Other than those things, I love the daily mix playlists and other playlists offered by both other users and Spotify themselves. I have found their customer service to be incredibly helpful and responsive the few times I have had issues or concerns and will happily continue my premium subscription. You guys rock and I would be lost without my daily Spotify rock out sessions!

Really good music app, mainly because it's hard to screw up a music app. But I've seen it happen. Spotify is a great app for just sitting back on any kind of day with nothing much to do, it's even great for the days where you're crammed with stuff to do. Reason being, it has a huge selection of music for any and all ocassions, such as stress relief, and falling asleep. Premium however is a nice luxury but it isn't worth the $10 a month unless you make more than $16 an hour. But despite saying it isn't worth it, I still signed up for it because it offers a great freedom of choice. I recommend this to anyone and everyone. If premium were maybe five dollars cheaper I'd recommend premium, but as of now this review is geared towards the standard app.

This app is just so great, I dont really giving reviews, but this app is just essential to me. There not one song or genre you can not find in Spotify. I can even listen to French, Spanish and Russian artist. I always get the premium membership, but even without it, I would choose it over Pandora any day (which I'm not say is a bad app) plus it pays attention to what you listen to and makes playlists for you which is such a huge plus for me! So efficient and easy to use. Cant ever go with out it !

It's just amazing. The layout it's clean and simple, but it isn't makeshift, which makes the difference between other apps. The download option it's good, but sometimes it randomly disappear, and it always happens when I'm w/out internet, lol. Back then when I blocked my phone the app was still ok, and I could jump to another song, pause and etc whatever time I wanted, but now this option isn't working. It's quite annoying blocking and opening my phone every time, hope this get better soon :)

I was (na√Øvely) using youtube music premium to explore my musical tastes, and got frustrated when I had to cancel that membership and the app lost almost all its features. I thought my friends recommending Spotify were exagerrating that it was infinitely better than YT Music, but decided to try it after getting fed up with it. Turns out, Spotify is awesome as hell. I can play it while writing this review without having to give it my credit card.

Honestly worth the premium membership. Great quality music, an amazing library at your disposal, and a very responsive and well built app. You can download entire playlists and listen to any of those songs even when offline. Suggested music is based on what you listen so it gets repetitive, but if you browse through the app you can find new music very easily. Great service!

Absolutely worth your time and money, have had a subscription for years now. Spotify is always my go-to for music, being able to base music stations off artists or a songs and not have the same songs repeat and repeat like another app is definitely something you will appreciate. Also their app itself is top notch and is always being updated to keep making it better. The amount of artists, songs, and playlists created by both Spotify and people like you and I is neverending. There is a playlist for every type of mood, feeling, or situation you can really think of. I'll be staying a fan and customer for as long as they're around, the length of this review should speak for itself. Thanks for being awesome everyone at Spotify, you evolved the way music reaches our lives, keep it up!

Best music app ever, only problem with it is that some songs don't appear at all, or in the profile of the artists (u only get to see the most popular songs but youll have to find the others by typing the title). But in general is very good, practical, easy to use and has allowed me to discover new music (radio mode is pretty cool), which makes it the kind of app that once you try you cannot live without.

Edit: they made driving mode optional! I really loved this app til the newest update and the "driving" interface showed up. Now I can't do ANYTHING while connected to my car. Can't scrub through songs, can't see album art, and can't swipe to change songs. Now I have to aim for big buttons and all I get to see are song and artist names.

I only wish I had had this kind of access to music many years ago, some of the albums I have I would never have thought I could get, having such a range of music on a device is brilliant, and the possibility of downloading, and the ability to easily leave the contract if necessary, the trouble I had disconnecting from a competitors system was horrendous, not that I wish to at the moment, the obscure performers I have accessed even back to the 1930 s has been amazing !

Spotify is hands down my favorite music streaming app!!! The user interface is clean and intuitive, while providing all the options a person would want while streaming music on a mobile device. I appreciate the fact that you can keep the playlists that you make even if you don't have the premium version and that they give you multiple options of lists that are cultivated for you that you can listen to in premium (no shuffle or skip limit) mode. Musician bios seal the deal! WELL DONE SPOTIFY!!

I've never had any troubles with this for finding my wide variety of musical taste. The personalized feel for the suggested music is helpful. And the ability to look back at what was listened to the most over time is a nice feature. I've tried other apps for my music and I always go back to Spotify, it's also easy to share music on social media which is a nice plus.

Spotify changed my life. The way the app utilizes metrics and data to find the best music for your mood and likes is amazing. This app has introduced me to music and artists from around the world. Their collection of old school classics is beyond your imagination. I highly recommend this app for music lovers. Also u can stream your playlists offline. Can't beat that.

I love using Spotify, it makes my morning jamming in my car easy. However, I do have a question for the UI design. I have small hands, I'm right handed, and my phone is a bit bigger. If I'm only able to use one hand, the button being located on the top right corner makes it harder for me to press it. I was wondering if u can have an option for where a user can have that back button? So for people who whatever hand can have that closer in their press range? I would really appreciate this feature.

I love Spotify and have been a premium user since as long as I can remember. My only gripe is a recent bug I started noticing; if I add just one song to a playlist and then close Spotify. (Which is normally how I add anyways.) And go back later, normally to listen to the aforementioned song, it's not in the playlist. And then I have to attempt to remember what it was called (Usually I can't) to re-add it. Besides the bug I do enjoy Spotify thoroughly. And would highly recommend.
replyContent: Hey, we'd love to help get this sorted. If you haven't tried reinstalling the app yet, we'd suggest giving it a go. If that doesn't do the trick, it'd be best if you reach out to one of our support channels by heading to support.spotify.com and searching ‚ÄòContact us'.

content: **I HAVE USED PREMIUM AND FREE SERVICE** Premium is better, yes, but the free service isn't bad. Yes the ads are annoying, but you still get unlimited access to Spotify's massive library. No music service has every single song by every single artist (even some video game soundtracks aren't available, but there could be multiple reasons out of Spotify's control for that), but Spotify gets real close. I recommend Spotify for music and podcasts.

I like the app. Better than YouTube in a sense that what they reccomend for you (in my case anyway), you don't necessarily hear/find on YouTube Music! Some songs Spotify doesnt have, kind of sucks but they do what they can!!! Only issue I've had was my music wouldn't play for a little bit whether it was connected to wifi or data. Only select songs would play. Got bad to where I had to re download my tunes!!! Overall.....my main music source (thanks to Google)!

Love it. Perfect music app for anyone's preference on music. I had premium and that was great with no in-app ads and unlimited song skips. but now i just have the free version. And the free version is great also, just has very little ads every 30mins and you can only skip like 10 tracks per hour and that resets every hour of listening. Which isn't at all a big nuisance like other music apps.

Really good app for discovering many interesting bands and genres. I have found a myriad of good songs and music, not even on the paid version, mind you. I regret not trying this out earlier. The only minor complaint I have is that on the free version you can't choose a one specific song to listen if the song is not on a Daily Mix playlist, but the pros more than make up for it.

I've been using spotify since 2015. Over the years I have racked up quite a long list of liked songs. I am able to go back and look at what I used to like over the years. Spotify mobile sucks if you don't have premium due to not allowing you to choose the song you want. You also are not aloud to download songs without premium. For those reasons I have had premium for years now. It's easy to use, manage, and control. Would definitely recommend if you are willing to buy premium.

10/10 app for me but it could use a few little things for me to really rate it 11/10 I like the idea and it works almost perfectly. When I'm in another app with the music playing, it will stop when there's an ad and it's so annoying. I don't really mind the ads themselves but it stopping because I have to get out of the game and click play and then still listen to the ad.

Love the fact that they dont try to play all the cheap version of your favorite songs (live, with poor sound quality and the audience singing half the song, or "tribute to/in the style of"..... like other music services.... and you get to pick the specific songs you want to hear. Offline mode is awesome if you go camping/boating, or otherwise travel, or have mobile data limit.

Best music streaming app for those wanting to discover new music. Unlike other apps, Spotify contains a selection of songs that are not well known. I'm an indie music lover, so I appreciate the large selection of songs from artists most people don't know of. My only complaint would be that premium is a little overpriced considering that the music quality is not the best it can be (like how Tidal offers Hi-fi audio). Other than that, this is the best app for listening to new music.

this app is great. instead of shuffling the playlist why can't you put the most listened songs in your playlist first. But, you can still shuffle them, just from most listened and should switch up. For instance, if Don't Cry was first, then the next time you hear Spotify it should be legends ( and yes, these are songs that i like and dont skip the song when I listen to them)

It's okay, the shuffle doesn't play all songs in the playlist, if we have to listen to ads I'd st least like to choose my song every now and then maybe a certain limit a day of chosing your song choice would be nice. That's about it besides that it's a pretty good app and would definitely recommend, I don't have premium, but when I did the app felt perfect, so you might want to consider getting that to avoid slight annoyances! I give 5 star performance with premium.

this is by far one of the best apps you can get for music. Spotify has never let me down with their app. I most definetly suggest buying their music. its very cheap and useful. I suggest it over pandora and apple music. you pick a song, Spotify has it. i especially like how it gives you live uupdates to new music coming out. it shows all the latest trends including hip hop, country, rock and more. you can create a playlist which is especially useful if you like a song.

spotify is a great app for music, they have almost every song and artist on here, there might be a few that's not but other than that there ain't nothing wrong with it. and it's even more convenient if you pay for premium cause you can select the song you wanna hear first and so forth and you can even download the songs so when you're offline you can still listen to your music on spotify.

I've finally switched to Spotify after using a different music app for years. Spotify is amazing. The library is vast. The interface is extremely user friendly and seemless when switching between PC and moblie. The playlists are great, especially the Weekly Discover. My hobbies take me out of cell service frequently, so go straight for the premium service and download your favorite playlists and albums so you have them with you all the time. My only regret is that I didn't switch years ago.

You can add songs to your library but you can also make Playlists and (on desktop) folders of playlists. And you can shuffle play those folders. You can control the music on any device that has your Spotify open, you can Google cast, there is a radio for each song and every artist. Same for podcasts. And Spotify makes a lot of automated Playlists that change daily just for you. Basically, there is a lot of functionality to explore with Spotify.

This music app has all the music I like and when you enter a artist or bands it seems to play slot of that particular artist/groups music and it seems to stick top that certain type of music!! Some to use and is free!!! I like that if you just choose to watch a video on the 30 minute intervals it allows you to listen to your music add free for 30 minutes, and it keeps allowing you to watch short commercials so you can have that as free option without having to pay for the service!!!üíãüòòüòòüòò

It's easy to find who you want to listen to, make playlists and your personalized radio off of that playlist, and discover artists you never knew you'd love so much! They also offer their own playlists based on moods, events, etc! Have great podcasts to listen to (including the Ellen Show :D). Spotify is vast and diverse so it can seem overwhelming, but they organize it in a simple way so everyone can use the app with ease. Premium is even better, as it removes ads and gives unlimited skips!

I gave a really.....aggressive review as a result of one of the previous versions of this app. reluctantly I went back to use Spotify recently to be pleasantly surprised that everything that irked me to the core about this app was taken away. I listen to a specific song when I click on it and its easier to maneuver the app. I was extremely frustrated when I was trying to listen to music before won here. the update made this my #1 app for listening to music, now. 5 stars!

I love spotify. Especially with student premium. Sometimes there are glitches with my echo dot but they're usually worked out if I close the app and reopen. It also continued to try to update but would never make any progess (would be stuck on 0%). I would have to open and close app to get rid of this as well. Finally after deleting and reinstalling the app, the issue appears to be gone.

Overall a great program. customer service has always been great, the few issues I've had over the years have always been addressed quickly and successfully. I've been a user since 2012. I do pay for the premium because the incessant ads for the free version drive me crazy. So I would say 5 stars for premium, 3 stars for the free version. Forr me this is a daily, essential program.

Love this so much more than pandora or iHeart Radio. Not only can you bring up playlists, albums, artists and songs, you get radios based on those. Plus it tracks your music taste and gives you a discover playlist filled with songs you'll probably enjoy and that you haven't listened to yet. The only thing I wish there was is an alarm setting, because I would love to make up to music rather than a ringtone.
Great app to stream music, etc.

I have been using Spotify for years now since I have compared to rhapsody and music unlimited (before sony cancelled it) among others and this is one I enjoy using the most. Music loads as if you're listening to a gapless album. Love the cross-fade and the quality. I even got my whole family to join Spotify since they were always wondering I had so much music on my phone. I felt like a spoke person for Spotify for a while. Now since it is also a part of PlayStation it's even better now. Play music and game!

I've been using it at work and I'm loving the whole program! Update: I've been using the app since mid-2018 and I still LOVE it! I have a playlist for almost every part of my day (and night) and each one grows by the week... there's only been maybe a dozen songs I have not been able to find, but thousands more that even have a couple of different versions! I HIGHLY recommend this app!!

Spotify is THE best music service, if you don't have it, get it. Do yourself a favor and spend the money to get the premium plan, it's worth every penny. I don't understand people who use a different music app, they clearly don't know what they're missing. I do think it would be cool for Spotify to add music videos for users to watch if they wanted? Idk if that would change the point of spotify's services or if it's something they have debated but it would be a cool feature.

Last Update: For the n-th time, my offline albums is undetected on my SD card EVERYTIME there's a software update or another device (which is already registered!) is detected from another running device. Spotify, this is embarassing. Offline use is the primary reason why we pay premium and you can't get this right? Don't be surprised if I unsubscribe soon. [Update Aug 2021] Love the "bell" button that streamlines the updates of music and podcasts!
